tags: ['地方發展與永續農業微學程', '全球研究學分學程', '國際素養微學程']
syllabus: This course is designed to offer an interdisciplinary framework for understanding inter-state politics in the age of globalization, using the most advanced “global politics approach”. It highlights the roles of a wide range of state, quasi-state, and non-state actors in shaping the inter-state politics in the contemporary world.
objectives: Students who successfully undertake this course will:•	Develop the conceptual and theoretical frameworks essential for interpreting inter-state politics in the contemporary world;•	Understand the roles of state, quasi-state, and non-state actors in shaping inter-state politics in the contemporary world; and•	Identify the key challenges that shape inter-state politics in the contemporary world.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1668&Crsname=文化地景專題: 遺產化的政治經濟學
name:
文化地景專題: 遺產化的政治經濟學
TOPICS IN EAST ASIAN CITIES: CULTURAL ECONOMY AND CULTURAL GOVERNANCE
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與社科院CSS151課程併班上課
tags: ['原民文化探索及永續發展學程', '智慧城市與智慧運輸學程', '都市文化與地景微學程']
syllabus: 本課程從批判遺產研究取徑探討當代文化遺產保存中的政治與經濟過程，意即在本課程中，我們將文化遺產保存視為是一個由多組行動者、組織、制度相互介入的動態過程，並稱之為「遺產化」。「遺產化」涉及到權力、資本、文化的生產、分配，是一個持續變動的社會-空間過程。本課程從文化地景的取徑作為切入視角，將地景視作是視覺化、空間化下的日常生活實踐，著重在這些實踐的時間、空間面向如何在保存政治中與人們的日常生活產生關聯。
objectives: 本課程在學期初會介紹遺產化的理論意義，並在整學期中以臺灣與其他東亞地區的文化遺產個案作為課堂主要講授教材，帶領同學討論遺產化、保存計畫下的社會空間過程，並以屏東霧台鄉魯凱族部落作為本課程的重點個案，並在期末舉行相關議題的分組課堂報告。

跨院通識與醫學院MED144課程併班上課
tags: ['基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: 1.	人類醫療之起源與中古時代以前之疫病、醫療與醫學面貌2.	人本、理性與科學，近代西方醫學之發展與成形3.	醫學教育之演變與醫療體系之進展4.	重要醫學史專題個論5.	醫學人文精神之啟蒙與醫學倫理之建立6.	學生分組專題報告與討論7.	現代醫學之重大變遷、蓬勃發展與未來展望入
objectives: 本課程從時代發展之通論及主題探討之專論兩方面，引領學生認識現代主流醫學之源起與發展脈絡、醫療於人類歷史中扮演之角色及影響，從而鑒往知來，並瞭解醫學與人群、社會之關係和互動，奠定醫學人文素養之基礎。

name:
基礎生物學
ASIC CONCEPTS OF BIOLOGY
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED101課程併班上課
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 屬專業基礎課程,提供各院學生, 生物學基礎內容:1.生物學基礎2.細胞的基本架構3.生物化學基礎: 能量及代謝4.基因訊息, 蛋白質功能5.基因表現及基因工程、基因轉殖生物、複製生物技術6.發育、遺傳學及演化7.生物的多樣性、 環境與生態
objectives: 使學生能了解生命的基本原理與現象,並提供足供將來較深入課程基礎知識, 及本領域之現代應用原理及展望

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1909&Crsname=環境健康大數據資料分析暨視覺化實務
name:
環境健康大數據資料分析暨視覺化實務
ENVIRONMENTAL AND HEALTHY BIG DATA ANALYSIS WITH VISUALISED PRACTICE
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED145課程併班上課
※英語授課
tags: ['科技與環境英語微學程']
syllabus: 學習使用SPSS統計分析軟體及QGIS地理資訊系統將呈現地圖視覺化分析軟體，培養正確呈現數據、以圖表生動表達的素養，增強量化研究及風險溝通的能力。本課程首先介紹國內外大型暴露風險與健康資料庫，以及運用次級健康資料從事研究常用之研究方法與概念；其後，介紹資料處理以及次級資料常用統計分析方法應用實務。進入實務課程後，每堂課有一個主題，教師於課堂講授後；同學當場於課堂上演練習題，並繳交課後作業。以真實數據實例進行練習及分析應用與結果圖表呈現並報告討論。資料分析實務課程所使用的範本資料庫，以環保署環境量測數據與衛生福利資料科學中心模擬數據檔為主。期末會進行課堂上機測驗，以測試學生是否習得資料分析之能力。1. Recognize and evaluate potential health risks from the nature environment, man-made hazardous materials, and social/cultural environments.2. Describe the basic idea of GIS“Geographic Information System” perspectives and practice the software with the database of environmental and health issues.3. Apply a computer system for capturing, storing, checking, and displaying data related to positions on Earth’s surface.
objectives: 本課程的目標，是協助對於運用環境/健康/疾病大數據資料研究有興趣；但無實作經驗之學生，建立運用次級資料從事環境流行病學研究與資料統計分析的能力。以便日後能運用SPSS統計分析軟體及QGIS地理資訊系統軟體於空間分析與醫療衛生決策與社會福利資源分配綜理的工作之中；預期修習結束，可獨立完成一篇勘發表並呈現於研討會的摘要論文/海報。This teaching will include the instructor’s lecture (emphasis on examples with environment and disease), interactive activities, and practice for students to apply their software (SPSS、QGIS).

name:
生物統計與資訊
BIOSTATISTICS AND BIOINFORMATICS?
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED146課程併班上課
tags: ['金融工程學程', '基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: 介紹生物醫學研究常用研究設計、取樣方法及資料結構、包括假說驅動(hypothesis-driven)與資料驅動(data-driven)研究之特性與注意事項。統計分析內容包括數據資料整理與敘述分析、統計推論統計及各項分布概念（常態、二項式、多項式、卜瓦松、ｔ、卡方、Ｆ分布）、無母數統計、信賴區間、平均值與比例值的比較、ROC曲線與AUC+個案數估計及迴歸模式(線性、二元、存活分析)。以生物醫學真實數據實例進行練習，及變方分析應用與SPSS軟體操作應用結果圖表呈現並報告討論。
objectives: 本課程主要目的介紹生物統計之基本概念及常用的統計檢定方法、流行病學方法論及研究設計，以及搭配統計軟體SPSS之使用與應用。預期同學能運用真實臨床醫療/健檢/環境數據，進行正確的統計檢定與資料分析並闡述結果。以便日後能運用於醫療、公共衛生決策與社會福利資源分配綜理的工作之中；預期修習結束，具備能力可獨立完成一篇勘發表並呈現於研討會的摘要論文/海報。

name:
公共衛生學
PUBLIC HEALTH?
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED147課程併班上課
tags: ['基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: 修完此課程，期望學生能夠：1.瞭解公共衛生的基本概念與重要內涵。2.瞭解台灣公共衛生的歷史與制度現況。3.瞭解公共衛生專業工作者的實踐場域。授課內容：(一)群體健康問題意識的培養 1.主題：談預防醫學的三段五級概念與疾病管理(二)群體健康問題的描述 1.主題：流行病學基本概念 2.主題：頻率計算在流行病學上的應用 3.主題：公共衛生監測 4.主題：疾病爆發流行調查(三)環境暨職業衛生(四)衛生行政與法規(五)健康保險(六)健康促進與衛生教育(七)公共衛生疾病防治(制)策略
objectives: 公共衛生為各科際整合學科，範疇橫跨人口學、生物統計學、流行病學、環境與職業衛生、社會與行為科學、衛生行政、醫療照護機構管理、政策法規與倫理等面向。本課程屬概論性質，旨在提供初進入公共衛生領域的學習者一個鳥瞰圖，藉由宏觀觀點，帶領學生認識公共衛生的學科定位與內容，瞭解台灣公共衛生的歷史發展與制度現況、當前重要的公衛研究與實務議題，以及公共衛生專業工作者的實踐場域。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1939&Crsname=共病時代-談人類與動物共通傳染病
name:
共病時代-談人類與動物共通傳染病
DISEASE, PLAGUE, AND CIVILIZATION
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED122課程併班上課
tags: ['基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: 人類與動物均為地球生態系中的一小部分。千萬年來，在微生物與宿主交錯演化的發展歷史中。人類的許多疾病其實與生活環境及其他生物密不可分。本課程在講動物疾病故事的同時，將協助學生認識自己，認識疾病，學習成為地球生態系的健康共同體。藉由學習共病時代之課程，增加學生對於人畜共通傳染病的了解，探討疾病發生時，對社會及個人健康造成的衝擊。藉此提高大眾對於人畜共通傳染病預防的重視與配合。最後，藉由透過人畜共通傳染病的學習，希望學生可以利用課堂上學習到的知識，嘗試創新桌遊製作，從規劃到實際遊戲，期望可以讓學生從中獲得靈感，了解學習的樂趣。
objectives: 1.以有趣的方法了解人畜共通傳染病的基本特性。2.以生活化的方式探討人畜共通傳染病的致病機轉。3.使學生瞭解相關的病毒學及細菌學知識與臨床檢驗診斷及檢驗方式。4.將此知識運用於醫學研究、疾病診斷、傳染病防治以及日常生活之中。5.提供日後從事臨床醫學、病毒學、分子分物學之研究工作或臨床工作打下良好基礎6.利用課堂上學習到的傳染病知識，進行創新桌遊製作

name:
疾病瘟疫與文明
DISEASE, PLAGUE, AND CIVILIZATION
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED123課程併班上課
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MED123.TXT課程旨在讓不同領域的學生深入瞭解疾病與人類之間的關係以及醫學歷史的故事，將以台灣史為主要介紹範圍。課程的重點是探討瘟疫對人類健康與醫學發展所帶來的影響，使學生深入了解生命的本質、特徵以及疾病的危害，同時普及疾病相關的醫學知識，提高學生對傳染性疾病的認識和自我保護能力。透過這門課程，學生可以深入了解疾病對個人和社會的影響。更進一步的了解醫學研究與對抗疾病方面的貢獻。
objectives: 1.具備微生物學的基本知識2.認識台灣歷史上的瘟疫事件3.了解疾病與人類社會及醫學發展的關聯性4.重新思考傳染病與人類社會的命運5.藉由醫學史了解疾病，學習依靠現代公共衛生技術，讓文明不再受傳染病的影響。

name:
微生物與癌症
CANCER MICROBIOLOGY
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED124課程併班上課
tags: ['基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MED124.TXT全球每年約1200萬人被確診癌症，其中大概有20%的癌症病例會被歸類於病毒或細菌感染所導致，這些病毒或細菌的感染被認為會增加罹癌風險。目前較常見因為病毒或細菌和癌症發生有關的是: B型肝炎病毒及C型肝炎病毒所引起的肝癌、人類乳突病毒（HPV）引起的子宮頸癌、人類泡疹病毒第四型（EBV）引起的Burkitt lymphoma、人類免疫缺陷病毒（HIV）引起的卡波西氏肉瘤、幽門桿菌引起的胃癌、肝吸蟲引起的膽管癌、血吸蟲引起的膀胱癌、以及第一型人類T細胞白血病病毒所引起的成人T細胞白血病等。本課程將介紹這些病毒及細菌的生子生物學和致病機轉，並且藉由期刊討論提供病毒及細菌誘導腫瘤發生的原因及潛在的治療策略。
objectives: 1.了解癌症病毒、細菌及寄生蟲的基本特性與致病機轉2.病毒和細菌與宿主細胞之基因或蛋白質調控3.微生物與免疫系統交互作用4.腫瘤內微生物菌群5.腸道菌群與癌症形成的關係6.以病毒或細菌治療癌症

name:
危老年代
AGING AND HEALTH
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED126課程併班上課
syllabus: 本課程將介紹常見的老年疾病，包括：各類型失智症、糖尿病、心血管疾病、肌肉與骨骼疾病和老年憂鬱等，透過科普文章和影片了解上述疾病的成因與發展，以期能達到更有效的預防與治療。
objectives: 1.	學生能瞭解老年人所面臨的健康危害。2.	學生能瞭解老年疾病的成因、發展、預防與治療。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1944&Crsname=危險同居「人」：漫談居家有害生物
name:
危險同居「人」：漫談居家有害生物
PESTS IN HOUSEHOLD ENVIRONMENT
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED127課程併班上課
syllabus: 居家環境是大自然中的一部份，有許多生物如蚊子、蒼蠅、蟑螂、跳蚤、塵蟎和我們同居，本課程透過主題介紹、標本採集製作與觀察等實作，逐一引導學生認識居家環境生物之生態背景、習性、相關媒介疾病，及相應的防治策略，期望藉由友善的環境管理減少居家生物的存在，來提升居家環境品質，並反思人類、居家生物與環境相互依存的永續關係。
objectives: 1.	學生能瞭解各種居家有害生物的種類。2.	學生能瞭解各種居家有害生物對人類健康的威脅，進而提升健康意識。3.	學生能建立友善、正確的居家有害生物的防治概念。

name:
環境與人類健康
ENVIRONMENT AND HUMAN HEALTH
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED128課程併班上課
syllabus: 本課程將介紹環境衛生的基本概念，並探討包括物理性的噪音和輻射、化學性的空氣、水源、廢棄物以及生物性的病媒危害等。透過本課程的介紹，學生將能了解環境中的各種刺激對人類健康的危害，從而能喚醒學生對生活環境的關懷與注意，進而凝聚共識，朝達成環境永續的終極目標。
objectives: 1.	學生能瞭解環境衛生的基本概念。2.	學生能瞭解各種環境危害與人類健康息息相關，進而提升健康意識。

name:
基礎外傷急救
BASICS OF TRAUMA CARE
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED129課程併班上課
tags: ['全民國防微學程']
syllabus: 1.外傷的分類、致病機制，人體的癒合過程。2.各類外傷現場緊急救護技巧知識及實作。3.緊急醫療救護網運作實務。
objectives: 學生能嫻熟各類外傷事故的基礎知識，同時在保護自身安全的前提下，在事故現場如何緊急救護傷者，呼叫後援單位，護送傷者抵達醫院，本課程希望能傳授學生外傷急救護理正確的技能，成為全社會全民國防的種子。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1947&Crsname=顯微鏡下的人體結構初步探索-初階人體組織
name:
顯微鏡下的人體結構初步探索-初階人體組織
PRELIMINARY EXPLORATION OF HUMAN BODY STRUCTURE UNDER MICROSCOPE – BASIC HISTOLOGY
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED130課程併班上課
tags: ['基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: 尚本課程介紹正常人體形態結構先初步 簡略介紹肉眼觀察的解剖構造後，再進入課程主要內容即微觀需以顯微鏡觀察的組織層級構造，並以線上資源或顯微鏡學習組織切片觀察。
objectives: 使學生學習判讀正常各類人體器官之組織切片。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1948&Crsname=人體生理功能解密:生理學入門
name:
人體生理功能解密:生理學入門
HUMAN BODY FUNCTIONS: BASIC PHYSIOLOGY
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED131課程併班上課
tags: ['基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: 課程主要包含下列主題:1.血液、微免&宿主2.骨骼肌肉關節3.神經及感官4.精神心理5.心血管循環&呼吸6.腸胃腎臟及泌尿生理7.內分泌&生殖8.成長老化
objectives: 使學生了解人體器官組織之生理功能

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1950&Crsname=探索藥物：現實與電影中的藥物
name:
探索藥物：現實與電影中的藥物
EXPLORING DRUGS: DRUGS IN REALITY AND IN MOVIES
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED133課程併班上課
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MED133.TXT介紹人類歷史上的重要藥物開發史，以及解析電影中曾經出現的藥物，講授藥物如何在人體產生作用與藥效。1. 介紹人類歷史上的重要藥物開發案例2. 解析電影裡曾經出現的藥物3. 藥物如何在人體產生作用與藥效
objectives: 以過去藥物開發的實例以及電影裡曾經出現的藥物為引，提升學生對新藥研發的興趣。

name:
藥物設計入門
INTRODUCTION TO DRUG DESIGN
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED134課程併班上課
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MED134.TXT由新藥研究的基本方法與藥物如何作用於體內開始，講授如何進行藥物設計，並介紹數個藥物設計主題。1.新藥研究的基本方法2.藥物作用原理3.藥物設計原理4.藥物設計主題介紹
objectives: 藉由介紹藥物設計相關知識，讓學生了解藥物的設計原理與方法。啟發學生參與新藥開發與生技製藥的興趣

name:
人類免疫與代謝
IMMUNOMETABOLISM OF HUMAN DISEASES
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED135課程併班上課
tags: ['基礎醫學數位微學程']
syllabus: 你知道免疫細胞也會碰上代謝問題嗎？免疫細胞也跟人類ㄧ樣有胃口的差異，而且免疫功能還跟他吃的東西有關。拿破倫說：軍隊靠著它的胃行進。實際上免疫系統不只是用來對抗病原菌的戰士，還肩負組織修復的工匠與清除死亡細胞的清道夫功能。本課程以淺顯例子介紹免疫代謝這個最新的研究領域，無需生物與醫學背景。讓你知道腸胃怎麼控制你的大腦，為什麼癌症這麼難治療，還有肥胖等代謝問題怎麼影響你的免疫力。
objectives: 人體90%的疾病與免疫系統失調有關。傳統醫療為控制症狀，要抑制免疫反應。免疫代謝是結合免疫學與代謝的尖端領域，本課程旨在了解免疫細胞的內在代謝與外在環境如何能被調控，與新的治療方式。將討論，肥胖，代謝症候群，瘦身藥與糖尿病。同時討論一些流行的養生方法的真假，如防彈咖啡的原理，瘦瘦筆為何讓人減重?同時我們會討論創造力，在醫療上，給我們帶來哪些常用精采發明?

name:
基因中的演化之舞
TRACING THE TANGLED TRACKS OF EVOLUTIONARY JOURNEY IN GENOME
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED137課程併班上課
syllabus: 課程將介紹「分子時鐘」（molecular clock）理論與其所帶來演化學的巨變。中性演化理論，讓我們能從基因中找到演化時間的蛛絲馬跡。利用課堂講授，與實際讓學生運用各種簡單而實用生物資訊工具（無需寫程式基礎）實際分析生物的基因或蛋白質序列，找出物種的親緣關係。(將討論，遺傳疾病診斷，犯罪鑑定，親子分析，病毒來源等應用。)
objectives: 本課程將以深入淺出的方式介紹基因中的分子時鐘，如何挑戰演化生物學的觀念。同時結合實際操作簡單的生物資訊網頁工具與軟體，讓不會寫程式的同學也能實際體驗用用資訊工具解謎的感覺。 請注意，本課程目標是分子演化，而並非教授物種演化過程與動物分類學。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1957&Crsname=展示我們的健康-醫學與博物館學
name:
展示我們的健康-醫學與博物館學
MEDICINE AND MUSEOLOGY: EXHIBITING THE HEALTH
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED140課程併班上課
syllabus: 本課程內容將透過博物館學技術介紹博物館展示如何呈現身體、健康與疾病傳達醫學與健康概念。藝術與科技發展史如何與醫學博物館結合。特別議題討論中醫與西醫的差異，以及如何具像化在博物館的展示。配合課程內容兩次校外參訪：高醫校史館及科工館。
objectives: 博物館是集結典藏、研究、教育、展示及娛樂的科學普及教育場所，本課程透過學習博物館學技術如何結合醫學及健康科學的知識、歷史、科技及藝術傳達給社會大眾。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1958&Crsname=醫學媒體識讀與生醫文獻導讀
name:
醫學媒體識讀與生醫文獻導讀
MEDICAL MEDIA LITERACY AND BIOMEDICAL LITERATURE REVIEW
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED141課程併班上課
syllabus: 本課程透過學習檢索科學期刊、閱讀生物醫學科學報告瞭解如何判讀媒體、網路及通訊軟體上的醫藥、健康相關假消息。透過練習事實查核並傳播正確知識之方法。
objectives: 網路、通訊軟體充斥各種假訊息，不乏與醫藥、健康相關假消息。本課程設計讓非醫藥主修領域學生具備查驗科學原文報告、判別事實真偽能力，得以具備良好的醫學媒體識讀素養，並能科普化導正錯誤訊息。

name:
神經心理學：大腦與情緒
NEUROPSYCHOLOGY: THE BRAIN AND EMOTIONS
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED153課程併班上課
syllabus: 本課程主旨在介紹心理學和神經科學的基礎概念，說明大腦如何調控情緒、認知、學習等功能，以及其和日常壓力、心理疾患的關係。透過探索大腦的奧秘，一窺憂鬱症、焦慮症、失智症的神經機制和臨床防治，並幫助學生應用所學，更多地認識自己、了解他人。
objectives: 本課程目標在於幫助學生1)了解心理學和神經科學中各項研究主題及方法2)了解各項認知功能的神經生理機制3)了解心理性疾患的機制和臨床防治4)應用所學以增進情緒管理和壓力因應5)應用所學以實現關懷及同理他人的理念

name:
癌症治療
CANCER THERAPEUTICS
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED154課程併班上課
syllabus: This course will introduce a variety of current cancer treatments, including the most traditional chemotherapy, targeted drugs, antibody drugs, as well as the latest in gene, metabolism, cell, and immunotherapies, early detection, and precision medicine, etc. It systematically introduces basic principles and applications, with content that has both breadth and depth, making it suitable for students from all fields to choose as an elective.
objectives: Cancer is the leading cause of death among the top ten worldwide, and cancer treatments are rapidly evolving. In this course, students will learn about various cancer treatments, understand the cancer formation and treatment development process, and gain a foundational and comprehensive understanding of cancer therapies. This will extend to the most cutting-edge immunotherapies, early detection, and precision medicine, with the goal of inspiring students to engage in fundamental cancer research and the applied industries related to medical treatment.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1966&Crsname=改變世界的分子：藥物的藝術與社會影響力
name:
改變世界的分子：藥物的藝術與社會影響力
THE MOLECULES THAT CHANGED THE WORLD: THE ART AND SOCIAL IMPACT OF MEDICINES
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED155課程併班上課
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MED155.TXT新物質被製造出來之後，各國的勢力消長和生活方式也跟著改變?介紹對人類歷史造成重大影響的重要藥物開發史以及相關研究。1.介紹影響人類歷史的重要藥物與相關研究2.以藥物化學與天然物化學為基礎，講述這些分子的發現過程、化學結構及其用途等3.這些藥物如何在人體產生作用與藥效
objectives: 生技製藥為現今臺灣熱門產業之一，藉由介紹對我們日常生活產生巨大影響的藥物或化學物質，啟發學生參與新藥開發與生技製藥的興趣，並可結合學生原先系所之專業以發展跨領域的新創產業。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1967&Crsname=深睡的力量：揭開睡眠與健康的面紗
name:
深睡的力量：揭開睡眠與健康的面紗
THE DEEP POWER OF SLEEP: UNDERSTANDING SLEEP AND HEALTH
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED156課程併班上課
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MED156.TXT睡眠是人類不可或缺的基本生理需求，充足的睡眠對於維持身心健康至關重要。然而，現代社會的生活節奏快，工作壓力大，多數人都有睡眠不足或睡眠品質不佳的問題。因此，此門跨院選修課程，將透過講述睡眠基礎知識、睡眠與健康、常見睡眠障礙、以及提升睡眠品質的技巧讓學生能自助助人，有能力提供給有睡眠困擾的人建議以及因應策略。本堂課將透過課室的講授、線上學習、睡眠中心參訪、專家交流、實作演練、小組討論，讓學生了解睡眠對身心健康的影響，進而重視睡眠的重要性；另外，課程將提供改善睡眠品質的實用技巧，讓學生能自助以及助人。
objectives: 一、認知目標：1.學生能夠了解睡眠的定義、分類、功能、週期與生理變化。2.學生能夠認識常見的睡眠障礙及其症狀。3.學生能夠掌握提升睡眠品質的技巧。4.學生能夠了解睡眠對身心健康的影響。二、情意目標：1.學生能夠重視睡眠的重要性。2.學生能夠養成良好的睡眠習慣。3.學生能夠正確認識睡眠障礙，並尋求適當的治療。三、技能目標：1.學生能夠根據自身情況，制定改善睡眠品質的方案。2.學生能夠運用放鬆技巧，緩解壓力，促進睡眠。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1968&Crsname=生活柯南：破解似是而非的迷思
name:
生活柯南：破解似是而非的迷思
LIVING CONAN: CRACKING THE MYTHS OF PLAUSIBILITY
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED157課程併班上課
syllabus: 本課程旨在培養學生批判性思考與資訊素養，將透過分析日常生活中的迷思與流言，學習如何提出有效問題、進行文獻檢索、閱讀並理解實證研究，最終能夠基於證據提出建議或解答。課程將結合理論學習與實務操作，通過案例分析、小組討論及研究項目，引導學生掌握關鍵技能，成為獨立思考者。
objectives: 一、讓學生了解如何從情境中形塑好問題。二、透過問題的關鍵字搜尋現存的文獻證據。三、能閱讀具實證證據文章四、能歸納統整找到的資訊給予建議或答案。

name:
與老共舞
LIVING WITH AGING: GERIATRIC CARE FOR OLDER ADULTS
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED158課程併班上課
syllabus: Older population grows dramatically worldwide. This course contained three parts which are designed to provide students 1) to understand the trend of global aging and policies on healthy ageing, 2) to enhance knowledge and advanced skill of geriatric care, 3) to assess and identify psychosocial and physiological care of the elderly, 4) Enable to integrate of geriatric care-related knowledge to develop products for older users or aging caregivers.
objectives: 1.Understand the policies on healthy ageing.2.Distinguish the differences between normal ageing and ill health.3.Identify unique health needs by current development in elderly comprehensive assessment.4.Analyze the common issues relevant to geriatric syndromes.5.Review effective strategies to geriatric care on own case scenario.6.Perform self-directed learning and continually aspire to develop products for aging users or caregivers.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAI1970&Crsname=看不見的魔力：生活中的微生物之應用
name:
看不見的魔力：生活中的微生物之應用
THE INVISIBLE MAGIC: MICROORGANISMS AND THEIR APPLICATIONS IN DAILY LIFE
description:
《講授類》
跨院通識與醫學院MED159課程併班上課
syllabus: 本課為全英語授課，程設計有三個層次，(1)首先介紹微生物特性；(2)介紹生活中各行各業中微生物的益處與害處；(3)後段課程為激發學生創造力，舉行模擬iGEM比賽，希望學生可以以所學的知識去解決實際的問題。This is an English-only course that covers three aspects of microbiology: (1) The basic features and functions of different types of microorganisms; (2) The positive and negative impacts of microorganisms on various fields and occupations in everyday life; (3) A mock iGEM contest that challenges students to apply their learned knowledge to real-world issues and propose innovative solutions.
objectives: 以英語介紹微生物的特性與培養條件，之後帶領同學用實物或影片認識食衣住行中有微生物參與的部分。並由同學應用所學，發展一個專案，應用微生物的特性，解決一個生活問題。訓練學生以英語接收資訊，整理資訊，並以口說，小組討論，筆記等方式，練習溝通統整。Introduce the characteristics and cultural conditions of microorganisms in English, and then lead the students to recognize the parts of food, clothing, housing, and transportation that involve microorganisms using real objects or videos. And let the students apply what they have learned to develop a project that uses the characteristics of microorganisms to solve a life problem. Train students to receive information in English, organize information, and practice communication and integration through speaking, group discussion, note-taking, and other methods.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAIE600&Crsname=透過實用性英語增進溝通能力（中級）
name:
透過實用性英語增進溝通能力（中級）
IMPROVING COMMUNICATION SKILLS THROUGH FUNCTIONAL ENGLISH(INTERMEDIATE LEVEL)
description:
《講授類》
限非外文系。建議英文程度『中級』以上程度學生修習選課。本課程為優先選修課程，依選課須知規定，優先條件為第一篩選順序，志願序或點數加選為次要篩選順序。優先條件順序:(1)全英語學士專班(分組/班)學生。(2)其他學士班學生。 
※英語授課
tags: ['實用英語跨域學程', '全英語通識教育菁英學程']
syllabus: This course is task-based and project-based and actively engages students in the cooperative learning process. Through an array of functional English applied to real-world tasks, the course aims to build students' English communication skills in speaking and writing in academic, social, and professional contexts. The class consists of two components: the first two hours are instructor's lectures and class interactive activities, and the third hour adheres to Si Wan College's English Table activity for each class session. Students need to participate in both components to receive full credit for each class. This course is required for the EMI General Education Honors Program and the Practical English Cross-Disciplinary Program.
objectives: To improve students' English language skills through tasks, projects, and interactiveactivities.To help students develop communication skills in English for professional interaction,thereby enhancing their employability.To assist students in communicating in the target language with fluency and confidence.To enhance students' sociolinguistic competence.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GEAIE605&Crsname=通過體驗式學習自信地說英語（中級）
name:
通過體驗式學習自信地說英語（中級）
SPEAKING ENGLISH WITH CONFIDENCE THROUGH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING(INTERMEDIATE LEVEL)
description:
《講授類》
限非外文系。建議英文程度『中級』以上程度學生修習選課。本課程為優先選修課程，依選課須知規定，優先條件為第一篩選順序，志願序或點數加選為次要篩選順序。優先條件順序:(1)全英語學士專班(分組/班)學生。(2)其他學士班學生。
※英語授課
tags: ['實用英語跨域學程']
syllabus: This course is designed to help students develop their speaking skills in English with a focus on fluency, clear communication, and confidence. This course is experience-based, task-based, and project-based, aimed at actively engaging students in the cooperative learning process.Through a variety of interactive activities, including discussions, presentations, debates, role-playing, and content creation, students will practice and improve their spoken English while engaging a learning cycle moving through experience, reflection, and action. The course also includes strategies for overcoming common challenges in speaking English in different informal and formal environments.Note: This course heavily builds upon active participation as key to successfully building English speaking skills. We provide a variety of fun and interactive environments to practice English conversation and presentation skills, guiding you through each step. A willingness to improve your English is expected and rewarded.Note, as well: We may adjust the syllabus schedule based on student needs and availability of resources for course activities.
objectives: 1.To assist students to acquire skills in functioning cooperatively and creatively in projects and tasks.2.To assist students to become skillful at expressing themselves and demonstrating theirpersonalities, preferences, and thoughts in the target language.3.To instruct students on effective ways of communicating and interacting well with others.4.To assist students to develop grammatical control for language accuracy.5.To have fun using English to communicate and interact with each other.

name:
成功的英文寫作（中級）
WRITING FOR SUCCESS IN ENGLISH(INTERMEDIATE LEVEL)
description:
《講授類》
限非外文系。建議英文程度『中級』以上程度學生修習選課。本課程為優先選修課程，依選課須知規定，優先條件為第一篩選順序，志願序或點數加選為次要篩選順序。優先條件順序:(1)全英語學士專班(分組/班)學生。(2)其他學士班學生。
syllabus: This course introduces students to the basics of writing and composing in English. Guided, structured writing activities interweave with freer, multi-drafted composing activities, aimed at providing students with ample opportunities to develop and practice writing skills. Students will be involved in the learning process through listening, reading, writing, rewriting, revising, and editing to experience the writing process and ultimately, write more, better, and with confidence.
objectives: At the end of the course students will:1.Learn and apply general strategies to complete reading and writing assignments efficiently and effectively.2.Improve oral skills through active participation in interactive activities.3.Acquire skill in developing paragraph structure.4.Become competent in portfolio building.

name:
英文寫作（中級）
FUNDAMENTALS OF ENGLISH COMPOSITION（INTERMEDIATE LEVEL）
description:
《講授類》
限非外文系。建議英文程度『中級』以上程度學生修習選課。本課程為優先選修課程，依選課須知規定，優先條件為第一篩選順序，志願序或點數加選為次要篩選順序。優先條件順序:(1)全英語學士專班(分組/班)學生。(2)其他學士班學生。
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\GEAIE611.TXTThis course is designed to help students develop their basic academic writing skills in English. The course covers the basics of grammar, punctuation, sentence structure, paragraph development, and essay writing. Through a variety of writing assignments and exercises, students will develop their ability to express themselves clearly and effectively in written English.
objectives: The purpose of this course is to teach students how to identify basic elements and types of paragraphs. We will take a process writing approach, involving students in brainstorming, planning, data-collecting, outlining and drafting with teacher and other peers’ in-class support. We will also develop reading and note-taking skills in order to write clear and structured paragraphs.By the end of this course, students are expected to meet the following objectives:1. understand common rhetoric modes in English writing.2. improve sentence structure and paragraph development skills.3. demonstrate basic knowledge about descriptive, comparison, and cause-effect writing tasks.4. develop the ability to write a clear thesis statement, topic sentences, and supporting sentences5. develop the ability to brainstorm, draft, revise, and edit effectively.6. learn how to organize and present ideas logically and coherently.7. develop critical thinking skills through reading and writing activities.8. be able to edit and proofread their own and their peers’ writing.

tags: ['實用英語跨域學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\GEAIE702.TXTThis course is designed for upper intermediate level students to develop their language skills in preparing and giving a clear, well-organized presentation. The course aims to enhance students’ oral communication and PPT presentation skills. It focuses on developing students’ communication skills that will give them the confidence to present their experiences, knowledge, ideas, and opinions. The course follows a process approach that emphasizes the step-by-step decisions and tasks that are involved in planning, composing, and delivering an effective presentation. Students will explore different topics, learn related vocabulary, and develop skills in structuring and delivering formal presentations that express an opinion or point of view. Students will practice presenting in groups first and then individually as the course progresses and their confidence improves.
objectives: Upon completing this course, students are expected to achieve the following goals:1. Become familiar with presentation techniques and strategies on how to give effective presentations on a range of topics in a variety of situations.2. Improve their overall English oral proficiency and communicative competence.3. Foster their confidence in oral expression and in delivering formal presentations.

name:
演說與辯論（高級）
PUBLIC SPEECH AND DEBATE（ADVANCED LEVEL）
description:
《講授類》

※英語授課
tags: ['實用英語跨域學程']
syllabus: This course offers rigorous training designed to equip students with the tools, techniques, and confidence needed to excel in diverse communication scenarios. It is not an easy course, as it demands commitment and active participation. The focus will be on public presentation and speech, rather than debate, considering the diverse backgrounds and varying English proficiency levels of the students. Through weekly practice, this course aims to cultivate mastery in the art of effective public speaking and dynamic presentation skills. The primary goal is to empower students to deliver impactful speeches and presentations with clarity, authenticity, and influence. This course will also help students build self-assurance, enabling them to express their thoughts with conviction, connect with audiences, and leave a lasting impression. The grading criteria and grade conversion for this course will align with the guidelines outlined in the 國立中山大學學生成績作業要點 document, available on the university's website.重要規定：根據學校規定，自112學年起入學的新生只能修讀中高級的跨院EAP/ESP課程。具體規定如下：大一新生需(1)先修習通識英文，(2)再修習跨院EAP/ESP課程，(3)且需在不同學期逐級修讀，順序不得顛倒。此外，現有的中級EAP/ESP課程是為舊學年法規適用的大二、大三及大四學生開設的，112學年起入學的新生僅能修讀中高級的跨院EAP/ESP課程。因此，尚未符合以上規定的同學請儘快換課。第一次加退選時間為9月12日至9月13日。如有任何問題，請學生聯繫全英語卓越教學中心。
objectives: The primary objective of this course is to empower students with the proficiency and self-assurance to deliver impactful speeches and presentations. Specifically, the course aims to cultivate the students’ ability to craft compelling narratives, deploying appropriate delivery strategies by adopting effective rhetorical techniques and literary devices. By exploring the intricacies of both verbal and nonverbal communication skills, students will develop a profound understanding of the symbiotic relationship between the speaker and the audience, enabling them to become persuasive speakers who engage listeners through interactive techniques and audi-ence-focused approaches. By the end of the semester, students in this course will be expected to confidently command attention, evoke emotions, and influence opinions across diverse con-texts.

name:
21 世紀影響力寫作技巧（中高級）
WRITING FOR IMPACT IN THE 21ST CENTURY (HIGH-INTERMEDIATE LEVEL)
description:
《講授類》
限非外文系。建議英文程度『中高級』以上程度學生修習選課。本課程為優先選修課程，依選課須知規定，優先條件為第一篩選順序，志願序或點數加選為次要篩選順序。優先條件順序:(1)全英語學士專班(分組/班)學生。(2)其他學士班學生。
syllabus: This is a course in 21st century journalism. Students will learn to interpret and evaluate the world around them and organize content into meaningful texts according to a given purpose. The digital compositions they write will be factually based and written to either inform or persuade an audience. Four genres will receive our attention: hard copy news stories (press release), exposés, publicity stories (poster), and persuasive short stories.
objectives: Reading and writing are the main academic skills in focus for this course. First, through the analysis of various digital genres, students will understand how information is organized and composed in journalistic texts (“overview”). After consulting with the instructor, students will then compose their own copy, and receive feedback from both the instructor and classmates. Students will also learn how to construct interview questions and plan for interviews. The stories they compose will be published on their own individual websites (the focus of Week 1).

objectives: Analyze the expression, feelings, and actions in the music, learn the style of music, and lead students to deeply appreciate the unique artistic characteristics of the music from multiple perspectives.Through the explanation and group discussion, and the understanding of multiple perspectives, students are guided into the richness of life in music, and through this experience, they can build the experience and application of English vocabulary.

※英語授課
tags: ['實用英語跨域學程', '全英語通識教育菁英學程']
syllabus: This course aims to increase awareness and appreciation of diversity within the contemporary context. Students will explore their inherited and constructed traditions while learning from the experiences and perspectives of others. Through lectures, interactive discussions, reflection, research, and presentations, students will develop language skills, empathy, and cross-cultural competence, and become conscientious of their role as citizens in an increasingly diverse global society. The course will consist of two components: The first two hours are instructor's lectures and classroom interactive activities, and the third hour adheres to English Table for thematic discussion. Students are required to participate in both components to receive full credit for each class. This course is a requirement for the EMI General Education Honors Program and the Practical English Cross-Disciplinary Program.
objectives: 1. To assist students in developing their cultural self-awareness and explore their inheritedand constructed traditions and significant life experiences.2. To provide students with opportunities to be involved in culturally enriching activities togain knowledge and acquire communication skills.3. To discuss, compare, and contrast the experiences and contributions of diverse groupsthat shape global culture.4. To develop students’ research and presentation skills.

name:
美國文化（高級）
AMERICAN CULTURE（ADVANCED LEVEL）
description:
《講授類》
限非外文系。建議英文程度『高級』以上程度學生修習選課。本課程為優先選修課程，依選課須知規定，優先條件為第一篩選順序，志願序或點數加選為次要篩選順序。優先條件順序:(1)全英語學士專班(分組/班)學生。(2)其他學士班學生。
syllabus: Course Goals and Objectives:This course delves into the diverse literary forms and cultural aspects that have shaped the United States of America. It aims to familiarize students with a wide range of texts, including critical essays, short stories, memoirs, novels, video clips, and films, while exploring key themes in American literature and culture from 1865 to the present, including the impact of digital culture and the contemporary political climate.
objectives: Throughout the semester, we will engage in a series of fundamental questions that examine the essence of America and what it means to identify as an American. Additionally, we will explore the relevance of the reading materials to our lives in Taiwan. The course explores various thought-provoking topics, such as cognitive poetics, positive psychology, ecology, hybridity, refugee experiences, New Age religion, transracial/national adoption, trauma, embodiment, and disability. We will also analyze "post-" terms like post-ideology, post-race, post-truth, and post-humanism while considering the intricate interplay between contemporary beliefs, global capitalism, and subjectivity/consciousness.We will ponder over the belief systems that arise from and align with contemporary global capitalism, as well as explore how subjectivity is defined within the context of these beliefs and the disciplinary powers of global capitalism. A broader perspective on the American experience will lead us to address pressing questions about contemporary life, such as the evolving face of American culture after the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. We will examine the epistemological and ontological underpinnings of subjectivity for various individuals, including the neuronal self, New Agers, and those who have experienced trauma, discrimination, or mental/physical disabilities. Moreover, as cross‐racial/cultural interactions flourish, we will explore the concept of loving “the other” as oneself and examine the potential for a meaningful social bond.

description:
《講授類》

tags: ['實用英語跨域學程']
syllabus: This course explores cultural sensitivity, communication skills, and global etiquette. Students delve into cross-cultural communication, business etiquette, and social customs worldwide. Navigating protocol in various settings, travel challenges, and diplomatic skills are emphasized, fostering inclusive communication. Engaging methodologies include lectures, guest speakers, role-playing, case studies, group projects, and reflective writing.
objectives: 1. Significance of International Etiquette:a)	Understand the role of international etiquette in daily life and social interactions within the global community.b)	Acknowledge its roots in Western traditions while embracing local customs and protocols when navigating different cultures.2. Importance of International Etiquette:a)	Recognize the growing relevance of international etiquette due to increased global travel.b)	Appreciate its role in preventing misunderstandings and preserving personal and national reputations.c)	Embrace cultural sensitivity with the wisdom of ancient Chinese rites and the universal adage, "When in Rome, do as the Romans do."

objectives: The main objectives of this course are as follows :	To develop communication skills and provide practice in comprehending oral business discourse	To present technical business vocabulary through contextualization at both the sentence and the paragraph levels	To present high-interest, interactive situations based on actual business applications	To provide activities for practice and improvement of general language skills and critical thinking

name:
實用醫療英語 （中高級）
PRACTICAL ENGLISH FOR HEALTH (HIGH-INTERMEDIATE LEVEL)
description:
《講授類》
限非外文系。建議英文程度『中高級』以上程度學生修習選課。本課程為優先選修課程，依選課須知規定，優先條件為第一篩選順序，志願序或點數加選為次要篩選順序。優先條件順序:(1)全英語學士專班(分組/班)學生。(2)其他學士班學生。
syllabus: This course is taught by American, Andrew. Everyone is welcome to join this interactive class. This course is focused on helping students learn how to talk about their health and healthcare in English. Students will further learn about the current trends in healthcare (such as AI), patient communications, and healthy living. Students will have the opportunity to practice their Healthcare English communication skills, such as how to use English as a patient when talking to their doctor. Additionally, this course will help students develop their skills to analyze and overcome barriers to patient communications. Students will also learn about cultural and ethical considerations that medical professionals, patients, and the medical field in general face. During the class, students will work together to create videos highlighting communications with doctors and/or healthcare public health advertisements.
objectives: Upon completion of the course:1)	Students will be able communicate about their health using daily medical English. Students will be able to see a doctor and communicate with them using English.2)	Students will understand basic medical ideas.3)	Students will be able to apply critical thinking to solve common medical communication problems encountered in the healthcare setting.4)	Students will be able to understand the ethical and cultural aspects of medicine and use appropriate English to promote inclusive healthcare.

objectives: This course examines the connection between literature and medicine in Western culture. In this course, we will examine how cultural productions addresses and sheds light on topics related to mind and body, health and sickness, the roles and interactions between patients and medical professionals, and the larger social relevance of medicine in arts and culture.

限大二以上修習
syllabus: 透過參與幼稚園活動與幼稚園幼兒的互動經驗，認識幼兒發展歷程，增進對人的尊重和體驗個人的成長。
objectives: - 認識幼兒發展- 培養與幼稚園的幼兒互動能力- 培養與幼兒有效的溝通技巧- 參與幼稚園的活動- 培養對於其他人負責任的態度

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GESL353&Crsname=服務學習：美術館與服務學習
name:
服務學習：美術館與服務學習
SERVICE LEARNING: TRAINING IN MUSEUM ORGANIZATION AT THE KAOHSIUNG MUSEUM OF FINE ARTS
description:
《服務學習類》
限大二以上修習
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\GESL353.TXT藝術家常淪為為社會經濟上的弱勢，通常無法自我行銷，本課程是協助藝術家與藝術活動，使用智慧型手機與自由軟體來行銷藝術，運用數位能力來協助在地藝術團體進行藝術相關數位化的資料庫建立，網路宣傳行銷，協助藝術活動與藝術家透過網路進行藝術創作的展演活動與藝術運動，透過服務學習反思，開發智慧資訊管理能力與創新觀念。一、 課程介紹、瞭解服務學習之實施與注意事項二、 服務學習相關專業的理論基礎；三、 職前訓練：學習為在地藝術團體建立數位化資料庫，應用於幫助在地藝術團體或藝術文化機構。四、 職前訓練：學習藝術資訊管理模式，應用於幫助藝術團體以數位技術與模式管理其作品。五、 職前訓練：教導藝術家如何使用智慧型手機管理藝術作品與行銷宣傳。學習藝術網站設計觀念，運用宣傳與行銷方法與技術。六、 反思知能與批判性思考：由服務中學習來進行反思。應用於幫助藝術團體永續經營，進行服務學習之社會實踐。七、 領導力與品格，工作倫理，服務學習技巧(一)溝通力與表達力(二)實際進行服務學習八、 服務學習之反思與慶賀。
objectives: 透過服務學習為在地藝術團體建立數位化資料庫， 學習藝術資訊管理模式，應用於幫助藝術團體以數位技術與模式管理其作品，用於幫助藝術團體永續經營，由服務中來進行學習社會實踐的反思。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=GESL354&Crsname=服務學習：臺灣獼猴生態宣導

服務學習：臺灣獼猴生態宣導
