ACCOUNTING(I)
description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限企管系(含雙主修、輔系)
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Description:An accounting system is created to guide the entity how to record its business operations in an organized way. Accounting is a technique that associates with identifying, recording and communicating economic events (or transactions) to users interested in the entity’s operations. Accounting functions as a business language which communicates an entity’s operation results to interested users. A high quality of accounting is indispensable in sustaining the entity’s operations and making right decisions.This course covers two semesters and targets to give students a complete accounting knowledge. Assets, equity and liabilities are three major elements for accounting. For this semester, we start by learning the accounting cycle, the routine work flows accountants need to process on a regular basis. The accounting cycle starts from analyzing transactions, breaking them down into one of the above three elements, recording them using the debit and credit rules, to summarizing and presenting them in the financial statements appropriately. Financial Statements are the final output of accounting. Four major financial statements include Income Statement, Retained Earnings Statement (Statement of Stockholders’ Equity in practice instead), Statement of Financial Position, and Statement of Cash Flows. We will also introduce items in the current assets such as inventory and cash.
objectives: Objective:This course has two objectives: The first one is to help students develop a basic knowledge in accounting and apply it to solve real-world problems. The second one is to empower students’ skills in logical analysis, critical thinking, independent learning, successful communication and clear presentations through the process of learning. This course builds a solid basis for developing students’ future career.

tags: ['海洋生產模式整合學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\BM105.TXT- Consumer preferences and the concept of utility- Consumer choice, budget constraint and utility maximization- Optimal choice and demand; the substitution and income effect- allocation of time and labour supply, intertemporal choice- Production and cost functions; substitutability among inputs and returns to scale- Cost minimization and profit maximization- Profit maximization in competitive markets, monopoly, and oligopoly; markets and applications- General equilibrium and the fundamental theorems of welfare- Risk, uncertainty and decisions making under uncertainty- Oligopoly models- Introduction to game theory
objectives: As a professional manager, you need not only the management knowledge but also an insight on the circumstance your organisation is facing. The most important aspect of the circumstance for a company is the market. Hence, a student of business should have some ideas about what the market is. After you complete this one-year’s course, we hope you can have a preliminary understanding of the market and trade.Economics has two parts: macroeconomics and microeconomics. Macroeconomics deals with issues such as economic growth, business cycles, monetary policies, and international finance. Microeconomics focuses on consumer behaviour and companies’ decisions, and studies how these interactions among people and companies shape markets.This module considers the way in which various decision making units in the economy (individuals and firms) make their decisions. These are fundamental concepts and approaches that underpin much of modern microeconomics. Consumer choice based on utility maximization is considered in detail and then applied to areas such as labour supply. It also considers in detail firms’ input and output decisions based on profit maximisation and cost minimization. Basic economic models are used to introduce students to analytical methods of reasoning. Applications and mathematical problems are used to enable students to see clearly the interplay of key concepts.This module also aims to introduce students to the game theoretic approaches and asymmetric information problems that are the foundation of much modern microeconomics. Strategic behaviour and imperfect information are at the heart of many applied economic problems.Last but not least, the curriculum has been designed to support the holistic learning of the latest academic theory and practice delivered using cutting-edge pedagogies and teaching methods.

name:

description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限企管系(含雙主修、輔系)；併班上課 ※英語授課

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\BM105A.TXT- Consumer preferences and the concept of utility- Consumer choice, budget constraint and utility maximization- Optimal choice and demand; the substitution and income effect- allocation of time and labour supply, intertemporal choice- Production and cost functions; substitutability among inputs and returns to scale- Cost minimization and profit maximization- Profit maximization in competitive markets, monopoly, and oligopoly; markets and applications- General equilibrium and the fundamental theorems of welfare- Risk, uncertainty and decisions making under uncertainty- Oligopoly models- Introduction to game theory
objectives: As a professional manager, you need not only the management knowledge but also an insight on the circumstance your organisation is facing. The most important aspect of the circumstance for a company is the market. Hence, a student of business should have some ideas about what the market is. After you complete this one-year’s course, we hope you can have a preliminary understanding of the market and trade.Economics has two parts: macroeconomics and microeconomics. Macroeconomics deals with issues such as economic growth, business cycles, monetary policies, and international finance. Microeconomics focuses on consumer behaviour and companies’ decisions, and studies how these interactions among people and companies shape markets.This module considers the way in which various decision making units in the economy (individuals and firms) make their decisions. These are fundamental concepts and approaches that underpin much of modern microeconomics. Consumer choice based on utility maximization is considered in detail and then applied to areas such as labour supply. It also considers in detail firms’ input and output decisions based on profit maximisation and cost minimization. Basic economic models are used to introduce students to analytical methods of reasoning. Applications and mathematical problems are used to enable students to see clearly the interplay of key concepts.This module also aims to introduce students to the game theoretic approaches and asymmetric information problems that are the foundation of much modern microeconomics. Strategic behaviour and imperfect information are at the heart of many applied economic problems.Last but not least, the curriculum has been designed to support the holistic learning of the latest academic theory and practice delivered using cutting-edge pedagogies and teaching methods.

name:
企業概論
INTRODUCTION TO BUSINESS
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】近年來企業（例如台積電、廣達、鴻海與聯發科等）在產業整體發展過程中扮演非常重要的角色，並成為經濟成長的驅動力。而企業經營成功與否取決於管理者與其夥伴之合作與付出，為有效提升企業經營績效，相關管理者與人員須對企業本質與特性有所了解，因而本課程著重於講解企業的內涵與功能，並針對許多企業的特點做深入討論與分析。相關探討議題包括企業所面對的內外部環境、企業道德、組織企業之型態、人力資源管理、行銷管理等。此外，本課程會運用Kahoot與季中錦標賽、樂高模擬與管理個案討論等方式，讓修課同學能更深入瞭解並應用企業概論的內容與知識。透過修習此課程，修課同學將對企業經營概念有深入的了解。The emphasis of the introduction to business course is on introducing the nature of companies and insights into business management especially paying attention to elaborating the ideas of marketing management, human resource management, internal and external environment analysis, etc. Further, the case discussion and lego game methods are used as teaching tools to increase students' understandings.
objectives: Upon completion of this course, students will have a good understanding of business management.

name:

MARKETING MANAGEMENT
tags: ['科技創新與服務業管理學程', '地方敘事與創生學程', '海洋生產模式整合學程', '音樂藝術管理與行銷學程', '行銷管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Marketing is one of the most dynamic and exciting aspects of business. This course is designed to introduce the student to the field of marketing and its basic concepts. Moreover, we will learn how to analyze the marketing environment of a product and then develop an appropriate marketing mix for the product. The process will involve the decisions regarding a product's features, price, promotion and distribution. This course will help you to systematically analyze the marketing environment for a product, service, or organization.
objectives: By the completion of this course the student should, at minimum, be able to:1.Demonstrate an understanding of key terminology and frameworks in marketing.2.Demonstrate the ability to apply marketing tools for analyzing customers, competition as well as for assessing the firms’ internal strengths and weaknesses.3.Demonstrate an understanding of how marketing contributes to achieving the strategic objectives of the firm.

description:
《講授類》

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The subject of organizational behavior (OB) touches the “human” side of management. Topics in OB include job attitudes, personality, emotions, motivation, leadership, teamwork, decision-making, communication, power and politics, leadership, organizational culture, conflict and negotiation, and stress and well-being. This course provides an introduction to these concepts and topics. Through understanding these concepts and topics, you will develop your ability in managing organizations, teams, and individuals, and eventually become a more effective subordinate, coworker, or leader.
objectives: Goal #1: Increase content knowledge relevant to the field of OBGoal #2: Learn to apply OB theories and research to “real” world contextGoal #3: Develop your potential for leadership and management through enhancing abilities in decision-making, problem diagnosis, communication, and motivating and influencing others.

Homework problems, exam problems, and computer software drilling, not able to be gone through in the Statistics (I) course due to time constraints, will be discussed and reviewed here. objectives: The objective of this course is to help students with assimilating, drilling, and learning statistics knowledge, concepts, and problem solving skills, for the course Statistics (I).

MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING
description:
《講授類》

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\BM302.TXTDescription:Managerial accounting is a company's internal language to express a company’s internal operations. Managerial Accounting helps managers perform three vital activities: Planning, Controlling and Decision-Making. This course is divided into three parts to achieve this target:1.	Use of cost concepts for decision-makers2.	Use of costs for decision-making3.	Use of costs for planning and controlPart 1: Use of Cost Concepts for Decision-MakersIn the first part of the course, we discuss the fundamental concepts and framework for cost management. We explain cost terms that will be used throughout the book. We learn how to distinguish between period costs and production costs, and between variable costs and fixed costs. We record cost behavior by choosing a cost system that best fits. We introduce traditional cost systems including job order costing and process costing.Part 2: Use of Costs for Decision-MakingIn the second part of the course, we transit from traditional costing to activity-based costing which measures cost more correctly and offers better cost information for decision making. We introduce cost-volume profit analysis (CVP) and apply relevant (or incremental) cost analysis for short-term decisions in special orders, make or buy, sellor process further, and the drop of unprofitable segments. We also learn how to price goods or service appropriately based on cost information.Part 3: Use of Costs for Planning and ControlThe third part of the course looks at management for planning and control. We focus on how to set standard costs and detect reasons why real costs are different from standard costs for a better cost control. We also discuss various techniques used to budget and plan long-term capital investment.Managerial accounting is a company's internal language to express a company’s internal operations. Managerial Accounting helps managers perform three vital activities: Planning, Controlling and Decision-Making. This course is divided into three parts to achieve this target:1.	Use of cost concepts for decision-makers2.	Use of costs for decision-making3.	Use of costs for planning and controlPart 1: Use of Cost Concepts for Decision-MakersIn the first part of the course, we discuss the fundamental concepts and framework for cost management. We explain cost terms that will be used throughout the book. We learn how to distinguish between period costs and production costs, and between variable costs and fixed costs. We record cost behavior by choosing a cost system that best fits. We introduce traditional cost systems including job order costing and process costing.Part 2: Use of Costs for Decision-MakingIn the second part of the course, we transit from traditional costing to activity-based costing which measures cost more correctly and offers better cost information for decision-making. We introduce cost-volume profit analysis (CVP) and apply relevant (or incremental) cost analysis for short-term decisions in special order deals, make or buy, sell or process further, as well as continue or eliminate unprofitable segments. We also learn how to price goods or service appropriately based on cost information.Part 3: Use of Costs for Planning and ControlThe third part of the course looks at management for planning and control. We focus on how to set standard costs and detect reasons why real costs are different from standard costs for a better cost control. We also discuss various techniques used to budget and plan long-term capital investment.
objectives: Objective:This course has two objectives. The first objective is to help students develop a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of the concepts and practice exercises at the back that are needed for better decision-making. The second objective is to empower students’ skills in logical analysis by using financial tools, critical thinking, independent learning, successful communication and clear presentations. The enhanced ability students benefit from this course helps students solve real-world problems and succeed in their future career.

objectives: This introductory course is aimed at helping students learn the fundamental concepts of Management Information Systems (MIS). The key challenges and opportunities in MIS as well as relevant practical aspects will be explored via the interactive teaching and learning activities and discussions. The reference papers from the leading academic journals, including (but not limited to) MIS Quarterly, Information Systems Research, Journal of Management Information Systems, Information Systems Journal, Information & Management, Decision Support Systems, Decision Sciences, Journal of Global Information Management, are recommended for the extracurricular reading.

The key challenges and opportunities in MIS as well as relevant practical aspects will be explored via the interactive teaching and learning activities and discussions. The reference papers from the leading academic journals, including (but not limited to) MIS Quarterly, Information Systems Research, Journal of Management Information Systems, Information Systems Journal, Information & Management, Decision Support Systems, Decision Sciences, Journal of Global Information Management, are recommended for the extracurricular reading.

name:
成本會計學
COST ACCOUNTING
tags: ['會計學程', '金融工程學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The purpose of this course is twofold. First, it focuses on the costing of manufacturing and activities in manufacturing industries. They include costing systems under different production processes, including accounting systems for materials, labor, and manufacturing overheads, job costing, process costing, cost behavior analysis, joint products and by-products costing, activity-based costing. The second part focuses on the uses of cost information, including information and decision making, capital budgeting, reasonability accounting, and profit variation analyses.
objectives: The purpose of this course is to prepare students with the capability for costing and using cost information to aid business decisions.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】學 分 數：three credits開課單位：College of Management, Department of Business Administration授課教師：Professor Taiihwa Chow(研究室：管3041)　(分機：4634) e-mail : taihwa@mail.nsysu.edu.tw
objectives: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to marketing research, and discusses nature, key concepts, theories, processes, and techniques, as well as their applications. Students gain an appreciation for the breadth and depth of the subject and its significance for a business enterprise, whether a start-up, manufacturers, retailers, or an not-for-profits company. The discussions center on planning executing marketing research proposals, and writing up of final reports.

name:
整合行銷溝通
INTEGRATED MARKETING COMMUNICATION
tags: ['行銷管理學程', '音樂藝術管理與行銷學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course will provide students with a balanced overview of Integrated Marketing Communication (IMC) and execution. To understand the foundations of successful IMC and execution the course draws upon both theory and practice. Specifically, the course unfolds into a set of topics that are ordered in a manner similar to the stages of a marketing campaign. The course focuses heavily on selecting a target for advertising, developing an effective brand position, and stressing the importance of consumer insight. The course also examines how to execute strategy and to evaluate communication effectiveness.
objectives: The objectives of this course are presented as follows:1.To understand that advertising is oriented toward building market share and increasing sales through the development of brand image and long-run consumer loyalty2.To analyze the many elements of an advertising campaign, it’s planning, and the execution of message strategy and media selection3.To apply communication concepts: signs, field of experience, and meaning4.To understand that sales promotion focuses on short-term incentives to encourage purchase or sale of a product or service.5.To evaluate elementary techniques of advertising research6.To provide practice in the application of advertising theory to practical problems7.To achieve market leadership by creating customer satisfaction through product innovation, product quality, and customer service8.To integrate ethical considerations into discussion of advertising topics throughout the course

objectives: The purpose of this course is to prepare students with the capability for understanding financial reporting theories and concepts under IFRS, and the accounting treatments and financial reporting of business transactions under these concepts.

name:
新時代的科技法律陷阱
TECHNOLOGY LAW AND ITS TRAPS IN THE MODERN SOCIETY
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The main research of technology law is intellectual property law. Intellectual property rights (IPR) have been defined as ideas, inventions, and creative expressions based on which there is a public willingness to bestow the status of property. IPR provide certain exclusive rights to the inventors or creators of that property, in order to enable them to reap commercial benefits from their creative efforts or reputation. There are several types of intellectual property protection like patent, copyright, trademark, etc. Patent is a recognition for an invention, which satisfies the criteria of global novelty, non-obviousness, and industrial application. IPR is prerequisite for better identification, planning, commercialization, rendering, and thereby protection of invention or creativity. Each industry should evolve its own IPR policies, management style, strategies, and so on depending on its area of specialty.
objectives: After this class, students could understand and analyze the risk of IP for a given product or service.

name:
策略管理
STRATEGIC MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限企管系(含雙主修、輔系)
tags: ['科技創新與服務業管理學程', '人力資源管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\BM413.TXT策略管理之概念在企業競爭優勢創造程序中扮演非常重要的角色，係因此概念可協助企業有效規劃、管理並運用適當的策略與行動來建構競爭優勢，進而提升經營績效，例如Google運用平台經營策略來創造創新生態系，如此強化其競爭優勢。策略管理之概念涵括定義公司使命、目標與願景、分析公司所處內外部環境、選擇與執行策略等步驟，考量策略管理的複雜度。企業管理者與相關人員須對策略管理的概念有清楚的瞭解與認識，如此能知道如何協助企業提升其經營績效，並可了解產業脈動與發展趨勢。為達成此目標，本課程著重於介紹策略管理之內涵與本質，並搭配Kahoot與季中錦標賽、個案討論與樂高模擬等方式，可讓修課同學更深入了解策略管理的知識與應用模式。此外，本課程為企管系大四必修進階課程，企管系大三同學如果想先行選修，建議能先與授課老師詢問一下。The concept of strategic management, which consists of strategy formation and implementation, plays a crucial role in today’s economy and has an impact on firms’ performance. It suggests that firms should make use of appropriate strategies by analysing external and internal environments as well as selecting and deploying strategies in order to create strong competitive advantage. In this context, for the purpose of deepening the understanding of strategic management, this course is designed to explore the nature of strategic management. It comprises three parts. Firstly, insights into strategic management are introduced. Secondly, the pattern of strategic management is elaborated. Thirdly, a number of cases related to the strategic management concept are discussed and analysed.
objectives: Upon completion of this course, students will have a good understanding of strategic management.

description:
《講授類》

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Strategic management is the most fast-growing division in the field of general management during the past twenty years. “Being strategic” is the most important topic in all of management functions and is imperative for selecting a potential business manager. As a result, this course expects to advance participants' strategic thinking and systematic analytical capabilities.
objectives: The objectives of this course are to build a bridge between students and business practices by providing participants with a comprehensive knowledge of strategic formulation and execution and cultivating a way of deep-rooted strategic thinking. A number of analytical frameworks and pioneering concepts that can be immediately applied to business context will be introduced and practiced. A lot of questions or issues that are common and important in both business and daily life will be identified and discussed. It is expected that the course can help to develop participants’ decision-making mindset and skills through sharing, benchmarking, case discussions, and lectures.

name:
淨零碳規劃管理專題講座
SPECIAL LECTURES ON NET-ZERO TRANSFORMATION
tags: ['淨零轉型微學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Climate change impacts are increasingly affecting human life. 'Net zero emissions by 2050' has become a global consensus: countries urgently need to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050 in an effort to limit global warming to 1.5°C and avoid crossing the critical threshold that would lead to ecosystem collapse.Taiwan joined the international declaration of 'Net Zero Emissions by 2050' in 2021, announced its national net-zero emission pathway in 2022, and further passed the 'Climate Change Response Act' in 2023, actively promoting climate governance. With the growing number of domestic and international net-zero regulations and the carbon neutrality demands of international supply chains, 'carbon pricing' and 'carbon management' have become important trends and significant areas of study today. As the nation and industries are at the forefront of green transformation, the increasing demand for net-zero talent is evident.The Ministry of Economic Affairs launched the 'Junior Net Zero Carbon Planning Manager' certification exam in 2024, aiming to assist industries in net-zero transformation and cultivate the necessary net-zero talent. By offering the course, we hope to provide students with a systematic understanding of key knowledge in the net-zero field, accelerating their future entry into the ranks of green-collar professionals.
objectives: Students are expected to learn the following topics:1. Domestic and international extreme climate change governance and response methods;2. Key international initiatives and carbon tax trade policies;3. Introduction to carbon asset trading management frameworks;4. Implementation of carbon neutrality;5. Standards and procedures for organizational greenhouse gas inventories;6. Standards and procedures for carbon footprint inventories.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course and the seminar in human resource management (I) offered in the previous semester are semi-independent courses wherein the students complete a final capstone project for bachelor’s degree in business management. This capstone project culminates students’ learning in the undergraduate program and help them transition into the role of a professional in their field. Students who are interested in the “people” aspect of management, including human resource management, organizational behavior, and work psychology, are welcome to enroll in this course to complete their capstone project.For the capstone project, students can choose to work individually or as a team to complete a quantitative or qualitative investigation involving “people issues” in the workplace.
objectives: 1. Students will be able to reflect on what was learned in Human Resource Management and Organizational Behavior using real workplace examples, and thus building a strong connection between theories and practice.2. Students will learn about the process of conducting independent research in Human Resource Management and Organizational Behavior, which is a skill needed for academic research and consulting.

name:
行銷專題研討（二）
SEMINAR IN MARKETING MANAGEMENT （II）
description:
《研討類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限企管系(含雙主修、輔系)；併班上課
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course is the second part of a one-year training. In this training, through completing a data science project, we will let you know how to use data science to get an insight to markets. We will extensively collect and clean lots of on-line and off-line data and find possible correlations among variables. Then, you have to combine your business background knowledge with these finding of correlations and get your own insights on markets or evaluate effects of different marketing strategies. Through completing this project, we will also let you know the idea of evidence-based management.In the first part of this one-year training, we have provided you a basic training about coding (Python), statistical analysis software (STATA), and an introduction of geographic information system (for handling spatial data). Moreover, to let you be able to correctly understand or explain the relationship among variables, we have also taught you basic knowledge regarding statistical inference and regressions, and also some advanced regression methods, such as instrumental variable regression, quantile regression, and survival analysis. Therefore, in this course, based on this training, you will keep working on your data science project, and in the end of this semester, you should compose a market analysis report, which provides an insight based on the data you collect. If your group uses private data from a specific company, we will also invite managers from these companies in your final presentation.Moreover, because you need knowledge regarding statistical inference and regressions, and also some coding and computer skills, if you do not have skills and knowledge mentioned above, and are not working with students taking Seminar in Marketing Management I in a data science project, I do not recommend you to take this course.
objectives: 1. Understand the idea of evidence-based management.2. Know how to use data science methods to get market insights and evaluate the effects of different marketing strategies.3. Through exploring data about real business worlds, you can verify and enhance your business background knowledge.

Learn the principles of information security and privacy.7. Develop introductory programming skills.

『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限資管系一年級修習且需搭配實習一同修習

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】第一章　會計之基本概念第二章 會計循環(一)第三章　會計循環(二)第四章 買賣業會計第五章　會計資訊系統第六章　現金與銀行存款第七章　應收款項第八章　存　　　貨第九章　廠房級設備CH 1　IntroductionCH 2 Accounting Cycle(1)CH 3　Accounting Cycle(2)CH 4 Merchandise AccountingCH 5　Accounting Information SystemCH 6　CashCH 7　ReceivablesCH 8　InventoryCH 9　Plants, Property and Equipment
objectives: 會計是企業的語言，是瞭解組織運作結果的基礎，因此做為一個現代人均需俱備會計學的知識，無論任何行業或個人未來理財則均需了解會計。本課程的設計，係先介紹財務會計學的基本流程與觀念，並從財務報表組成要素的會計科目一一介紹與練習，讓學生們瞭解會計運作，進而結合現代商業知識，包括民法、公司法、商業會計法等攸關現實商業世界必用之法令，使學生們能深入淺出的吸收圍繞在身邊的商業資訊與會計知識如何配合，奠定未來作為管理階層人員的基本學能之基礎。Accounting is used as the communication intermedia between enterprise and the stakeholders. As a student in the management school, Accounting is the fundamental for business education. In this course, students will learn the goals and business structure of an enterprise, the process of accounting procedures, accounting rules, and the detailed accounting procedures of Assets.

name:
生產與作業管理
PRODUCTIONS AND OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】生產與作業管理為企業運作三大管理基石, 隨著管理現代化，企業為因應新世代的全球性競爭，如何促成調整其生產與作業管理之機能，以迎接所將面臨的挑戰，已是不容怠忽之課題。而將生產與作業管理資訊化，為企業刻所冀以達成產業升級之主要作為，對其間所涉及的各單元之理念、架構與應用，須能深入透徹, 已是身為現代管理人所不可或缺的基本能力之一。The developing of technologies changed the behaviors of business operations and the relationship within business networks. The major concern to improve business competivity is to establish the proper production/operation management systems for the business. In this course, the well-known production/operation management systems, such as enterprise resource planning, supply chain management, customer relationship management, and etc. are introduced and discussed. At the mean time, the major quantitative techniques are also demonstrated to make the students to improve the efficiency of business operations more systematically while implement the business operation models.
objectives: 生產與作業管理之發展沿革, 基本理念, 與應用時機; 如何針對本土企業之現階段及未來, 發展運用最適宜之生管體系-> 伴隨資訊化潮流，生管人員應如何規劃、設計、及導入所需之生產管理資訊系統。-> 相關的企業資源規劃、供應鏈管理、與顧客關係管理等系統之特性與運作原則。The basic theory of production and operation management for different business types are introduced, and the latest managerial concepts and information application are verified for the small-and-medium business. The purpose of this course is to educate the students to be able to develop the production/operation systems appropriately.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MIS331.TXTOver the past 30 years, web programming technologies have been rapidly moving from static to dynamic, desktop to mobile, and synchronous to asynchronous. Learning web technologies can be a daunting task as the industrial standard webpage today involves the use of multiple languages, frameworks, and databases. To ease students into this field, the course will be driven by lots of examples and provide many hands-on practice opportunities. By the end of the course, each student should have a website made that they can be proud of. The lectures will be delivered in English.
objectives: The goal of this course is to help students develop general skills and understanding in developing web applications.

name:

CASE STUDIES IN INFORMATION MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程的上課教材為實際的企業個案，內容包括企業建置資訊系統的情境與決策、資訊科技產業的經營、電子商務之經營、及商業模式與創新管理等。同學在每週上課前需詳細研讀個案、撰寫預習報告、並作小組討論。上課時採全班參與討論的方式，充分瞭解個案的情境，以及從同學們不同的觀點互相學習。This is a business case discussion course, including the contexts and decision making for the business information system implementation, information business operation, E-commerce business operation, business models and innovation management, etc. Students are requested to read assigned case materials before attending the class, writing pre-class reports, and contribute during the class discussions.
objectives: 每週上課均採用企業個案，為企業採用資訊系統的組織和管理議題，或是網路現象，供同學從管理的各個面向討論和學習。同學可從企業採用資訊系統或發展電子商務，所發生過的問題或決策情境，實際印證過去所學過的資管理論。There is a business case for each week class, including the organization or management issues related to the business information system implementation or internet phenomena. Students needs to apply all the knowledge and skills that they have learned in the college to provide a comprehensive analysis while attending the class discussions.

name:
巨量資料分析導論
INTRODUCTION TO BIG DATA ANALYTICS
tags: ['永續能源學程', '智慧製造聯網微學程', '人工智能投資微學程', '金融科技與創新微學程', '金融科技學程', '跨領域智慧製造學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】*** 本課程採「同步遠距含錄影」上課，課程與連線相關資訊將置於本校網路大學課程頁面, 請至本校圖資處首頁網路大學登入****** 未選上課無法登入的同學，第一堂課上課請至 https://meet.google.com/qii-pwtd-ofj ****** 本課程有多個課號(MIS 413/572, CM 503)，請修習相關學程的同學注意 ***Prerequisite:* Programming Proficiency: It is essential for students to have familiarity with at least one high-level programming language.Expertise in scientific programming languages, such as R, Matlab, Python, Julia, or SAS, will be especially beneficial.* Relational Databases & SQL: Students must possess a foundational understanding of relational databases and the Structured QueryLanguage (SQL). This knowledge is pivotal for many data engineering components within the course.* Data Structures Fundamentals: A grasp of basic data structures, including but not limited to arrays, lists, sets, and dictionaries,is vital. This understanding will serve students well as they delve into the intricacies of Data Engineering and Analytics.* Introductory Statistics: A solid grounding in statistical concepts is required. This includes understanding descriptive analytics,which encompasses measures of data dispersion and central tendency, as well as diagnostic analytics, such as hypothesis testing. Suchknowledge will pave the way for a deeper comprehension of data analytics methodologies and statistical machine learning algorithms.* Analytical & Problem-solving Skills: The practical aspects of this course necessitate strong analytical thinking andproblem-solving abilities. Students should be prepared to apply their knowledge to tackle real-world challenges.For those students who may find themselves lacking in any of the outlined prerequisites, it is strongly advised to pursue supplementarycoursework or dedicated self-study. This proactive approach will ensure a richer and more effective learning experience throughout the course.
objectives: This course offers an in-depth exploration of the multifaceted domains of AI, Machine Learning (ML), and Big Data Analytics. Students will gain afoundational understanding of Data Science, tracing its evolution and significance across diverse sectors such as business, healthcare, insurance, and finance.The curriculum addresses essential topics, encompassing Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Analytics, Machine Learning Design Patterns, and the nuancesbetween Supervised & Unsupervised Learning. Enhancing the course content, students will explore foundational concepts like deep neural networks, model architecturedesign, functional programming, and ML Interpretability, which aim to demystify the black-box nature of many ML models. A central component of our curriculumis the transformative potential of large language models, such as the GPT-series, Gemini, and Claude. Students will appreciate how these models are pivotal in data analytics,especially in their capacity to generate R and Python code for streamlined and automated data processing.Throughout the course, the emphasis on practical applications ensures that students garner hands-on experience with the R and Python programming languages,addressing modern data analytics challenges. This course is tailored for those eager to both grasp and apply the principles of data science and ML/AI in concretereal-world contexts.

Cross-domain knowledge elicitation3.	Text mining techniques4.	Model development
objectives: In recent years, information technology (IT) along with big data analysis has been widely applied in a variety of domains such as finance, healthcare, and marketing. Among the technologies, text mining has been employed to facilitate the decision-making processes in these domains.The objective of this project is therefore to support cross-domain decision-making issues by making use of such ITs as text mining, information retrieval and decision analysis. Good application examples in this project include incorporating in-time financial news to develop enterprise financial risk prediction models, extracting essential information from electronic health records (EHRs) to assist principal design setups, and analyzing responsive reviews from various sources of social media on corporate branding to suggest its strategic deployment or tactical revisions.

name:

MULTI-MEDIA SYSTEM PROJECT(II)
description:

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MIS422.TXT近年來，隨著數位化的資訊越來越豐富，資訊過載已經是一個普遍的問題。其中一個解決資訊過載的方式就是使用視覺化的資料呈現。在管理上，視覺化的資料能夠有效的協助決策者快速的理解資料中的內容，做出最為自信的決策。在工程上，視覺化的資料能夠幫助工程師快速理解資料中的缺漏與趨勢，以開發出最為實用的人工智慧系統。視覺化系統就是能夠產生互動式視覺化呈現的平台，以供資料分析與探索使用。然而，要做出一個功能強大又易用的視覺化系統，必須考量資料的格式，使用者的需求，與視覺化呈現的效果。在本專案課程中，同學要選擇針對一組特定的資料與問題，必要時結合資料探勘與機器學習的技術，開發出一款實用的視覺化系統。最成功的系統要能展現出在特定的應用上，其與眾不同之處與帶來的獨特價值。
objectives: 學習團隊開發視覺化系統專案的能力

PRODUCTION-MARKETING INFORMATION SYSTEMS PROJECT (II)
description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限資管系四年級
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】企業為因應電子化世代的全球性競爭，將管理機能資訊化並調整其經營管理之運作，以迎接所將面臨的挑戰；而如何就企業之特性與需求，運用適合的資訊科技來促成其體質改善、產業升級升級，實為現代資管人所必須具備的智能。本課程則藉由與國內企業進行產學合作之方式，以了解新興資訊系統（如，ERP、SCM、CRM、e-commerce…）應如何規劃、設計、與導入。The application information system is one of the major concerns of operating business, and the production/marketing information system is the most important. In this course, the students will be directed to go through all the procedure to establish the information systems associated with the selected cooperation(s). Initialing the innovative ideas, performing market analysis, contacting with the cooperative business, and developing the information system, etc. are the main tasks of this project.
objectives: 修課學生於課程進行過程中可體認學習：1. 資訊管理人員應如何對企業進行分析評估，以規劃設計具實用價值之產銷資訊系統。2. 企業資源規劃、供應鏈管理、與顧客關係管理等系統之特性與運作原則。The purpose of this two-semester course is to help the students to make use of all the skill and the theory learned from the other courses, and to build up the experience and the knowledge of dealing with the real world problems.

Students will establish the basic concept of corporate finance, obtain the basic knowledge of valuation, and discuss the process of capital budgeting. Finally, we will discuss calculation and interpretation of return, risk, and the security market line.PS:本課程是財管系必修課程，修課對象僅開放給財管系學生(包括已經申請上財管系雙主修及輔系的外系學生)
objectives: 1. Establish the basic concept of corporate finance.2. Introduce the basic ideas on the time value of money and cover more advanced time value topics with numerous examples.3. Discuss interest rate, bond valuation, and stock valuation.4. Understand investment criteria, project cash flow definitions, and scenario and sensitivity "what-if" analysis.5. Discuss returns, risk, market efficiency, equity risk premium, diversification, and the security market line.

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Financial accounting is the branch of accounting that focuses on producing information for external users of financial reports, such as shareholders and lenders. The information generated by the financial reporting system is essential for the efficient operation of global financial markets.This course is designed to develop the problem-solving and research skills necessary to understand issues related to the collection, reporting, and analysis of financial accounting information from the preparer’s perspective for decision-making. It aims to provide an in-depth exploration of financial accounting, including the preparation of financial statements involving more complex economic events and the recognition of assets. The course equips students with the knowledge and skills needed to advance to further studies in financial reporting.
objectives: This course aims to provide students with a solid foundation in the theory and practice of financial reporting. Students will be exposed to current issues within the financial reporting environment and will engage with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). By the end of the course, students are expected to be able to categorize and specify the items on financial statements, discuss the principles underlying the use of financial statements, identify and record economic events, and prepare financial statements such as statement of profit and loss, statement of financial position and statement of cash flow.

name:

ETHICS AND LAW
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. objectives: 身為現代財務金融人才，除了應該具備商業財務上的專業知識外，更應該瞭解未來工作中職務範圍、以及其與商業犯罪的分際，以免誤觸法網。在現今社會，只要稍具規模的公司行號，均邀請專業講師講授「倫理與法律」之研訓課程，供員工幹部研習；本系作為專業之財務管理學系，更應提供本課程予學生們及早準備，勿待學生步出校門時方感困頓、甚至觸法。As a modern financial and financial talent, in addition to the professional knowledge of business and finance, it is necessary to understand the scope of duties in the future, and to avoid to against the law.In today's society, as a professional financial management department, this course should be offered to students. Prepare as early as possible, and don't wait until the students step out of the school to against the law.

objectives: 本課程將協助同學瞭解多國藉企業如何進行重要的財務管理決策。課程將包含三大主題：國際財務環境與匯率決定、多國藉企業之外匯風險管理，以及多國藉企業之資產與負債管理(投資與融資決策)。This course focuses on how multinational corporations (MNCs) make important decisions about their financial management. name:
財務風險管理
FINANCIAL RISK MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
建議大三以上修課
tags: ['金融工程學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course will focus on the modelling and forecasting of financial market volatility. We will analyze various types of financial data, including stock prices, stock market indices, foreign exchange (FX) rates, option implied risk measures, cryptocurrencies and commodities (energy and metal). 本課程聚焦在描述與預測金融市場之波動度. 透過分析各種不同金融商品與市場, 包含個股, 股價指數, 外匯, 選擇權隱含風險測度, 加密貨幣(包括能源與貴重金屬), 我們將學習以下衡量金融投資風險之模型與方法, 並在3次電腦上機實作中進行練習:The following models/methods will be firstly discussed and then implemented in 3 Excel-based computer workshops:1. ARCH-type models (discrete-time), including GARCH, GJR-GARCH and EGARCH;ARCH 模型與其延伸(為離散時間模型), 用以描述市場波動度2. Stochastic Volatility (SV) models, with estimation using hidden Markov models (HMM) and Kalman filter (discrete-time);隨機波動模型 (亦屬離散時間模型), 並以兩種方法-隱藏馬可夫鍊與Kalman filter進行模型的參數估計3. Modelling financial risk contagion with linear Hawkes process (continuous-time)使用線性Hawkes process(連續時間模型)描述市場風險之傳染現象4. Calculation of VaR (Value at Risk) and ES (Expected Shortfall)計算風險值與預期損失
objectives: There are three objectives of this course:課程有以下3項學習目標:(1) To cover various methods and models for financial risk at an introductory level,對不同的衡量風險之方法與模型進行深入淺出介紹;(2) To survey some fundamental literature, and對財務風險衡量的重要文獻進行回顧與掌握(3) To give students ample opportunities to practice and implement tools using data across asset classes and sampling frequencies.在課程中提供同學大量練習機會, 並應用所學方法與工具至各式不同金融資產After this course, students will acquire modeling techniques specifically designed for the important and unique stylized facts of financial data. As a result, students will see their research capacities expanded and modelling/programming skills sharpened, which will help them conduct research for their master thesis.

name:
行為財務學
BEHAVIORAL FINANCE
description:
《講授類》
 財務管理專業學程/人工智能投資微學程
tags: ['人工智能投資微學程', '財務管理專業學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】理性、效率市場，與利潤極大化是當今傳統經濟學理論的主要假設。在這個理論框架下的投資人將會依據所有可得的資訊做出理性的決策並追求利潤最大化，而市場將會達成市場效率。不過，當上述的理論套用在現實世界中時，我們發現市場運作的結果往往跟理論的預期並不一致。傳統的財務理論因而受到挑戰。在此前提下，「行為經濟學」的出現，為真實市場違背傳統財務理論假設的現象提供了解釋。行為財務學是行為經濟學的主要分支，從心理學的角度出發，用「人的不理性」來重新演繹實際市場現象。非完全理性的投資人，其心理因素如何影響財務以及投資決策，進而導致行為悖離傳統財務理論的預期，將是這門課程所要探討的重點。Rationality, efficient markets, and profit maximization are the primary assumptions of contemporary traditional economic theory. Under this theoretical framework, investors are expected to make rational decisions based on all available information and pursue profit maximization, while the market is expected to achieve market efficiency. However, when applying this theory to the real world, we find that the actual outcomes of market operations often do not align with these theoretical predictions. As a result, traditional financial theory has been challenged.Against this backdrop, "Behavioral Economics" provides explanations for the phenomena observed in real markets that deviate from the assumptions of traditional financial theory. Behavioral Finance, a major branch of Behavioral Economics, approaches this issue from the perspective of psychology and employs the concept of "human irrationality" to reinterpret actual market phenomena. This course will focus on how the psychological factors of non-fully rational investors influence their financial and investment decisions, leading to behavior that deviates from the expectations set by traditional financial theory.
objectives: 本課程前半段將由行為經濟學的理論與實證基礎開始介紹，包含思考系統與既存的行為偏誤。後半段介紹行為偏誤如何修正傳統財務學的論點並解釋文獻上的財務實證發現。參與課程者不須具備心理學的知識背景，但應具備基本的投資學以及公司理財等相關知識。The first half of this course will begin with an introduction to the theoretical and empirical foundations of behavioral economics, including the thinking system and existing behavioral biases. The second half of the course will explore how behavioral biases can correct the traditional viewpoints of finance and explain empirical findings in the financial literature. Participants in this course are not required to have a background in psychology, but should have a basic knowledge of investment theory and corporate finance.

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. objectives: The students have deeper understandings in the distributions widely used in finance.1. Univariate random variables: (1) the features of probability mass functions and probability density functions; (2) how to derive the expected value and variance of a random variable and its function; (3) binomial, geometric, negative binomial, Poisson distribution, etc.; (4) uniform, exponential, gamma, normal, beta distribution, etc.; (5) probability integral transform; (6) the applications in financial engineering.2. Multivariate random variables: (1) the features of joint probability mass functions and joint probability density functions; (2) how to derive the covariance and correlation coefficient of two variables; (3) trinomial distribution; (4) bivariate normal distribution; (5) conditional distribution and the distribution of a function of two variables; (6) order statistics; (7) the relationship between standard normal and t (chi-squares, F) distribution.3. Point estimation: (1) method of moments and maximum likelihood estimator; (2) unbiasedness.Students who are interested in probability and statistical distributions are welcome to take this course.

name:
經濟學概論
INTRODUCTION TO ECONOMICS
description:
《講授類》
限管院大學部學生與電機系大學部學生選修/網大進行之非同步線上課程
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】對經理人來說，除了需具備基礎的管理知識外，亦需對其組織所面對的外部情勢有所洞見。而市場，大概是一間公司所需面對的最重要的外部環境。因此，商管學生必須對市場的運作有所了解。在本門課中，我將讓各位認識經濟學家是如何理解市場的運作。經濟學家理解市場的方式，是藉由研究市場中主要參與者 (消費者與生產者) 如何行動來入手。我們假設這兩類參與者是理性的，並觀察這些理性的參與者將如何形塑出市場。因此，在這堂課中，我們將討論消費者和生產者的行為，以及他們會如何互動。在觀看完這幾講後，相信你們將對市場有一個初步的理解。本門課為非同步線上學習課程。同學選上此課程後，請登入中山網路大學 (https://cu.nsysu.edu.tw/mooc/index.php) 上課。所有課程相關公告與資訊皆會張貼於網大課程中之「課程公告版」，請同學務必留意。As a professional manager, you need not only the management knowledge but also an insight on the circumstance your organization is facing. The market is probably the most important aspect of the environment for a company. Hence, a student of business should have some ideas about what the market is.In this course, I will provide you basic concepts of the market from an economist’s perspective. The economists’ way to understand markets starts from a study of the main participants: consumers and producers. We assume that these participants are rational, and observe how these rational consumers and producers shape the market. Hence, we will discuss consumers’ and producers’ behavior, and also discuss their interactions. After this course, we hope that you can have a preliminary understanding on the market.This course will adopt asynchronous online learning method. After registering in this course, you should login to the National Sun Yat-sen Cyber University (https://cu.nsysu.edu.tw/mooc/index.php). All video lectures, announcements, and relevant information will be posted on the website. Please pay attention.
objectives: 1. 學生將對市場有一個基礎的概念 Students will have basic ideas on markets.2. 學生將能認識到經濟學者對人類社會運作的觀點 Students can know an economist's perspective on the society.

name:
經濟學（一）
ECONOMICS(I)
description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限IBBA(含雙主修、輔系)學生修習，欲加選學生請於加退選2階段辦理選課
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course provides an introduction to microeconomics. Microeconomics is the branch of economics that deals with the decision making of individuals and firms. The main goal of this course is to provide students with the tools and basic understanding of microeconomic principles necessary to analyze economic phenomenon and economic policy decisions in real world situations. Topics will include, but are not limit to, the concept of scarcity, opportunity cost, gainsfrom trade, supply and demand, elasticities, tax policies, externalities, costs, profits and variousmodels of competition.
objectives: Students should be able to answer the following questions after finishing this course:1. Describe the core ideas that economists use in understanding the world.2. Explain how a market economy functions.3. Describe how an economy solves the fundamental problem of scarcity.4. Analyze economic events, both at the level of individual markets and that of the economy as a whole, using the basic tools of economics.5. Evaluate the effect of changes in market conditions on outcomes in the market.6. Describe both the advantages of markets and the meaning of and circumstances underwhich markets fail.

name:
會計學（一）
ACCOUNTING (I)
description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限IBBA(含雙主修、輔系)學生修習，欲加選學生請於加退選2階段辦理選課
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course aims to accomplish two main objectives: The primary objective is to assist students in acquiring fundamental accounting knowledge and using what they have learned to solve real-world challenges. The second objective is to develop students' abilities in logical analysis, critical thinking, self-directed learning, effective communication, and clear presentation through the learning process. This course lays the groundwork for students' future careers.Accounting I is an intensive introduction to the preparation and interpretation of financial information for investors (external users) and managers (internal users) and the use of financial instruments to support system and project creation. This course adopts a decision-maker perspective on accounting and finance to help students develop a framework for understanding financial, managerial, and tax reports.
objectives: Learning Outcomes,Understand financial statement preparation and analysis, including the use of accrual accounting concepts.Identify the different types of business entities and their characteristics, and understand the legal and regulatory framework that governs them.Develop technical skills in accounting, including the ability to interpret financial statements.Understand the use of budgeting in business planning and decision making.Analyze the impact of cost, volume, and profit on business operations, including the use of break-even analysis and product mix decisions.Understand the importance of performance measurement and evaluation to assess organizational performance.Apply cost-volume-profit analysis techniques to make informed decisions about pricing, product mix, and resource allocation.Understand capital investment decisions, including the use of performance evaluation techniques such as the balanced scorecard.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IBBA104.TXTThis course is designed to study the managerial and practical knowledge of foreign direct investment and multinational enterprises. By increasing the awareness of political, social, and cultural differences that businesses encounter, it also develops students the ability to develop frameworks for anticipating, analyzing, and reconciling these differences.
objectives: By reviewing the current patterns, trends, and behaviors of foreign direct investment and multinational enterprises. Students can understand the main challenges and social responsibility in the international contexts.Through this course, students can learn frameworks and develop analytic skills by incorporating the present and future trends of cross-border value-added activities into theories of international business.

name:
亞太經營環境與管理
ASIA PACIFIC BUSINESS ENVIRONMENT AND MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The purpose of this course is to help students understand cultural and institutional environment in the Asia pacific region. This course focuses on South Korea, China, Taiwan and Japan as exemplars of the commercial, developmental and political practices in the region. For example, you will learn institutions such as the Korean chaebol and key cultural mores such as Chinese guanxi. This course will also provide an overview of the challenges and opportunities for foreign company to penetrate the Asia Pacific region including ASEAN and the Australian Markets.
objectives: The first part of the course examines the attempts to industrialise key East Asian countries after the end of the Second World War. Specific attention is drawn upon South Korea and Taiwan. The metaphor of capitalist development in authoritarian states is discussed, followed by the gradual shifts towards democracy and neoliberal practices at key newly industrialised nations in the region. Also, evaluate why in the 1980s - some Taiwanese corporations made the decision to expand its operations in the mainland China. This course also focuses on ASEAN, RCEP (Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership) and other markets in the region. It will also highlight various issues encountered by Western companies in entering the mainland Chinese markets, and how it can overcome such issues.

objectives: Students can briefly understand the legal risks of a business.In the future, when making or implementing business strategies, managers could have more senses about how to lower or to circumvent these legal risks for the routine business operations.

name:
跨文化溝通
INTERCULTURAL COMMUNICATION
description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限IBBA(含雙主修、輔系)學生修習，欲加選學生請於加退選2階段辦理選課
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】People from different cultures face similar problems but approach them in different ways. Understanding how cultures differ is the first step to becoming an effective manager or expatriate specialist in a multicultural context. Organizations that tend to have employees from different cultural backgrounds include multinational corporations, international non-governmental organizations, and research universities. This course explores differences between supranational, national, and subnational cultures, as reflected in cross-cultural empirical studies of values and organizational structures. Relevant business applications include cross-cultural negotiation, collaboration, and leadership strategies. There will be a special focus on a key source of intercultural communication difficulties: individualistic vs. collectivist cultures and associated values and behaviors.
objectives: Upon completion of this course students will be able to:1.	Identify and recognize the main components of cultural variability2.	Understand how individual behavior partly reflects culture-specific socialization3.	Discuss the relationship between culture-specific values and economic performance4.	Reflect on how one’s own culture influences decisions, behaviors, and work practices5.	Better adapt to a multicultural or culturally challenging workplace6.	Manage groups and organizations in a way that promotes cross-cultural synergies

name:

description:

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IBBA203.TXTThis purpose of this course is to examine the interaction between the symbolism of language from various angles. Participative and interactive involvement will be pivotal throughout the course. The purpose is to examine how the language is utilised as a tool to deliver a wide range of effects – not only as a general communicative instrument – but also as an influential socio-economic and cultural vehicle to transmit beliefs, ideas and convincing attitudes and outlooks.This course provides a comprehensive evaluation of the multiple intrinsic power methods apply in the language, and how it discursively succeeds in filtering those views and positions in a wide range of subjects in societies.
objectives: 1. Understand and be able to discuss a set of key concepts regarding the symbolic meaning of key words in the English language and be able to be innovative and think independently textually and visually.2. Integrate these concepts and skills with other business courses so students will be better able to apply these tools in the future. In other words, be able to market needs and dynamics, how to maximise these methods from a competitive perspective, how globalisation and glocalisation takes use of these methods – as well as how to influence consumers and identity construction of subjects.

The first half of the course focuses on fundamentals of marketing management, consumer and business markets, market segmentation and brand positioning. The second half integrates management concepts into marketing mix, communication and integrated marketing campaign, competitive growth strategy, global markets and socially responsible marketing. These essential topics should help the student to build a clear understanding of how to apply managerial concepts to marketing practices.

name:
微積分
CALCULUS
description:
《講授類》
與生科系英語組併班
syllabus: This is a first course in Calculus - an introduction to differential and integral calculus of functions of a real variable. Calculus is the study of change and humans care about change more than they realise, whether they admit it or not. Concepts explored include (but not limited to) limits and continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, linear approximations, geometric applications of differentiations, indeterminate forms and L'Hôpital's Rule, indefinite and definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, techniques of integration, and applications of integration.This syllabus is not a binding legal contract. The instructor reserve the right to make changes (including grade evaluation) as they see fit at any time, but all adjustments will be announced.
objectives: Upon completion, you will be able to:1) calculate, use, and explain the concept of limits.2) explain and interpret the significance of the derivative of a function.3) use differentiation rules to efficiently calculate derivatives of elementary functions and composition of elementary functions.4) use differentiation to find geometric information of a given function and sketch its graph.5) formulate and solve optimisation problems using differentiation.6) explain and interpret the significance of the definite integral of a function.7) evaluate definite and indefinite integrals using substitution, integration by parts, and partial fraction decomposition.8) formulate and solve physical problems using the definite integral.

syllabus: This General Chemistry course will covers the fundamental concept of chemistry in graduate level. The course would help you to understand with difficult concepts to solving the problems. Subsequently, this chemistry course is a broad spectrum of covering a multiple topics will be discussed in detailed way in an relatively a short period of time through the important material’s (supplementary notes), would help to deep understanding. An additionally, this course demands/dedicate to time and efforts, it’s required to fulfill homework assignments on time, no extension can be allowed.
objectives: This course would allow to understand an overview about the fundamental concept of Chemistry in Our Lives, Chemistry and Measurements, Matter and Energy, Atoms and Elements Nuclear Chemistry for Medical Uses of Radioisotopes, and also Acids Bases. This course would allow for students who have an interest in nursing, nutrition, environmental science, food science, and a wide variety of other health-related professions. The description of this course are designed for an introductory chemistry course with suitable for undergraduate level of biological students, which are particular to relates the principal concepts of general, organic, and biological chemistry to the world around us, and in this way illustrates how chemistry can explains in multiple aspects of daily life. This course would allow for the students who are planning a career within the allied health field are required to gain broad exposure to the numerous ways in which chemistry is intrinsic to influences life.

name:

MICROBIOLOGY
tags: ['海洋天然物微學程', '海洋微生物及應用推廣微學程', '生物技術學程', '環境教育學程', '海洋生產模式整合學程', '海洋循環經濟學程']
syllabus: 本課程將探討微生物學的幾個主題(1)微生物生理學。(2)細菌及病毒存在的基本和應用之意義。(3)細菌如何和為何演化成多元之物種。(4)細菌/病毒與動物植物及環境之關係。(5)暸解微生物之基礎生命現象將有助於其它生命科學領域之暸解和學習。
objectives: 教導學生基礎微生物學的知識及實驗技術。介紹微生物學的過去現在和未來驅趨勢。

name:
微生物學實驗
MICROBIOLOGY LABORATORY
tags: ['生物技術微學程', '海洋微生物及應用推廣微學程', '生物技術學程']
syllabus: 細菌培養 、分離、純化及計數，細菌運動的測試，各類染色法，生化測試，分類鑑定，黴菌及病毒的培養，水質檢驗，飲料衛生檢查 細菌生長曲線，溫度 、鹽份及氧氣對細菌生長的影響，釀酒。
objectives: 1.讓學生熟悉在無菌條件下，操作各種基本微生物實驗。2.讓學生藉由生化測試及顯微鏡觀察，可以鑑定細菌的種類。3.藉由基本微生物實驗技術應用在生活上如飲料衛生檢查及釀酒.

syllabus: 魚類是脊索動物門中一個並源演化的類群，它包含超過三萬個已知的物種，也因此是脊椎動物類群中種類多樣性最高的。現生魚類包含有盲鰻、八目鰻、軟骨魚、輻鰭魚及肉鰭魚，這些物種呈現了形態上的高度多樣性及對不同環境的適應。
objectives: 本課程將教授魚類的基礎分類特徵、系統分類學，及其生態、行為及演化上的重要議題，如生理調控、生活史、生物地理學及對特殊環境的適應等。在研修此課程後，學生將對魚類有多層面的了解。

name:
魚類學實驗
ICHTHYOLOGY LABORATORY
tags: ['生物多樣性學程']
syllabus: 魚類是脊索動物門中一個並源演化的類群，它包含超過三萬個已知的物種，也因此是脊椎動物類群中種類多樣性最高的。現生魚類包含有盲鰻、八目鰻、軟骨魚、輻鰭魚及肉鰭魚，這些物種呈現了形態上的高度多樣性及對不同環境的適應。限有修魚類學正課之學生。
objectives: 以學生實際動手操作的方式，對魚類學課程內容有進一步的了解

name:
地質學
GEOLOGY
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 介紹地質學的基本概念、架構、內涵，以及其與人類生活與生存的相關性與重要性，課程內容包括板塊運動、岩石與礦物（構成地殼之材料）、火山作用、變質作用、風化、侵蝕與沈積作用、地質年代、塊體運動、地下水、地質構造、地質災害、板塊構造學說等。
objectives: 瞭解地質學基本概念，能夠說明地球的型態和組成、地球內部和表面的活動以及地球演變過程、地質資源與地質災害如何形成、地質作用對人類與萬物生存的重要性，並且能夠從知而起行，以實際行動為地球永續與環境永續盡一份力量。

name:
海洋生物多樣性導論
INTRODUCTION TO MARINE BIODIVERSITY
tags: ['海洋生物資源與實務應用微學程', '環境教育學程', '自然生物資產微學程', '海洋循環經濟學程', '生物多樣性學程', '臺灣研究學程', '探索海洋國家公園微學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MBR227.TXTThis course primarily explores the relationship between marine biodiversity and conservation, emphasizing a conservation perspective to help students understand theories and practical situations related to marine conservation. It aims to deepen understanding of the various threats facing marine ecosystems today and how to address them. Topics include marine population biology and conservation, the threads to marine biodiversity, marine ecosystem conservation, and global trends and status of marine conservation.
objectives: The course aims to provide students with fundamental concepts of marine conservation and an understanding of the current threats to various marine ecosystems, as well as the challenges they will face in the future.

name:
生物化學（一）
BIOCHEMISTRY(I)
teacher: 李益銘,廖志中,廖睿妘,翁靖如
tags: ['生物技術學程', '天然藥物合成學程']
syllabus: 氨基酸，蛋白質結構與功能，醣類，脂質，細胞膜，核酸，酵素基本概念及酵素動力學，酵素作用機制，酵素活性調控。尚未輸入
objectives: 讓學生可以了解在生命體中所進行的重要化學反應和其原理

name:
生物化學實驗
BIOCHEMISTRY LABORATORY

name:
海上實習
OCEANOGRAPHY CRUISE PRACTICE
description:
《實習類》
修課學生須先取得海科院舉辦之水域活動安全與自救訓練講習證明，始能參與水域活動(含實習航次)
※英語授課
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MBR310.TXT本課程主要為讓學生認識海上研究作業方法，包含海洋微生物、海洋底棲生物、及海洋浮游生物之採樣研究方法及資料分析處理介紹。
objectives: 讓學生認識海上研究作業方法，包含海洋微生物、海洋底棲生物、及海洋浮游生物之採樣研究方法及資料分析處理，日後無論是升學或在海洋環境調查的領域就業，皆可學以致用。

name:
生物統計學及實習(一)
BIOSTATISTICS AND PRACTICE (I)
syllabus: 1. What is Biostatistics?2. A good start is half the battle: Scientific methods and experimental design3. Charts and numbers equal the truth?: Descriptive statistics, samples, and populations4. Mass testing or not?: Sampling and probability concepts5. Are vaccines really effective?: Statistical hypothesis testing6. Why do emails sent to me always end up in the spam folder?: Analysis of Variance (ANOVA)7. Correlation is not causation: Correlation analysis and simple linear regression8. Not normally distributed data?: Non-parametric analysis
objectives: Through data organization and analysis, along with practice using the R language, students will become familiar with statistical principles, understand experimental design, and learn how to process, analyze, and interpret data and results.

name:
生態學
ECOLOGY
tags: ['環境教育學程', '環境科技與管理學程', '生物多樣性學程']
syllabus: In this course students will learn fundamental ecological theory which describes how organisms interact with the environment. Emphasis will be placed on examples from marine ecosystems, but connectivity between terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems will be highlighted. Further, students will learn how to use the scientific method to delve into current applied ecology questions.
objectives: After this course students will be able to:1) Describe key ecological theory with real-life examples2) Comprehend the scientific method and apply it to ecology-based inquiry3) Learn and use basic ecological sampling and research skills

name:
海洋無脊椎動物學（一）
MARINE INVERTEBRATE ZOOLOGY(I)
tags: ['海洋生物資源與實務應用微學程', '擁海學程', '環境教育學程', '海洋生產模式整合學程', '海洋循環經濟學程', '生物多樣性學程', '熱帶海洋微學程', '印象海味微學程']
syllabus: 在動物界中約有98%的動物是不具脊椎的，且確切的物種數目正隨著時間而增加，目前包含約30個門的生物，包含的綱、目與科更是不勝枚舉，不同類群在營養、運動、生殖等也具有相當高的多樣性。藉由此課程，能使學生了解原生生物及各類無脊椎動物之形態構造、習性與生活史，並了解各類無脊椎動物間的親緣關係。
objectives: 本課程是綜合介紹各門無脊椎動物之型態、生理、生態及分類，並擴充基礎知識外的一些知識，另小組間的討論增加同學的參與感與學習效益。

name:
天然物生物活性研究方法
RESEARCH METHODS FOR BIOLOGICAL ACTIVITY OF NATURE COMPOUNDS
tags: ['生物技術學程']

objectives: 上課講解細胞及動物模式後,給予學員一種未知天然物,於期未時報告此天然物可能之生物活性

name:
生藥學
PHARMACOGNOSY
tags: ['海洋天然物微學程', '生物技術學程', '校園預防醫學學程', '海洋生產模式整合學程', '天然藥物合成學程', '海洋生物資源開發學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MBR341.TXT「生藥學」(Pharmacognosy) 一詞是由希臘文”Pharmakon” (藥物) 以及 ”gnosis” (知識) 聯合而成，意即一門「解釋藥物知識」的學問。而中文所使用之「生藥學」最早見於日本學者大井玄洞之書，指稱”凡宇宙直接採取之藥物，具有其天然之形狀、或因機械的制法變換其形貌，而販賣者，皆為之生藥；而講求此等科學者，謂之生藥學”。因此，生藥學是以植物分類學，天然物化學等為基礎，包含藥物開發史，藥理、製劑學等等知識，合而為一的藥物科學。本課程設計以大學部三年級、具有普化、有機化學與生物化學等課程基礎之學生為對象，課程內容介紹藥用植物與生藥學的基本內容和方法，並藉由植物科屬次序排列介紹相關重點生藥之各種活性物質其化學成分與其藥理活性所應具備之基本知識，並例舉近年國內外天然藥物研究的新技術、新方法、新成果。
objectives: 初步將課程分為下列單元， 1) 課程概述，說明生藥學範疇以及各節課程內容的概述。 2) 民族植物學與民族藥學，介紹同學民族藥學中重要的植物科屬與其典故。 3) 生藥學研究法，介紹植物成分分離法、工具與原理，以及植物藥材的製造與品管等。4) 生物藥學科技的應用，介紹現代在製藥工程運用生物科技與新藥開發。5) 天然物化學簡介，介紹結合化學與生化知識的現代生藥學，6) 生藥活性成分介紹，說明植物體內製備生藥成分的機轉與各類活性成分骨架，最後依植物科屬次序講述常見之生藥之基原、成分與其用途，如生物鹼、氨基酸、木質素等芳香類化合物等，（配醣體、萜類化合物等部分另有天然物化學概論教授）。生藥學在現代藥物開發中的應用與前景。

name:
環境化學
ENVIRONMENTAL CHEMISTRY
tags: ['環境教育學程', '半導體設備工程學程']
syllabus: 探討自然環境包括水體、大氣及地質圈之現象及可能發生之機制。講授內容包括：自然環境與生命；自然水體之性質與組成；水體的氧化還原化學及平衡；錯化合現象；微生物與環境化學；非均勻相之交互作用；水汙染；水處理；土壤之性質及化學現象；大氣之組成及化學反應；空氣汙染；環境化學分析。
objectives: 使學生從科學的觀點來瞭解自然環境的動態變化，以期能提升環境保護的相關知識及正確意識。

name:
蛋白質化學
PROTEIN CHEMISTRY
tags: ['生物技術微學程', '海洋生產模式整合學程', '海洋循環經濟學程', '海洋生物資源開發學程']
syllabus: 根據原本基礎的生物化學，在蛋白質的部分教授更進階的內容，也希望在這個課程當中，讓學生認知蛋白質在各個領域，都是依賴著蛋白質不同的機轉，以擴增學生對於在蛋白質中化學反應的應用
objectives: 讓學生認識目前普遍對於蛋白質化學的發想與技術，並能以此為基礎進行實用

name:
專題研究（一）
INDEPENDENT STUDIES IN MARINE RESOURCES（I）
teacher: 王亮鈞,廖志中,廖睿妘,張桂祥,李益銘,林秀瑾,水晶,翁靖如,鄭源斌
description:
《獨立研究》
修課規定已公告於本系網頁(課程資訊>大學部>【課程公告】113-1大三「專題研究（一）］修課說明)，未依規定者不得修課。
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MBR360.TXT鼓勵大學部學生將課堂所學之理論進行海洋生物相關課題之專題研究。

SEMINAR IN MARINE RESOURCES(I)

name:
訊息傳遞與藥物開發概論
INTRODUCTION OF SIGNAL TRANSDUCTION AND DRUG DISCOVERY
tags: ['海洋天然物微學程', '生物技術學程', '海洋生產模式整合學程', '天然藥物合成學程', '海洋生物資源開發學程']
syllabus: 1.癌症的分子機制 2.細胞週期 3.化學療法與癌症的戰爭 4.過氧化增生活化受體gamma受體之訊息路徑
