url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=CHEM618&Crsname=奈米材料於生物醫學的應用
name:
奈米材料於生物醫學的應用
NANOMATERIALS APPLIED ON BIOMEDICINE
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CHEM618.TXTNanoscience is one of the newly emerging sciences. The main goal of this course is the synthesis, analysis and application of nanomaterials and to introduce the principles, structures, characteristics and applications of various nanobiomedical sensors. There are many types of biomedical sensors and they are widely used and their measurements include light, electricity, temperature, and chemical quantities. Nano sensors are developed using the special physical, chemical and optical properties (like fluorescence and color) of nanomaterials. Through this course, students can understand the basic knowledge, design principles, manufacturing methods and related applications of today's nano sensors. Beside, introduce the knowledge of nanomaterials in medicine, biochemistry and environmental analysis and application of various nanotechnology combined with liquid phase microextraction technology, mass spectrometer, fluorescence spectrometer and colorimetric analysis in medicine, biochemistry, environmental and drug analysis. In addition to study for nano biomedical sensors, this course also aims for fast screening and rapid diagnosis methods for medicine such as cancer detection using today's nanotechnology to achieve rapid and accurate detection.奈米科學是近來新興的科學之一，本課程主要目標為奈米材料的合成, 分析與應用:介紹各式奈米生醫感測器之原理、構造、特性及其應用等。生醫感測器的種類繁多且應用廣泛，量測包含光、電、溫度及化學量等.奈米感測器則是利用奈米材料特殊的物性、化性、電學與光學性質，所發展出來的檢測器,目前相關的技術已經蓬勃發展，希望透過課程的介紹，讓學生瞭解當今奈米感測器的基本知識、設計的原理、製造方法與其相關的應用。介紹奈米粒子在藥物,生化,環境分析技術方面的知識。應用各種奈米科技結合液相微萃取技術,質譜儀,螢光光譜儀在醫藥,生化,環境分析和藥物之分析.本課程除了闡述奈米生醫感測器外，對癌症篩檢、快速檢驗等，利用現今之奈米技術達到快速及準確的檢測。
objectives: Introduction on synthesis of various modern nanomaterials, learning all possible characterization instruments such as MS, UV,Visible, FTIR, Fluorescence and colorimetric Spectroscopy...The applications of various fields of nanomaterials on medicine, biomedicine, environmental science and pharmaceutical science will be introduced.

name:
AI產業及半導體化學講座
SPECIAL LECTURES ON ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENT INDUSTRY AND CHEMISTRY IN SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURE
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CHEM623.TXT介紹AI基本概念及AI在半導體化學產業中的應用，包含運用AI技術預測化學反應和分子結構，將研發資料模型化，加速產品研發。利用AI優化實驗設計及生產流程，提升生產品質以降低不良率，減少能源浪費。另外透過AI分析使實驗自動化，縮短問題排查時間以提升生產效率。
objectives: 認識AI在化學研究領域及半導體產業上的廣泛應用，了解AI在產業中應用的實際案例，並學習使用AI解決問題的方法與概念。

name:
古典力學
CLASSICAL MECHANICS
syllabus: The course will lay out the fundamental concepts of Newton's laws of motion. They required the quantities like velocity and force. The momentum, angular momentum, and energy come up and their conservation laws become important concepts in physics. Then we will introduce the formulism of Lagrangian, which can equivalently give the equations of motion as those in Newton's laws. Finally, we will introduce another frame by Hamilton, which gives the idea of phase space of orbits.
objectives: 1. knowledge of Newton’s Laws and equations of motion2. momentum, angular momentum, and energy, and their conservation laws3. knowledge of oscillatory motion4. two-body systems of a central potential5. Calculus of Variations6. Lagrangian and Euler-Lagrange equation7. Hamiltonian Mechanics

name:
電動力學導論
INTRODUCTION TO ELECTRODYNAMICS
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\PHYS506.TXTVector AnalysisElectrostaticsElectric Fields in MatterMagnetostaticsMagnetic Fields in MatterElectrodynamics
objectives: To the best of our knowledge, there are four forces at play in the Universe, one of them is the force of electromagnetism. The electromagnetic force is carried by electromagnetic fields composed of electric fields and magnetic fields and it is responsible for many familiar phenomena in nature. It is the force which is responsible for the incredible range of properties that different materials exhibit; the origin and the propagation of light; it is the basis of electric power engineering and electronics including digital technology. Remarkably, a full description of the force of electromagnetism is contained in four simple and elegant equations, the Maxwell equations. In this course we will introduce the Maxwell equations and extract some of the many stories they contain.

name:
凝體物理（一）
CONDENSED MATTERPHYSIS (I)
tags: ['量子材料微學程']
syllabus: 1.Crystallography and crystal structure: Primitive and conventional unit cells, Bravais lattice, basis, Miller Indices.2.Diffraction: Bragg’s law, structure factor, Reciprocal lattice, Brillouin zone, x-ray diffraction.3.Lattice dynamics: Elastic wave, lattice vibration, vibrational modes and phonons, 1D monatomic and diatomic chains, phonon dispersion.4.Thermal properties: het capacity and heat conductivity.5.Free electron model: Drude model, Density of states, Fermi-Dirac distribution and Fermi level, electrical conductivity from free electron gas.6.Energy band in solids: Bloch wave and Bloch's theorem, periodic potential, nearly free electron model, energy and band gap, first Brillouin zone and extended zone scheme, tight binding model, metal, insulator and semiconductors, Fermi surfaces, Kronig-Penny model.
objectives: This course is designed to for entry-level graduate students or upper-division undergraduates to develop basic knowledge and understanding of the key principles and applications of Condensed Matter Physics. Upon successful completion of this course, students should have the following abilities.1.Demonstrate knowledge for crystal structures of solids, different physical mechanisms involved in crystal bonding and lattice dynamics,2.Formulate the problem of electrons in a periodic potential, examine its consequence on the band-structure of solids and explain the physical properties of solids in terms of their band-structure,3.Describe the behaviour of solid matters and explain the underlying physical concepts based on solid state theory and principles,4.Apply physics principles and mathematical methods in Condensed Matter Physics to explain various physical, electrical and optical properties of materials.

name:
表面物理
SURFACE SCIENCE
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\PHYS603.TXTThis course will explore the principles and applications of surface physics, with a particular emphasis on using photoelectron spectroscopy to analyze the band structure of two-dimensional (2D) materials. The course is structured as follows:1. Review of Foundational Concepts:Quantum MechanicsCondensed Matter PhysicsPhotoelectron Spectroscopy Techniques2. Overview of Spectroscopic MethodsDetailed Study of Photoelectron SpectroscopyPractical Analysis of 2D Materials3. Application of Photoelectron SpectroscopyAnalysis of Band Structure in 2D Materials
objectives: 1. Understand the Fundamental Theories of Surface Physics- Master the basic concepts of quantum mechanics and condensed matter physics, and understand how these theories apply to surface phenomena.2. Become Familiar with Photoelectron Spectroscopy Techniques- Gain a deep understanding of the principles and operations of photoelectron spectroscopy and learn how to apply this technique to study the surface and band structure of materials.3. Apply Theoretical Knowledge to Practical Analysis- Develop the ability to independently use photoelectron spectroscopy to analyze the band structure of two-dimensional materials and explain the observed experimental phenomena.4. **Enhance Experimental Design and Data Analysis Skills**- Improve students' abilities in designing experiments, collecting, and analyzing data to derive valuable scientific conclusions.

name:
圖論中的拓樸方法
TOPOLOGICAL METHODS IN GRAPH THEORY
syllabus: ConnectivityPlanar graphsGraph minorsColin de Verdiere parameter (optional)
objectives: This course focuses on graph structures — the connectivity, the planarity, and the minors. We will see how Menger's theorem characterizes the connectivity of a graph. On the other hand, Kuratowski's theorem shows that a graph is planar if and only if it does not contain K_5 nor K_{3,3} as a minor. We will study the notion of minors and topological minors of a graph and see various families of graphs that are characterized by certain forbidden minors. In the end, we will go deeper into graph minors and study tree-width, tangle, the graph minor theorem, and so on.

syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MATH651.TXTThe purpose of the course is to broaden students' knowledge via talks in different research areas. The default day of talks would be Thursday; the tentative weeks for talks are given in following the schedule. However, please be advised that the schedule is "tentative." It may be flexible based on each speaker's availability. Thus, for the precise time of each talk, please follow the announcement that posts on the department's website as well as on the bulletin board.The grade of this course solely depends on the Final Presentation. The topic of the Final Presentation shall be determined by students and their (potential) thesis advisor. If the student who has not yet have a thesis advisor by the week of midterm exam (the week of 10/27~11/02), please contact Dr. Po-Han Hsu for the topics of Final Presentation.The students are required to attend the first class. After that, students may join any talk based on their interests. Certainly, the whole class will meet on the Final Exam week for Final Presentation. The precise time and location of Final Presentation will be updated later in this semester.
objectives: After this course, the students shall have more understanding in different research areas in mathematics.

name:
生物數學專題研討（二）
SEMINAR IN BIOMATHEMATICS (II)
syllabus: 在過去半世紀，越來越多生物學家認為雜交、水平基因轉移和重組等網狀事件在演化樹中發揮著重要作用，但多數已發表的研究結果都停留在用樹狀結構來刻畫物種的演化歷史。近年來，越來越多人投入網狀結構的研究，這一領域的工作便是專注於建構系統發育網絡的方法。系統發育網絡（Phylogenetic Networks）的研究在近幾十年來越發熱門，主要原因是系統發育樹（Phylogenetic Trees）這個模型已經不足以用於解釋所有演化事件。 而這方面的研究，已經漸漸從生物界外溢到數學界。 隨著越來越多有用的模型被刻畫出來，許多數學問題也因此產生，例如數量的分佈、隨機性或者漸近行為。
objectives: 此專題研討，我們會將焦點放於一些熱門模型的研究，例如Tree-Child Network及Galled Networks。

name:
耦合專題研討（二）
SEMINAR IN COPULAS (II)
syllabus: We will cover basic topics including, but not limited to, Definitions and Basic Properties, Sklar's Theorem, Random Variable Generation, Archimedean Copulas, Dependence, and Additional Topics.
objectives: This course aims to provide students with a thorough understanding of the fundamental concepts of copulas and their applications.

name:

SOI IC ENGINEERING
description:
《講授類》
開放大三、大四學生選修
tags: ['矽光子微學程', '半導體元件學程']
syllabus: 本課程首先介紹SOI積體電路的晶圓技術，再導入SOI元件的各種架構與特性探討，並討論SOI積體電路技術的優缺點，以便進一步探討SOI積體電路的設計技巧和各種特殊SOI積體元件性能。
objectives: 使學生瞭解SOI元件、技術與電路設計之原理與應用。

objectives: 本課程著重於光電半導體元件的最新研究趨勢，使學生瞭解本領域的發展，對相關議題能啟發研究方向。

name:

SOLID STATE ELECTRONIC DEVICES (I)
tags: ['半導體設備工程學程', '半導體元件學程']
syllabus: 1. Electrons and Holes in Semiconductors2. Carrier Transport Phenomena3. Nonequilibrium Excess Carriers in Semiconductor4. The pn Junction5. The pn Junction Diode6. Metal-Semiconductor and Semiconductor Heterojunction
objectives: 本課程從介紹基礎的半導體物理出發，接著介紹基本且重要的電子元件其操作模式與機制，並講授其電子元件在實際製作上與使用上與理想理論不同之處。使學生可獲得基礎與實際上電子元件的相關知識，並可應用於電子元件的分析與設計。

name:

SPECIAL TOPICS IN MICROELECTRONICS ENGINEERING
syllabus: 本學期主要以尖端微電子製造技術為主，並探討高轉導高性能元件和IC之結構設計與VLSI/ASIC線路設計之模擬與設計。
objectives: 讓同學能對下世代高性能之奈米微電子之結構設計與製程技術有所瞭解。並探討奈米元件應用於IC線路設計所應注意之技巧與問題。

name:
非線性系統
NONLINEAR SYSTEMS
syllabus: 1.非線性系統簡介(Introduction to Nonlinear Systems)2.數學基礎(Mathematical Background )3.相位平面作圖分析(Phase Plane)4.李亞普諾夫理論系統穩定分析(Lyapunov Function Based Analysis)5.線性化分析(Linearization)6.進階穩定分析(Advanced stability Analysis)7.強健性設計(Robust Design)8.小擾動分析(Singular Perturbation)
objectives: 本課程主要介紹非線性系統的分析。重點著重於利用李亞普諾夫理論對穩定度作系統之分析，其他還包括輸入輸出之穩定分析，強健性設計及小擾動分析。 (The target of the course is to introduce the analysis of nonlinear systems including of the Lyapunov function based stability analysis, input-output analysis, robust control and singular perterbation. )

name:

syllabus: 本課程主要探討如何利用狀態空間方程式描述物理及工程系統，並分析線性系統的穩定性、控制性、觀察性、控制器及觀察器設計。此外，此課程也介紹了一些與控制系統課程相關定理的證明，讓學生能夠完全了解所用定理結果的前因後果。再者，此課程也會配合相關軟體，使學生能夠在理論與實驗搭配間更加了解線性系統概念。
objectives: 本課程主要探討線性系統其系統行為之描述，內容包括統之穩定性分析、觀察性分析及其控制器設計，並探討系統的物理觀念及其數學描述的各種方法，是線性系統之進階課程，適合碩士班以上之學生學習。

name:
賽局理論與應用
GAME THEORY AND APPLICATIONS
syllabus: Part I. 處理衝突的策略.(1) Zero-Sum Games, (2) Normal-Form Games with Complete Information, (3) Normal-Form Games with Incomplete Information, (4) Extensive-Form Games with Perfect Information, (5) Extensive-Form Games with Imperfect Information.Part II. 達成合作的策略.(5) Bargaining Games, (6) Correlated Games, (7) Multi-Stage Games, (8) Infinitely Repeated Games。Part II的主題未必會全部講授。Part III. 利益分配的策略.(9) Coalitional Games: Core, Bargaining Set, and Shapley Value.
objectives: ●賽局理論屬於「最佳化理論」的分支，研究「在每個人的決策都會互相影響的情況下，每個人該如何做決策，才能讓自己獲得最大利益」。也就是說，傳統的「最佳化理論」是研究「單人作決策的最佳化問題」，而「賽局理論」是研究「多人共同作決策的最佳化問題」。●另一方面，從「賽局理論所探討的主題」的角度來看，賽局理論亦可定義為一門科學，研究如何為賽局參與者提供最佳策略，以便「對付衝突」、「達成合作」、與「利益分配」。賽局理論的應用非常廣泛，除了傳統的經濟領域之外，亦包含「資訊安全」與「無線網路」等工程領域。●本課程會用到微分（透過微分求極值）和機率（貝氏定理和期望值）。沒修過「機率」相關課程的同學，不適合修這門課。

name:
數值電磁學
NUMERICAL ELECTROMAGNETICS
syllabus: 1. Basic Concept2. Finite Difference3. Treatment of Sources4. Absorbing Boundary Condition5. Frequency Domain Information
objectives: Elementary electromagnetics teaches how EM waves propagate in free space and ontransmission lines, and how plane waves reflect/transmit at material boundaries.There are closed-form analytical solutions for these kine of fundamental EMproblems. However, analytical solutions for practical engineering EM problemsare very difficult to obtain, if not at all impossible. To solve these problems,one must resort to numerical techniques. Traditionally, EM problems are solvedwith numerical methods in the frequency domain which have been prevailed forover a half century now. Due to the progress of computing power of moderncomputers, time-domain methods once deemed inpractical are now very appealingfor real-world EM problems. This class is about some basic ideas andimplementations of the finite-difference in time domain numerical method.

name:

objectives: 了解無線電與雷達等微波系統之操作原理與電路設計方法。

objectives: 介紹磁共振造影的原理與其在臨床上的應用。

name:
系統晶片測試

description:
《講授類》
開放大三、大四學生選修
※英語授課
tags: ['數位IC設計學程']
syllabus: 1. Introduction to VLSI testing concepts2. Fault models3. Fault simulation4. Test generation5. Testability analysis6. Design for testability7. Built-in self test8. Memory testing9. Board- and system-level testing
objectives: 1. Be able to explain the background knowledge of system-on-chip testing2. Be able to enumerate various fault models for system-on-chip testing and their different considerations, and apply them3. Be able to enumerate various fault simulation algorithms and their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit4. Be able to enumerate various test pattern generation algorithms and their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit5. Be able to enumerate various circuit testability analysis algorithms and their strengths and weaknesses, and apply them to a digital circuit6. Be able to enumerate various circuit redesign methods for testability improvement and be familiar with their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit7. Be able to enumerate various methods of implementing built-in self-test methods and hardware designs, be familiar with their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit8. Be able to enumerate fault models and test methods for memories, and the design of built-in self-test methods, and apply them to a digital circuit9. Be able to enumerate various design frameworks that provide system chip testing and their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=MEME516&Crsname=氫能與燃料電池原理與應用
name:
氫能與燃料電池原理與應用
PRINCIPLES AND APPLICATIONS OF HYDROGEN AND FUEL CELLS
tags: ['永續能源學程']
syllabus: 1.學習各種燃料電池之原理以及燃料電池電化學的轉換過程。從燃料電池的燃料供應、電化學理論、電池管理、電力轉換來瞭解燃料電池的重要步驟。2.了解燃料電池在日常生活中的應用、環保能源的開發、未來的發展。3.了解燃料電池系統設計與模擬分析。Fuel cells are being developed at an increasingly fast pace with many academic researchers entering the field. The study of fuel cells is growing in popularity, as well as materials science and engineering, and engineering may find the course useful and suitable.
objectives: This is an overview of Hydrogen Fuel cells. After completing this one semester course, the student should be capable of understanding electrochemical phenomena and control engineering and Thermodynamics ideas and gaseous behaviors.

name:
彈性力學
ELASTICITY
tags: ['南星產業樞紐學程']
syllabus: 1. Introduction (week1)2. Tensor Analysis (week2-week3)3. Analysis of Stress (week4-week5)4. Analysis of Strain (week6)5. Stress-Strain Relation (week7)6. Two-Dimensional Problems in Elasticity (week8)7. Stress Concentrations (week10)8. Failure Criteria (week11)9. Bending of Beams (week12)10. Exact and Approximate Solutions (week13)11. Torsion of Prismatic Bars (week14)12. Axisymmetrically Loaded Members (week15)13. Beams on Elastic Foundations (week16)14. Energy Methods (week17)
objectives: 彈性力學為研究所固體力學領域最基礎的課程，重要性不言而知，它基於大學部之材料力學及靜、動力學之背景，再深入探討三維之應力及應變、各種負載作用在不同之結構物，了解其應力及變形，評估破壞是否發生，確保可靠安全。

name:
有限元素法
FINITE ELEMENT METHODS
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MEME523.TXTFinite element method (FEM) uses numerical analysis to solve the boundary value problems and deformation when an object is subjected to load. The fundamental theories of FEM will be introduced in this course. Students will also be asked to analyse the stress and strain problems of the objects applied with load, by using commercial software (ANSYS or Abaqus).有限單元法是利用數值分析方法來計算固體受力之邊界值問題及變形。本課程將介紹有限單元基本理論，並透過實際操作常用之有限單元套裝軟體（ANSYS或Abaqus），分析物體受力之應力及變形行為。
objectives: The objective of the course is to introduce the basic theory, modeling techniques, and computational aspects of the finite element method.

name:
最佳化理論
OPTIMIZATION THEORY
syllabus: 本課程將會專注於以下重點:1. 基礎Matlab使用2. 最佳化理論簡介3. 連續型最佳化問題4. 離散型最佳化問題
objectives: 本課程將能使學生能夠:1.了解基礎最佳化理論2.使用不同演算法分析與解決各種最佳化問題

name:

PLASTICITY

tags: ['製造與大數據分析微學程', '跨領域智慧製造學程']
syllabus: 本門課的主要內容包括:介紹類神經網路的基本理論,回顧早前提出的各種類神經網路的架構及方法,說明資料先期及後期處理的重要性，講解數特徵變數萃取的方法，介紹各種類神經網路的架構、功能及使用方法。

objectives: 1.瞭解磨潤學的原理在高科技時代的重要性2.瞭解磨潤學的活用方法

name:
智慧製造與監測技術
SMART MANUFACTURING AND MONITORING TECHNOLOGY
tags: ['智慧港埠微學程', '智慧製造聯網微學程', '製造與大數據分析微學程', '碳流資訊盤查與低碳設計微學程', '跨領域智慧製造學程', '半導體設備工程學程']
syllabus: 傳授智慧製造系統與設備概念，使得修課同學習該系統的監測技術與感測器使用能力，並搭配APP軟體與無線通訊模組，實現智慧監測功能。為了讓同學具有相關實務經驗，也安排設備應用實例與操作課程。建立同學智慧製造學理技術與實務經驗。
objectives: 製造技術日新月異，搭配物聯網、感測器、監控技術與雲端系統，智慧製造環境儼然成形。本課程為智慧製造與工業4.0的入門介紹，除了雲端與數位製造概念說明，亦包含監控技術、感測器、APP軟體與實務範例介紹。教導學生相關理論與應用情境，搭配APP軟體授課與實做培養學生實務經驗。

name:
環境化學
ENVIRONMENTAL CHEMISTRY
tags: ['環境教育學程', '環境科技與管理學程', '半導體設備工程學程']
syllabus: This course includes total 8 chapters, the zero defines the relationship between science, biology and human activities; the first introduces the fundamental of chemistry; the second and third ones specify the chemical thermodynamic and kinetics, respectively; the fourth and fifth chapters discusses basis of aquatic chemistry, including chemical and redox equilibrium; the sixth focuses on the environmental analysis; the seventh and eighth try to elucidate the importance of interaction between water, air, soil and microbial systems.
objectives: The primary goal of environmental chemistry is to provide the thoughts, profession, definition and broad explanation of physical and chemical aspects involved in the spheres on earth to students.

name:
環境生物技術
ENVIRONMENTAL BIOTECHNOLOGY
tags: ['科技與環境英語微學程']
syllabus: This course mainly deals with environmental applications of bioprocesses and biotechnologies. Environment-friendly sustainable tools and technologies are reducing the pollution considerably.The course syllabus are as follows：1.	Microbiological Sampling.2.	Comparison of Biotechnological Treatment and Other Methods.3.	Recent Advances in Environmental Biotechnology.4.	Biodegradation of Pollutants.5.	Sustainable Production of Bioenergy or Value-Added Products by Biotechnologies.
objectives: Applied environmental biotechnology is the field of environmental science and biology that involves the use of living organisms and their by-products in solving environmental problems. It includes the pure biological sciences such as genetics, microbiology, biochemistry, and chemistry. In addition, the subjects from outside the sphere of biology, such as chemical engineering, bioprocess engineering, information technology, and biophysics are examined.

name:
環境電化學原理與技術
PRINCIPLE AND TECHNOLOGY OF ENVIRONMENTAL ELECTROCHEMISTRY
syllabus: Electrochemistry in the area of chemical engineering and material science has bbe applied for energy generation, such as electrocatalyst, supercapacitance, fuel cell, exchange membrane, ionic liquid. In recent years, environmental techniques, such as electro-Fenton,electrocoagulation, electro-redox, and electrophotochemistry, which involve electrochemistry are extensively studied. In order to explore the electrochemical knowledge for environmental engineering, the main chapters are designed to give basis of (1) fundamental of electrochemistry, (2) thermodynamics, (3) electrode kinetics, (4) mass transfer, (5) electro-analysis, (6) environmental redox and (7) applications and technology
objectives: This course specifies the fundamental of electrochemistry which focuses on the application and development of environmental technology.

name:
水及廢水分析
WATER AND WASTEWATER ANALYSIS
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 依照環保署公告標準方法進行水質分析試驗，並透過企業參訪與PASCO實驗了解環境檢測業工作概況與訓練團隊合作與邏輯思考能力。
objectives: 使學生熟習水及廢水分析之原理及實作技術，並訓練團隊合作與邏輯思考能力。

name:
廢棄物及土壤分析
SOLID WASTE AND SOIL ANALYSIS
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\ENVE545.TXT1. QA/QC for analysis2. Sampling methods for waste and soil3. Analytical methods for wastes: inorganic and organic4. Analytical methods for soils & sediments: inorganic and organic5. Experiments
objectives: Providing students various aspects of knowledge related to the sampling and analytical methods for selected wastes and soils

name:
空氣污染控制設計
AIR POLLUTION CONTROL & DESIGN
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\ENVE563.TXT本課程旨在介紹空氣污染物之控制技術及污染防治設備之設計原理，並藉由設計實習瞭解空氣污染控制設備之設計步驟與方法。課程內容包括旋風集塵器、重力沈降室、靜電集塵器、袋式集塵器、濕式洗塵器、活性碳吸附塔、廢氣吸收塔、廢氣焚化爐等空氣污染控制設備之操作技術及設計原理。
objectives: 藉由空氣污染控制設計案例實作，讓學生瞭解氣態及粒狀空氣污染物之控制技術及設計原理。

name:
廢棄物自然處理系統
NATURAL SYSTEMS FOR WASTE TREATMENT
tags: ['環境教育學程', '生物技術學程', '環境科技與管理學程']
syllabus: Treatment System Planning, Feasibility Assessment, and Site SelectionWetland Structures and FunctionsWetland System DesignAquatic Treatment SystemsWastewater Stabilization PondLand Treatment Systems1. Slow-rate Systems2. Overland-flow Systems3. Rapid-infiltration SystemsNatural Attenuation (NA)NA Application at Hazardous Waste SitesRisk Assessment and Model Application PhytoremediationSludge Management and TreatmentOn-site Wastewater Treatment SystemsEcological Engineering Methods
objectives: Introduction of natural systems for waste treatment.

teacher: 陳威翔,張耿崚,彭彥彬,施育仁,林淵淙,袁中新,陳則綸,高志明
syllabus: 依規定免登

name:
大氣模式特論
SPECIAL TOPICS ON ATMOSPHERIC MODELS
syllabus: 1.	Chemistry- Transport Models2.	Emission Modeling and Related Issues3.	Numerical Algorithms4.	Aerosol Modeling5.	Dynamical Aspects6.	Sensitivity Analysis7.	Multiphase Chemistry Modeling8.	Multiphase Chemistry Modeling9.	Data Assimilation and Inverse Modeling10.	Statistical Methods11.	Poster Session
objectives: The special topics of atmospheric model intends to teach graduate students to study the atmospheric diffusion model, receptor model and source model to understand the spreading and possible impact of air pollutants on environment.

name:
實驗方法設計
DESIGN OF EXPERIMENTAL METHODS
syllabus: 實驗研究法的設計目的主要是探究獨立變項與依變項之間的因果關係，實驗方法設計與實驗相關。本課程內容含括：指導研究生如何從資料檢索、實驗記錄撰寫、正確文獻搜尋及引用到實驗設計，培養其邏輯性及正確實驗操作觀念。
objectives: 使學生瞭解環境科學的整合概念、論文撰寫方法及實驗設計之變異性分析。

name:
儀器分析
PRINCIPLE OF INSTRUMENT ANALYSIS
tags: ['半導體設備工程學程']
syllabus: This lecture concentrates on the principle of instrument for environmental analysis and application.Four main topics will be introduced:1. Chromatography2. Spectroscopy3. Material chemical properties analysis4. Material physical properties analysis5. Electroanalytical Chemistry
objectives: Introducing the concept and principle of the instrument will help students to realize the environmental issue, like wastewater or polluted atmosphere throughproper instrument.

name:
計算機結構
COMPUTER ARCHITECTURES
syllabus: Instruction Set ArchitectureArithmetic DesignsSingle-Cycle Datapath/ControlPipelined DatapathMemory HierachyVirtual Multiprocessor
objectives: 本課程旨在涵蓋計算機在機器語言和組合語言層面上運行的基本概念。課程深入探討指令集架構的設計，並重點介紹精簡指令集計算機 (RISC) 和複雜指令集計算機 (CISC) 之間的差異。通過學習計算機的組成部分及其系統性能，學生將掌握基本的設計原理。

name:
演算法設計與分析
ALGORITHM DESIGN AND ANALYSIS
tags: ['巨量資料分析學程', '金融科技學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CSE510.TXTThe Complexity of Algorithms and the Lower Bounds of ProblemsThe Greedy MethodThe Divide-and-Conquer StrategyTree Searching StrategiesPrune-and-SearchDynamic ProgrammingThe Theory of NP-completenessApproximation AlgorithmsAmortized AnalysisRandomized Algorithms
objectives: 講授演算法的基本原理與設計策略，訓練學生設計演算法解決問題的能力，並使其熟悉演算法的分析方法，俾使學生能實際設計解題的方法。

name:
高等電腦網路
ADVANCED COMPUTER NETWORKS
tags: ['永續能源學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CSE515.TXTTCP/IP通訊協定為網際網路的基礎核心部份，本課程將介紹ＴＣＰ／ＩＰ的核心技術，並深入探討網際網路的應用程式如何架構於TCP/IP之上及如何運作.
objectives: 1.ISO MODEL AND THE TCP/IP PROTOCOL SUITE2.IP ADDRESSING3.SUBNETTING AND SUPERNETTING4.DELIBERY AND ROUTING OF IP PACKERS5.INTERNET PROTOCOL(IP)6.ARP AND RARP7.INTERNET CONTROL MESSANG PROTOCOL (ICMP)8.INTERNET GROUP MANAGEMENT PROTOCOL (IGMP)9.USER DATAGRAM PROTOCOL (UDP)10.TRANSMISSION CONTROL PROTOCOL(TCP)11.ROUTING PROTOCOLS (RIP,OSPF,AND BGP)12.APPLICATION LAYER AND CLIENT-SERVER MODEL13.HYERTEXT TRANSFER PROTOCOL (HTTP)14.WORLD WIDE WEB (WWW)15.SOCKET INTERFACE

name:
高等作業系統
ADVANCED OPERATING SYSTEMS
syllabus: This course aims at the advanced issues of operating systems, including(1) Virtual-memory management(2) System protection & security(3) Distributed operating systems(4) Real-time systems(5) Multimedia systems
objectives: The objective of this course is to help graduate students learn the designing and research issues of operating systems. Students need to take the undergraduate OS course as the prerequisite.

name:
進階資料探勘
ADVANCED DATA MINING
syllabus: 1. Introduction to Data Mining2. Brief Review of Fundamental Data Mining3. Topics of Advanced Data Mining
objectives: Due to the increasing usage of very large databases and data warehouses, mining useful information and helpful knowledge from data sets has been evolving into an important research area. Data mining involves applying specific algorithms for extracting patterns or rules from data sets in a particular representation. In the course, we will focus on advanced data mining topics in addition to a brief review of fundamental data mining concepts and techniques. We hope the course can provide the learners a variety of mining problems and related algorithms and applications.

name:
類比積體電路設計
ANALONG INTEGRATED CIRCUIT DESIGN
tags: ['半導體元件學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CSE598.TXT1. Integrated systems Fabrication technologies, Integrated vs. discrete Active and passive devices in integrated systems2. Single-stage amplifiers, Common-source, Source-follower, Common-gate, Cascode stage, Intrinsic gain limitation vs. technology node3. Differential amplifiers, Single-ended and differential operation, Differential pairs, Common mode Differential amplifiers in integrated systems4. Passive and active current mirrors, Basic current mirrors, Cascode current mirrors, Active current mirrors.5. Frequency response Integrated amplifiers and frequency response.6. Feedback systems, Feedback Topologies Effects of feedback on frequency response.7. Noise, Thermal noise, Device noise, and Noise in amplifier structures8. Operational amplifiers, Performance Parameters, One-stage op-amp topologies, Multiple-stage op-amp topologies, Frequency stability and compensation, Operational transimpedance amplifiers (OTAs).9. Bandgap references, Supply-independent biasing, Temperature independent references Architectures.
objectives: Study the design and implementation of analog integrated circuits. Focus on the transistor-level design of circuits using modern CMOS semiconductor fabrication processes. The blocks and circuit architectures discussed are the core components of most integrated systems and are essential in communications, multimedia, imaging, sensors, and biomedical applications. Provide a device-oriented overview of integrated circuits and silicon fabrication processes and their ramifications on the transistor models. Various amplifier topologies in ICs using these devices are discussed, and also examine in detail topics such as frequency response, linearity, biasing, feedback, operational amplifiers, compensation, and noise.

name:
三維模型設計及三維列印
3D MODELING AND 3D PRINTING
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CSE602.TXT1. 3D modeling: basics and tips2. Computer-aided design software3. 3D printing: basics and tips4. Special topics on 3D designs and 3D printing
objectives: This course aims to provide an environment for makers to build things with 3D printing technologies. Students will be given the general idea and tips regarding 3D design and 3D printing, and will be challenged with three mini projects and one final term project that show not only what they learn but also the creativity.

objectives: Students are expected to understand- basic concepts of machine learning- deep learning models

ENGLISH TECHNICAL WRITING
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CSE639.TXT(If COVID restrictions require any weeks to be online, we meet at: meet.google.com/qpx-vkmz-dnk)This course is designed to introduce various English technical writing formats and requirements to computer science and engineering students. It provides some basic training to improve students' English writing and organization skills. Lectures and workshops are conducted in English. There are in-class exercises, quizzes, and homework written assignments. Students are expected to participate actively in lectures, workshops, and presentation sessions.
objectives: Goals:1)	Introduce various technical writing formats and requirements2)	Provide general guidelines for technical writing3)	Improve students general English writing and organization skills4)	Strengthen students communication and presentation skills5)	Enhance students' proof-reading ability by reviewing common mistakes in technical writing6)	Prepare students to write their journal papers, theses, or dissertation in English7) Understand the proper use of AI tools in writing

objectives: In this class, we aim to give basic treatment knowledge of the discrete-time signal processing including linear systems, sampling, filtering and filter design, reconstruction, the discrete-time Fourier and z-transforms, Fourier analysis of signals, the fast Fourier transform, and spectral estimation. syllabus: Organic Photovoltaics: Mechanisms, Materials, and Devices■General Overviews■Mechanisms and Modeling■Materials and Devices1.bulk heterojunction solar cells; 2.organic solar cells incorporating a p-i-n junction; 3.liquid-crystal approaches to OPVs; 4.OPVs based on nanoporous titania films; 5.semiconductor quantum dots based on nanocomposite; 6.OPVs based on conjugated polymers/carbon nanotubes; 7.OPVs based on Polythiophene/C60.
objectives: Sunlight is an unlimited (renewable and thus sustainable), clean, and readily available energy source, which can be exploited even at remote sites where the generation and distribution of electric power present a challenge. Today, any crude oil supply crisis or environmental degradation concern resulting from fossil fuel burning has prompted both people and government to consider solar energy resource more seriously.

name:
有機半導體材料專題
SPECIAL TOPICS: ORGANIC SEMICONDUCTING MATERIALS
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\EO5041.TXTThe science and technology of organic conducting materials are inherently interdisciplinary; They fall at the intersection of three established disciplines: chemistry, physics and engineering. The field of organic semiconductors remains vital; again and again the science and technology have moved into new directions. Specific examples of recent advances of special importance include the following:1.organic semiconductors which are stable, soluble and processible, and therefore suitable for industrial applications;2.the science and technology of high-efficiency light emission from OLEDs and PLEDs;3.ultrafast photoinduced electron transfer in organic semiconductors mixed with controlled amounts of acceptors; this phenomenon has opened the way to a variety of applications including high-sensitivity plastic photodiodes, and efficient plastic solar cells;4.organic semiconductors as materials for solid-state lasers.
objectives: The science and technology of organic conducting materials are inherently interdisciplinary; They fall at the intersection of three established disciplines: chemistry, physics and engineering. These organic materials are synthesized by the method of organic chemistry. Their electronic structure and electronic properties fall within the domain of condensed mater physics. Efficient processing of organic materials into useful forms and the fabrication of electronic and opto-electronic devices require input from engineering.

name:
液晶光電材料
LIQUID CRYSTAL OPTOELECTRONIC MATERIALS
syllabus: 1. Introduction of liquid crystals (molecular structures, orientational order, dielectric & elastic  properties).2. Liquid crystals optics (polarization, birefringence, reflection of cholesteric liquid crystals).3. Optical modeling methods (Jones matrix method, Mueller matrix method).4. Effects of Electric field on Liquid Crystals (Dielectric Interaction, flexoelectric effect).5. Freedericksz transition (Statics & Dynamics transition).6. Liquid Crystal Materials (Refractive indices, dielectric & elastic constants).7. Modeling of liquid crystal director configuration (Electric energy of liquid crystals, modeling the  electric field).8. Liquid crystal display matrices, drive schemes and bistable displays (transmissive, reflective, and  bistable LCD).9. Liquid crystal/polymer composites (PDLC, PNLC, and PSCT).10. Tunable liquid crystal photonic devices (Lens, grating, laser).
objectives: 讓學生對光電材料有多一點的認識，本課程將著重於液晶材料，介紹液晶獨特的物理以及光學特性，並學習如何設計可調式液晶光電元件。

name:
高分子合成與反應
SYNTHESIS AND REACTIONS OF POLYMERS
tags: ['有機和材料合成學程']
syllabus: 1. Introduction2. Step polymerization Synthesis: Reactivity of functional groups, Kinetics of step polymerization, Molecular weight determination and control, Crosslinking and crosslinking technology, Newer polymers and polymerizations, inorganic and organometallic polymers.3. Radical chain polymerization: Rates of radical chain polymerization, Initiation, Molecular weight, Chain transfer, Inhibition and retardation, Energetic characterizations, Auto acceleratio and Process conditions.4. Emulsion polymerization: Description of condition and quantitative aspects.5. Ionic chain polymerization: Initiation, Propagation, Chain transfer and terminations of anionic and cationic polymerizations, Block copolymer and carbonyl polymerization.6. Chain copolymerization: Copolymer composition, Radical and ionic copolymerizations, Copolymerizations involving dienes and other copolymerizations.7. New branches of polymer and their synthesis.
objectives: After completing this course the student should be able to:1. Know the polymerization reactions of various commonly used polymers.2. understand the basic polymer synthesis reaction methods, reaction mechanisms, and the relationship between reaction conditions and the molecular weight, chemical structure.3. Understand the basic chemical structure and the pathways of various organic polymerization reactions.

objectives: 課程的目標是讓研究生熟悉基本的電磁理論與量子物理知識，以培養學生在光電與材料科學領域之深入研究之興趣並加強基礎能力，以培養從事尖端奈米科學相關研究所需的基本能力和正確觀念。

Crystallization, Melting and Glass Transition7. Polymer Blend and Solution8. Physical Properties of Polymers9. Surface Properties of Polymers10. Self-Assembly Structure of Block Copolymer to Mesoporous Materials11. Biomacromolecules12. Polymer Nanocomposites
objectives: 本課程將首先介紹軟物質的種類，包含了高分子，液晶，界面活性劑，膠體及生物高分子。另外也介紹軟物質在奈米及自組裝材料的應用。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=MOES546&Crsname=電子顯微鏡於軟物質研究之應用
name:
電子顯微鏡於軟物質研究之應用
ELECTRON MICROSCOPY FOR SOFT MATERIALS
tags: ['半導體製程模組學程', '半導體設備工程學程']
syllabus: 本課程主要介紹各種電子顯微鏡於軟物質研究上之應用，包括電子顯微鏡成像原理及電子束與軟物質之反應、結晶性與無定形分子材料之形態觀察以及試片之製備方法。最後介紹電子繞射原理、結晶結構之鑑定、暗視野影像技術與應用及新穎三維斷層造影電子顯微鏡之成象。
objectives: 藉由課程內容之規劃，使學生充分了解如何利用電子顯微鏡取得軟物質影像與試片製備之方法，並了解其成像原理以應用於軟物質研究課題。

name:
半導體元件
SEMICONDUCTOR DEVICE
tags: ['半導體物理與先進元件分析微學程', '半導體製程模組學程', '類比射頻IC設計學程', '半導體設備工程學程', '半導體元件學程']
syllabus: 1.Introduction to crystals2.Energy bands and carrier concentration in thermal equilibrium3.Carrier transport phenomena4.P-N junction5.Metal-Semiconductor Diode (M-S Contact)6.Metal Oxide Semiconductor (MOS) Diode7.Metal Oxide Semiconductor Field Effect Transistor (MOSFET)8.Non-ideal MOSFET effects & short channel effects
objectives: 本課程介紹半導體元件的動作原理與物理機制，使學生建立半導體物理與元件的基本知識，進而對未來半導體元件的研究與應用產生興趣。

name:
凝態理論
CONDENSED MATTER THEORY
syllabus: 1. Crystal structure2. Wave diffraction and the reciprocal lattice3. Crystal binding and elastic constants4. Free electron Fermi gas5. Energy bands6. Semiconductor crystals7. phonon
objectives: Students should learn the theoretical framework of the condensed matter physics, in particular, solid state physics. From periodic structures, we can arrive at the concept of reciprocal lattice. This concept and the later introduced Bloch's theorem lead to the band structure. Thereafter we would be able to classify materials into metals, semiconductors, and insulators.

name:
專題研究（一）
INDEPENDENT STUDIES(I)
description:
《獨立研究》
有機高分子相關專題。學生選課前請先與指導教授洽談。
syllabus: Week 1-3: Introduction to Polymer Research•	Lecture: Overview of Polymer Science and Research Trends•	Reading: Selected chapters from a polymer science textbook•	Lab: Introduction to laboratory techniques and equipmentWeek 3-6: Polymer Chemistry and Synthesis•	Lecture: Polymerization Methods (Addition, Condensation, Ring-Opening)•	Reading: Articles on recent advancements in polymer synthesis•	Lab: Synthesis of simple polymers and characterization techniquesWeek 7-9: Polymer Processing and Fabrication•	Lecture: Processing Techniques (e.g., extrusion, injection molding, blow molding)•	Reading: Case studies on polymer processing•	Lab: Polymer processing workshop with hands-on activitiesWeek 10-12: Polymers in Environmental Applications•	Lecture: Polymers for Water Treatment, Pollution Control, and Biodegradable Polymers•	Reading: Articles on sustainable polymer technologies•	Lab: Design and testing of polymer systems for environmental applicationsWeek 13-15: Research Methodology and Proposal Writing•	Lecture: Research Design, Proposal Writing, and Data Analysis•	Reading: Guidelines and examples of research proposals•	Lab: Workshop on writing research proposals and conducting literature reviewsWeek 15-18: Student Presentations and Feedback•	Lecture: Preparing and Delivering Effective Presentations•	Lab: Student presentations on research proposals or findings•	Feedback Session: Peer and instructor feedback on presentations
objectives: This course teaches students theoretical and practical skills for advanced polymer science research and its many applications. Course completion should allow students to:1. Learn Polymer BasicsLearn polymer science basics including polymerization, structure, and characteristics. Clearly understand polymer chemistry and its applications.2. Use CharacterizationMaster polymer property analysis utilizing characterization tools. Outcome: Conduct and analyze NMR, FTIR, GPC, DSC, and other tests.3. Use polymer processingLearn and use polymer processing methods to make polymer products. Shape polymers using extrusion, injection molding, and blow molding.4. Examine Polymer UsesExamine polymer utilization in biological, environmental, electrical, and energy applications. Develop, test, and offer polymer-based solutions and innovations for particular needs.

name:
專題研究（三）
INDEPENDENT STUDIES(III)
description:
《獨立研究》
有機高分子相關專題。學生選課前請先與指導教授洽談。
syllabus: Week 1-3: Polymer Characterization Techniques•	Lecture: Techniques for Characterizing Polymers (e.g., NMR, FTIR, GPC, DSC)•	Reading: Selected journal articles on characterization methods•	Lab: Hands-on experience with characterization toolsWeek 4-6: Physical Properties of Polymers•	Lecture: Mechanical, Thermal, and Optical Properties of Polymers•	Reading: Papers on the relationship between polymer structure and properties•	Lab: Experiments on tensile testing, thermal analysis, and optical microscopyWeek 7-9: Polymers in Biomedical Applications•	Lecture: Polymers for Drug Delivery, Tissue Engineering, and Medical Devices•	Reading: Recent research articles on biomedical polymer applications•	Lab: Preparation and analysis of polymer-based biomedical materialsWeek 10-12: Polymers in Electronics and Energy•	Lecture: Conductive Polymers, Polymers for Energy Storage, and Flexible Electronics•	Reading: Research on polymers in electronic and energy applications•	Lab: Fabrication and testing of polymer-based electronic devicesWeek 13-15: Research Methodology and Proposal Writing•	Lecture: Research Design, Proposal Writing, and Data Analysis•	Reading: Guidelines and examples of research proposals•	Lab: Workshop on writing research proposals and conducting literature reviewsWeek 16-18: Student Presentations and Feedback•	Lecture: Preparing and Delivering Effective Presentations•	Lab: Student presentations on research proposals or findings•	Feedback Session: Peer and instructor feedback on presentations
objectives: This course covers polymer science from basics to cutting-edge research. Course completion should allow students to:1. Understand Polymer Basics: Master polymer chemistry, including polymerization, structure-property correlations, and environmental behavior. Explain polymer science ideas and apply them to real-world and research situations.2. Learn Experimental Methods: Develop polymer synthesis and characterisation abilities, including sophisticated experimental methods. Successfully conduct and evaluate experiments employing spectroscopy, chromatography, microscopy, and rheology.3. Make Theory Practical: Merge theory and practice via lab work and case studies.In polymer research, apply theoretical principles to real problems and advances.4. Assess, innovate applications: Evaluate polymers in many sectors and develop novel uses using current research and developing technology. Develop polymer-based solutions for medical, environmental, electronics, and energy problems.5. Conduct Thorough Research Objective: Improve abilities in question formulation, experiment design, data analysis, and conclusion drafting. Write a critical, methodologically rigorous, and unique research project or proposal.6. Communicate Scientific Findings Objective: Improve research presentation abilities via written reports and oral presentations. Give compelling presentations and create extensive reports that explain study results and consequences.7. Address Multidisciplinary Effects: Understand how polymer science affects society and the environment via its interactions with other sciences and engineering.Outcome: Assess polymers' multidisciplinary uses and their influence on global issues including sustainability and health.8. Encourage Collaboration: Foster cooperation and collaboration via group projects and peer interactions.Work well in teams, contribute to initiatives, provide constructive comments, and learn from peers.9. Follow research trends: Critically assess and keep up with polymer science research and technology. Discuss polymer research advances and future goals to influence research and application strategies.10. Lab Reports: Evaluate experimental methodologies and data analysis abilities.Research proposal/project: Assess research topics, design, methods, and new solutions.

name:
材料化學
MATERIALS CHEMISTRY
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MOES591.TXT1. The basic content of material chemistry, including the structure, properties and preparation of materials.2. High-performance materials and functional materials.
objectives: This course will combine materials science and chemistry, so the relationship between material structure and its performance can be understood from the molecular level to the macroscopic scale. Furthermore, this knowledge will be able to improve the properties of materials and expand their applications.

name:
生醫材料
BIOMATERIALS
syllabus: In this course, biomaterials that can be resulting from metals, ceramics and polymers will be introduced in terms of their material features and corresponding biomedical applications. In particular, the chemical structures, chemical characterization, bio-related properties of biomedical polymers will particularly be emphasized and compared with ceramics and metals. Following the introduction of biomaterials, the fundamental cellular structure, molecular biology and the interactions between cells and biomaterials will further be given. Lastly, the basic design, preparation and evaluation of polymeric biomaterials will be instructed.
objectives: After finishing the course, the students are expected to have essential knowledge and concepts in biomaterials science and molecular biotechnology for designing and preparing advanced biomaterials and their related devices for various biomedical applications, for example, tissue engineering, drug carriers, implant devices, therapeutic agent design and wound dressings.

name:
工程英文寫作
ENGLISH TECHNICAL WRITING
syllabus: For long-distance teaching, we will use Google Meet.Effective written and oral presentation skills are crucial for success at multinational companies, international scholarly programs, and international conferences. This course will cover core topics such as wording, sentence structuring, and in-text citations. Conceptual topics will also be discussed, including effective figure making and useful presentation skills. Throughout this course, there will be exercises such as in-class discussions, writing assignments, and group presentations.
objectives: This course aims to strengthen English communication skills in technical environments. Exercises in this class will present suitable challenges to help students become more effective communicators. Upon completion of this course, the students will have drafted a mock academic article, led group discussions, and presented an oral technical report. Sections of the course will also be devoted to formating, working, formulating a written graduate thesis.

tags: ['數位IC設計學程']
syllabus: Lecture 1 : Introduction to System-on-chip DesignLecture 2 : Basic Verilog Coding for Combinational Building BlocksLecture 3 : Basic Verilog Coding for Sequential LogicsLecture 4 : CPU Design BasicsLecture 5 : Pipelined CPU DesignLecture 6 : RTL Coding GuidelinesLecture 7 : Introduction to Design for Testability (DFT) and ReliabilityLecture 8 : Design Verification
objectives: You will learn to model digital circuit designs with Verilog and to use commercial CAD tools for system simulation, synthesis, scan chain insertion, ATPG, and APR of dedicated CPU designs.

description:
《講授類》

syllabus: Instruction Set ArchitectureArithmetic DesignsSingle-Cycle Datapath/ControlPipelined DatapathMemory HierachyVirtual Multiprocessor
objectives: The course aims to cover the essential concepts of how computers operate at the machine and assembly language levels. It delves into the design of instruction set architecture and highlights the differences between Reduced Instruction Set Computers (RISC) and Complex Instruction Set Computers (CISC). By studying the components of a computer and its system performance, students will gain knowledge of fundamental design principles

name:

description:
《講授類》
與電機碩併班上課
※英語授課
tags: ['數位IC設計學程']

objectives: 1. Be able to explain the background knowledge of system-on-chip testing2. Be able to enumerate various fault models for system-on-chip testing and their different considerations, and apply them3. Be able to enumerate various fault simulation algorithms and their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit4. Be able to enumerate various test pattern generation algorithms and their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit5. Be able to enumerate various circuit testability analysis algorithms and their strengths and weaknesses, and apply them to a digital circuit6. Be able to enumerate various circuit redesign methods for testability improvement and be familiar with their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit7. Be able to enumerate various methods of implementing built-in self-test methods and hardware designs, be familiar with their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit8. Be able to enumerate fault models and test methods for memories, and the design of built-in self-test methods, and apply them to a digital circuit9. Be able to enumerate various design frameworks that provide system chip testing and their advantages and disadvantages, and apply them to a digital circuit

Design and Simulation of OTA6. Architecture, System and Circuit Level Design7. Circuit Design in Advanced Process8. Layout and ESD
objectives: After the completion of this course, the students would learn1. how to design the reference circuits and OTA.2. how to simulate the circuits with HSPICE3. how to analysis the circuit in system level4. how to simulate the circuit in system level5. how to complete the IC tapeout

name:
數位信號處理
DIGITAL SIGNAL PROCESSING
description:
《講授類》
與通訊碩併班上課
syllabus: 1. Lecture 01-Discrete Time Signals2. Lecture 02-Discrete Time Systems(I)3. Lecture 03-Discrete Time Systems(II)4. Lecture 04-Fourier Domain5. Lecture 05-The Z Transform6. Lecture 06-Sampling of Continuous-Time Signals7. Lecture 07-Changing the Sampling Rate8. Lecture 08-Discrete Fourier Transform9. Lecture 09-Short-Time Fourier Transform10. Lecture 10-Transform-Domain Systems11. Lecture 11-Filters-Introduction12. Lecture 12-Filter Types and Structures13. Lecture 13-Filter Design - IIR14. Lecture 14-Filter Design - FIR15. Lecture 15-Fast Fourier Transform
objectives: In this class, we aim to give basic treatment knowledge of the discrete-time signal processing including linear systems, sampling, filtering and filter design, reconstruction, the discrete-time Fourier and z-transforms, Fourier analysis of signals, the fast Fourier transform, and spectral estimation. We will teach the basic theory for each of the transform domains and provide illustrative examples.

name:
類比積體電路設計
ANALOG INTEGRATED CIRCUIT DESIGN
description:
《講授類》
與資工碩併班上課
syllabus: 1. Integrated systems Fabrication technologies, Integrated vs. discrete Active and passive devices in integrated systems2. Single-stage amplifiers, Common-source, Source-follower, Common-gate, Cascode stage, Intrinsic gain limitation vs. technology node3. Differential amplifiers, Single-ended and differential operation, Differential pairs, Common mode Differential amplifiers in integrated systems4. Passive and active current mirrors, Basic current mirrors, Cascode current mirrors, Active current mirrors.5. Frequency response Integrated amplifiers and frequency response.6. Feedback systems, Feedback Topologies Effects of feedback on frequency response.7. Noise, Thermal noise, Device noise, and Noise in amplifier structures8. Operational amplifiers, Performance Parameters, One-stage op-amp topologies, Multiple-stage op-amp topologies, Frequency stability and compensation, Operational transimpedance amplifiers (OTAs).9. Bandgap references, Supply-independent biasing, Temperature independent references Architectures.
objectives: Study the design and implementation of analog integrated circuits. Focus on the transistor-level design of circuits using modern CMOS semiconductor fabrication processes. The blocks and circuit architectures discussed are the core components of most integrated systems and are essential in communications, multimedia, imaging, sensors, and biomedical applications. Provide a device-oriented overview of integrated circuits and silicon fabrication processes and their ramifications on the transistor models. Various amplifier topologies in ICs using these devices are discussed, and also examine in detail topics such as frequency response, linearity, biasing, feedback, operational amplifiers, compensation, and noise

name:
抗量子密碼學應用
APPLICATIONS OF QUANTUM-RESISTANT CRYPTOGRAPHY
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CSE503.TXTThe field of post-quantum cryptography has recently arisen, and its effects are expected to be long-lasting. This course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of the quantum-resistant methodology for developing diverse cryptosystems. In addition, this course also emphasizes certain NIST standards. The pupils will be requested to do exercises in order to develop these skills.
objectives: The aims of this course are as follows:a. Assist students in comprehending several quantum-resistant methodologies.b. Encourage students to develop Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) techniques that can address practical issues in daily life.c. Improve cognitive skills to independently resolve computational issues.

name:
計算機結構
COMPUTER ARCHITECTURES
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CSE506.TXTInstruction Set ArchitectureArithmetic DesignsSingle-Cycle Datapath/ControlPipelined DatapathMemory HierachyVirtual Multiprocessor
objectives: The course aims to cover the essential concepts of how computers operate at the machine and assembly language levels. It delves into the design of instruction set architecture and highlights the differences between Reduced Instruction Set Computers (RISC) and Complex Instruction Set Computers (CISC). By studying the components of a computer and its system performance, students will gain knowledge of fundamental design principles

name:
演算法設計與分析
ALGORITHM DESIGN AND ANALYSIS
tags: ['巨量資料分析學程', '金融科技學程']
syllabus: The Complexity of Algorithms and the Lower Bounds of ProblemsThe Greedy MethodThe Divide-and-Conquer StrategyTree Searching StrategiesPrune-and-SearchDynamic ProgrammingThe Theory of NP-completenessApproximation AlgorithmsAmortized AnalysisRandomized Algorithms
objectives: 講授演算法的基本原理與設計策略，訓練學生設計演算法解決問題的能力，並使其熟悉演算法的分析方法，俾使學生能實際設計解題的方法。

name:
密碼學
CRYPTOGRAPHY
tags: ['軟體工程學程', '資通安全學程']
syllabus: 1. Fundamental Mathematics of Cryptography2. Symmetry-based Cryptographic Techniques3. Public-key Cryptographic Techniques4. Cryptanalysis5. Concept of Security Model and Proofs
objectives: 1.Establishment of the discipline of diverse cryptographic techniques2. Concept of security in cryptography3. Evaluation of security in cryptography

name:
高等電腦網路
ADVANCED COMPUTER NETWORKS
tags: ['永續能源學程']
syllabus: TCP/IP通訊協定為網際網路的基礎核心部份，本課程將介紹ＴＣＰ／ＩＰ的核心技術，並深入探討網際網路的應用程式如何架構於TCP/IP之上及如何運作.
objectives: 1.ISO MODEL AND THE TCP/IP PROTOCOL SUITE2.IP ADDRESSING3.SUBNETTING AND SUPERNETTING4.DELIBERY AND ROUTING OF IP PACKERS5.INTERNET PROTOCOL(IP)6.ARP AND RARP7.INTERNET CONTROL MESSANG PROTOCOL (ICMP)8.INTERNET GROUP MANAGEMENT PROTOCOL (IGMP)9.USER DATAGRAM PROTOCOL (UDP)10.TRANSMISSION CONTROL PROTOCOL(TCP)11.ROUTING PROTOCOLS (RIP,OSPF,AND BGP)12.APPLICATION LAYER AND CLIENT-SERVER MODEL13.HYERTEXT TRANSFER PROTOCOL (HTTP)14.WORLD WIDE WEB (WWW)15.SOCKET INTERFACE

name:
數位簽章機制與應用
DIGITAL SIGNATURE SCHEMES AND APPLICATIONS
tags: ['資通安全學程']
syllabus: 本課程將介紹數位簽章技術，並探討數位簽章之應用。
objectives: 1. 使學生熟悉數位簽章技術2. 培養學生數位簽章協定設計能力3. 訓練學生研發數位簽章應用4. 建立學生安全證明觀念

name:
駭客攻防與電腦鑑識技術
HACK TECHNOLOGY & COMPUTER FORENSIC
tags: ['資通安全學程']
syllabus: 本課程主要教授進階駭客攻防技術研討，透過瞭解駭客行為，防禦的措施等技術，達到保護網路及系統安全的目的。此外也加入電腦鑑識(Computer Forensic)的相關方法，並探討學術研究論文在這些技術上面發展之現況，課程理論與實務並重。主要的內容大綱包括：1. 進階網路駭客攻防與系統駭客攻防2. 高階滲透測試原理與實務3. 網站安全測試技術與模糊測試原理4. 入侵偵測分析理論與實務5. 電腦鑑識技術理論與實務6. 駭客偵測防禦與機器學習技術7. 相關論文研討
objectives: 深入了解駭客攻擊的原理與如何透過各項工具與腳本語言如 Python 等進行偵測與防禦。在技術面包括了解網路通訊原理及攻擊防禦技術、作業系統原理及安全漏洞偵防、鑑識證據搜集及保存等。此外，本課程亦強調實務演練，希望同學們能在學完相關內容之後，能夠獲得實際駭客運作與安全防禦之經驗，也能進行深入的學術研究。知己知彼，透過各種實驗來增進學生的攻防技術能力。

name:
高等作業系統
ADVANCED OPERATING SYSTEMS
syllabus: This course aims at the advanced issues of operating systems, including(1) Virtual-memory management(2) System protection & security(3) Distributed operating systems(4) Real-time systems(5) Multimedia systems
objectives: The objective of this course is to help graduate students learn the designing and research issues of operating systems. Students need to take the undergraduate OS course as the prerequisite.

name:
資訊安全理論與實務
INFORMATION SECURITY THEORY AND PRACTICE
tags: ['資通安全學程']
syllabus: 1. Establish the concept of security in the researches of applied cryptography and secure protocols.2. Learn how to design security systems for computer and communications systems by applied cryptography.3. Understand performance evaluation of security systems in computer and communications systems.
objectives: This course will help students to build up the essential disciplines of designing, developing, and implementing security systems for computer and communications systems. The disciplines include the concept of theoretical security, design of security systems, and performance evaluation of security systems in practice.

name:
網路安全專題
INDEPENDENT STUDIES IN CYBERSECURITY
syllabus: Cybersecurity is an essential study that involves safeguarding networks, systems, and programs from digital intrusions. This course will assist students in the development of cybersecurity concepts and the design of security mechanisms.
objectives: The objectives of this course are as follows:a. Utilize contemporary security methodologies to assist students in comprehending a variety of cybersecurity mechanisms.b. Facilitate the development of practical safety measures that can address common issues in daily life.c. Improve the capacity to autonomously solve problems through the development of critical thinking skills.

name:
大型再生能源電力系統專題
INDEPENDENT STUDIES IN LARGE-SCALE RENEWABLE ENERGY POWER SYSTEMS
syllabus: Renewable energy grid integration requirements and challengesGrid codes and ancillary service requirementsGrid integration challenges and mitigationsRecent technology innovations in renewable energy grid integrationPower system operation and stability management with large scale renewable energy penetration
objectives: This course will help students to familiarize with and gain insight into recent experiences, technological innovations, and progress in large scale renewable energy grid integration.

name:
高等電機機械理論分析
ADVANCED ELECTRIC MACHINERY THEORY
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IMPE5017.TXTElectromagnetic circuits: Basics of magnetic field; magnetic circuit analysis; electromagnetic induction; induced emf; ac excitation; eddy current loss.Single-phase transformers: Construction and working; ideal and practical transformers; equivalent circuit and modelling of practical transformer; voltage regulation and efficiency; testing of transformer; auto-transformer.Three-phase transformers: Construction and working; connections of three-phase transformers; phase-groups of three-phase transformer; modelling, analysis and testing of three-phase transformers.Electromechanical energy conversion: Basics of electromechanical energy conversion devices; production of torque for permanent magnet and electromagnet.DC generators: Construction and working; commutation; armature reaction; types of generators; voltage regulation and efficiencyDC motors: Characteristics and working; types of dc motors; speed control; losses and efficiency test.Synchronous machines: Operation principle and construction; excitation system; equivalent system and phasor diagram; open circuit and short circuit tests.
objectives: 1: Basics of Electromagnetic circuits.2: Operation principle, construction, analysis, and modelling of single-phase transformers.3: Circuit testing, parameter determination, voltage regulation, loss analysis and efficiency calculations of single-phase transformers.4: Working principle, analysis, connections and testing of three phase transformers.5: Basics of electromechanical energy conversion devices6: Construction, working, and analysis of dc generators.7: Operation principle, analysis and testing of synchronous machines.

Newly developed power flow formulations6. Three phase distribution power flow calculation7. Sensitivity calculation8. DC power flow9. State estimation10. Optimal power flow
objectives: To provide a firm understanding of power network modeling, solution techniques, and optimization methods related to power system load flow analysis and its applications.

Modeling of the converter and various soft-switching techniques are included, too. Finally, the enrolled students have to finish hardware implementation of a DC/DC converter during this course.

name:
最佳化理論
OPTIMIZATION THEORY
syllabus: 1. Introduction to Optimization2. Matrix differentiation3. Convex set and convex function4. Convex optimization problems5. Duality6. Unconstrained minimization7. Equality constrained minimization8. Karash-Kuhn-Tucker (KKT) conditions9. Interior point method10. Factional optimization theory
objectives: The main goal of this course is to introduce the convex optimization concepts and methods, including convex set, convex function, various convex optimization problem, K.K.T. conditions, duality, etc., and their applications to the wireless communications and signal processing. We expect a student who finishes the course is well equipped to handle optimization problems.

name:
高等通訊工程數學
ADVANCED MATHEMATICS IN COMMUNICATIONS ENGINEERING
tags: ['半導體製程模組學程']
syllabus: The course covers probability, statistics, and linear algebra concepts with applications to communications. The students are expected to i) use fundamental properties and theorems of probability theory, sample spaces, events, and random variables to model and interpret the real-life phenomena, ii) apply sampling to a large data set for statistical inference - Statistical (random process) modeling of an empirical process is based on the laws of probability theory. Statistical models are essential for analyses and developments in several fields including communications, iii) utilize matrix computations to analyze eigenvalues and eigenvectors, and matrix decomposition including singular value decomposition (SVD).
objectives: Students will learn the mathematics required in communication theory.

name:
通信系統性能評估

syllabus: 1. Probability2. Random Variables3. Transform Theory4. Random Processes5. Birth-Death Queueing Systems6. Markovian Queues in Equilibrium7. Simulation Techniques8. Case Studies
objectives: This course aims to introduce the concepts of performance evaluation techniques for communications systems.Prerequisite: Elementary course on probability theory and stochastic processes

name:
機器學習
MACHINE LEARNING
syllabus: Units Topics1. Linear Regression and linear classification2. Nearest Neighbor and Clustering3. Statistical Learning and Bayesian Learning4. Classification with Mixture of Gaussians, Logistic Regression, and Generalized linear models5. Kernel Methods and Gaussian Process6. Support Vector Machines7. Convolution Neural Networks and Deep learning
objectives: This course is an introductory survey of modern machine learning. We will learn the concepts behind several machine learning and reinforcement learning algorithms without going deeply into mathematics and gain practical experience applying them. We will consider artificial intelligence perspectives, making the course valuable to students interested in engineering, and intelligent agent applications.

name:
智慧資料處理
SMART DATA PROCESSING
syllabus: 1. 人工智慧與機器學習: AI工具與生成式AI工具2. 機器學習處理模式:RNN(LSTM、Transformer)3. 多維資料機器學習處理模式:CNN 處理模式--YOLO v4 處理架構4. 智慧晶片資料處理架構5. 效能導向適切資料排列演算法6. 以智慧運算為導向的計算架構
objectives: 介紹與學習如何應用AI處理模式處理資料。透過「實踐中學習」的教學理念，學生可以綜合應用所學的知識和技能於創新設計，讓他們在學習和創作中找到樂趣。透過接觸業界專家，學生能深度瞭解人工智慧處理模式的實際應用以及如何將所學知識技能應用在實際工作中。

name:

syllabus: IntroductionInitial value problemEuler’s method and Heun’s methodPredictor-Corrector methodsRunge-Kutta methodsMulti-steps method (Adams method)Identification and modelingSymbolic operationsLMIsSimulink application for initial value problem and nonlinear systemsMidterm examinationGradient descentNewton's methodGradient descent for linear regressionLogistic regressionCross entropy of logistic regression and odds ratio
objectives: 本課程將介紹如何使用工程軟體解決數值分析的相關問題。除此之外，本課程將培養同學在相關專業科目其工程軟體設計的技巧，並利用工程軟體所學之技巧解決各種工程問題。

name:

name:

tags: ['科技創新與服務業管理學程']

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Information and Communication Technology (ICT) has been an irreplaceable part of our daily life. Businesses adopt ICT to support their operation as well as enhance their service to partners or end customers. This course is designed to facilitate students to understand the impact of ICT on individuals’ life and business operation. The content of this course includes both book chapters, research articles, and Harvard teaching cases. Book chapters aim at offering fundamental ICT knowledge, research articles focuses on how to conduct a research in IS area, and real cases demonstrate how ICTs can be applied to counter business problems or even cause unexpected problems toward individuals or business.
objectives: The design purpose of this course is for student to1. generate an awareness of ICT;2. increase the understanding of the importance of ICT in contemporary business organizations and individuals’ daily life3. help student develop fundamental knowledge of using ICT to solve business issues;4. to understand IS research;

name:

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The course is designed to provide an in-depth examination of the nature and development of information systems. The focus is on how systems analysis and design (SA&D) theories, techniques, languages, models, principles, and tools can be applied, adapted, extended, and integrated in support of systems analysis and design activities. The orientation of this course is highly practical, with hands-on learning experience. The scope of the course aims to be state-of-the-art, emphasizing the implementation of CASE tool and the latest possibilities for modeling user requirement and designing or devising information systems with the support of CASE tools. No prior exposure to algorithm or networking is assumed. However, familiarity with business problems and programming is assumed.
objectives: (1) Understanding the models, theories, principles, languages, methods, and tools of SA&D.(2) Use our understanding of SA&D knowledge to rethink our conceptions of SA&D, and to develop an effective and solid perspective.

name:
供應鏈管理
SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT
tags: ['科技創新與服務業管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MIS526.TXTIn order to survive in today’s fiercely competitive business environment, companies need to manage effectively the entire set of activities involved in the production and delivery of goods and services to their customers. In particular, globalization trends, increased demand for product variety, frequent changes in fashion and technology, high customer expectations, and the rapid development of e-commerce add major complexity to an already challenging task. Recognizing that the logistics and distribution processes often transcend corporate and even national borders, it is necessary to break down the boundaries that have traditionally segregated supply chain participants from one another. Therefore, effective supply chain management should focus on the links between chain participants (e.g., suppliers, manufacturers, distributors and retailers). Inefficient (or absence of) coordination between supply chain partners may lead to disastrous consequences for the whole supply chain.Supply chain management is currently a “hot” topic in the corporate world and at major universities. Some prestigious universities offer entire programs in supply chain management. By its nature, it is relevant to managers in a wide variety of organizational functions. Because of the course’s managerial focus, it is well suited to all students with an interest in general operations management. In particular, it is strongly recommended for those who see their career in electronic commerce, consulting, or in businesses where operations, distribution or logistics play an important role.
objectives: Specific Course Objectives•	Learn computer and analytical tools for analysis, management and performance improvement of supply chains in digital era.•	Discuss concepts and recent influential innovations and digitaization in supply chain management•	Gain exposure to a digital transformation for supply chain and broad range of communication within a international supply chain.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】介紹軟體完整生命週期各階段之活動、課題、與相關之方法論，並搭配個案研討協助學員理解軟體工程內涵。課程內容除包含：軟體需求管理、軟體架構設計、程式撰寫準則、軟體測試方法、與軟體營運架構等基本軟體開發活動外，也介紹軟體開發程序，以及軟體專案和產品管理等課題之方法論與實務運作。

name:
系統模擬與分析
SYSTEM SIMULATION AND ANALYSIS
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】無論是管理領域或理工領域中，經常需應用資訊科技或模式來對所面臨的問題進行實驗，以期能更經濟、更深入地了解問題的本質、系統行為…等。其中，本課程所專注的作業層次之系統模擬，若能善用得宜，則可發揮其在評量、預估、比較、敏感度分析、瓶頸分析、最佳改善…等功能；而熟悉此項技能者，更將具有整體觀、多方位思考之能力，與理性、客觀、果斷之特質。Simulation is one of the key techniques to analyze the complex problems systematically, and it is also an important tool to integrate the business operations and the information systems. Performing experiments is an important way to study the systems, especially, the complex systems. System simulation is a technique to perform the experiments for an existed system without interrupting or a proposed system before implementing by computer models. The key factors to make the simulation project solving the problems successfully, the simulation analyst not only need to be properly trained of using the tools, but also have to analyze experimental results appropriately.
objectives: 修課學生可習得：1. 模擬程式之撰寫、模擬系統之發展…等技能。2. 分析模擬實驗結果、產生具體而客觀之建議方案。In this course, the procedures for executing the simulation project are introduced, the concepts of transforming problem faced into suitable simulation model are instructed, and the schemes of analyzing the numerical results and animated phonemes are discussed. In particular, output analysis and variance reduction technique will be demonstrated to help the students to make the experiments more efficiently and to explore the facts based upon statistics.

name:
電子商務
ELECTRONIC COMMERCE
tags: ['行銷管理學程', '金融科技與創新微學程', '金融科技學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course will discuss the current status and future development of e-commerce, and the current status of applying information technology to e-commerce. Course topics include macro and micro factors of e-commerce development, important e-commerce business models, smart commerce, application of artificial intelligence and big data techniques to e-commerce, FinTech, consumer behaviors, etc. In addition, this course will discuss theories and models in the fields such as information systems, consumer behavior and organizational behavior, and how to apply those theories to conducting e-commerce research.本課程將探討電子商務的現況及未來發展，以及資訊科技在電子商務應用之現況，包含電子商務發展的整體環境因素及個體環境因素、重要的電子商務模式、智慧商務、人工智慧與巨量資料在電子商務之應用、金融科技、消費者行為等。本課程另一重點為探討資管、消費者行為、組織行為等領域理論與模型，以及如何應用這些理論從事電子商務的研究。
objectives: 1. Understand the impact and opportunities of rapid development of the Internet technology on business operation, and the induced issues about business operation and management.2. Understand the information technology that drives the development of e-commerce and related issues.3. Understand how to apply theories to the study of e-commerce and the challenges of practical operation of e-commerce through case study and practice.4. Understand theories in the information system, consumer behavior, and organizational behavior fields and how to apply those theories to understand user and consumer behavior in the e-commerce context.1.瞭解網際網路科技的快速演進為企業經營所帶來的契機及衝擊，以及因而所引發的經營管理議題。2.瞭解帶動電子商務發展的相關資訊科技發展及重要議題3.透過個案討論及實務演練，體驗電子商務相關理論之應用及實務操作可能面臨的挑戰。4.瞭解資管、消費者行為、組織行為等領域理論，及如何應用這些理論探討電子商務中使用者或消費者行為。

name:
巨量資料分析導論
INTRODUCTION TO BIG DATA ANALYTICS
tags: ['永續能源學程', '智慧製造聯網微學程', '人工智能投資微學程', '金融科技與創新微學程', '金融科技學程', '跨領域智慧製造學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MIS572.TXT*** 本課程採「同步遠距含錄影」上課，課程與連線相關資訊將置於本校網路大學課程頁面, 請至本校圖資處首頁網路大學登入****** 未選上課無法登入的同學，第一堂課上課請至 https://meet.google.com/qii-pwtd-ofj ****** 本課程有多個課號(MIS 413/572, CM 503)，請修習相關學程的同學注意 ***Prerequisite:* Programming Proficiency: It is essential for students to have familiarity with at least one high-level programming language.Expertise in scientific programming languages, such as R, Matlab, Python, Julia, or SAS, will be especially beneficial.* Relational Databases & SQL: Students must possess a foundational understanding of relational databases and the Structured QueryLanguage (SQL). This knowledge is pivotal for many data engineering components within the course.* Data Structures Fundamentals: A grasp of basic data structures, including but not limited to arrays, lists, sets, and dictionaries,is vital. This understanding will serve students well as they delve into the intricacies of Data Engineering and Analytics.* Introductory Statistics: A solid grounding in statistical concepts is required. This includes understanding descriptive analytics,which encompasses measures of data dispersion and central tendency, as well as diagnostic analytics, such as hypothesis testing. Suchknowledge will pave the way for a deeper comprehension of data analytics methodologies and statistical machine learning algorithms.* Analytical & Problem-solving Skills: The practical aspects of this course necessitate strong analytical thinking andproblem-solving abilities. Students should be prepared to apply their knowledge to tackle real-world challenges.For those students who may find themselves lacking in any of the outlined prerequisites, it is strongly advised to pursue supplementarycoursework or dedicated self-study. This proactive approach will ensure a richer and more effective learning experience throughout the course.
objectives: This course offers an in-depth exploration of the multifaceted domains of AI, Machine Learning (ML), and Big Data Analytics. Students will gain afoundational understanding of Data Science, tracing its evolution and significance across diverse sectors such as business, healthcare, insurance, and finance.The curriculum addresses essential topics, encompassing Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Analytics, Machine Learning Design Patterns, and the nuancesbetween Supervised & Unsupervised Learning. Enhancing the course content, students will explore foundational concepts like deep neural networks, model architecturedesign, functional programming, and ML Interpretability, which aim to demystify the black-box nature of many ML models. A central component of our curriculumis the transformative potential of large language models, such as the GPT-series, Gemini, and Claude. Students will appreciate how these models are pivotal in data analytics,especially in their capacity to generate R and Python code for streamlined and automated data processing.Throughout the course, the emphasis on practical applications ensures that students garner hands-on experience with the R and Python programming languages,addressing modern data analytics challenges. This course is tailored for those eager to both grasp and apply the principles of data science and ML/AI in concretereal-world contexts.

objectives: The term “fintech” is being used more and more in the modern world. Fintech stands for financial technology and covers technology-enabled model innovation in the design and delivery of financial services and product. It is now a broad category that refers to the innovative use of technology in personal and commercial finance. The applications of fintech extend across various business sectors, including initial public offerings (IPO), insurance, lending, investment management, payments, etc. The purpose of the course is to provide students with an opportunity to explore the fintech applications and the related theories such as information economics.This is a practical course with heavy emphasis on guest lectures, modern application studies, and projects.

Besides gaining fundamental knowledge of deep learning algorithms, students will get practical experience by implementing deep models via coding assignments and final projects using Python and deep learning frameworks.
