name:
資訊檢索
INTRODUCTION TO INFORMATION RETRIEVAL
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MIS590.TXTAs the internet and social media continue to evolve, we are witnessing an explosive growth in the availability of unstructured data, such as text and images. Effectively understanding this data and addressing users’ information needs have become significant challenges, sparking widespread interest in research communities. The advancement of attention mechanisms and large language models has introduced new potential to the field of information retrieval, leading to a surge in related academic publications and conferences.This course will provide an overview of how to access, manage, and utilize unstructured data, such as text and images. We will begin with the fundamentals of information retrieval, including Boolean models, vector space models, and probabilistic models. This foundation will equip students with the necessary knowledge to handle unstructured data. We will then explore popular research areas, such as recommender systems, knowledge graphs, and large language models, giving students a preliminary understanding of state-of-the-art methods. To conclude, the course will address critical issues such as safety, fairness, ethics, and responsibility in the field of information retrieval.This course is designed for graduate students and senior undergraduate students who have a basic understanding of data mining and deep learning. Students will be introduced to the world of information retrieval, with a focus on its ongoing challenges and emerging issues. The course aims to broaden students’ perspectives and assist them in selecting future research directions.
objectives: 修習本課後，學生應該具備以下知識：瞭解資訊檢索的基本原則和演算法以及關聯的資訊系統應用。Upon completing this course, students should be equipped with the following knowledge:Understand the principles and algorithms of information retrieval and their associated applications.

金融市場理論與實務
FINANCIAL MARKETS THEORY AND PRACTICE

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. objectives: This course will introduce various prevalent financial products in recent years, including popular financial derivatives, digital currency, commodity futures, and options. This course will further present the effects of market structure, market risk, market frictions, and behavioral biases on the financial market. Students will learn the prevalent financial products of the latest trends and research issues in financial markets.

name:
現代投資組合理論與策略
MODERN PORTFOLIO THEORY AND INVESTMENT STRATEGY
tags: ['金融工程學程', '人工智能投資微學程', '金融科技學程', '財務管理專業學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】In a fast changing financial world, a thorough understanding of investment analysis and portfolio theory is essential for investment managers as well as corporate executives to develop robust business strategies. The emphasis of this course is on the introduction and implementation of modern portfolio theory and investment analysis. Case study will be a major teaching method.
objectives: We will spend some time working on various computer projects to make participants become familiar with the theory and applications. Students will be working in groups on topics covered in the text as we move on. Ideally, at the end of the semester, the students will understand the standard procedures commonly used in modern portfolio management.The average students should expect to spend at least 3 hours per week for this course on reading the textbook, doing designated assignments, and preparing for examinations. Regular attendance is highly recommended.

name:
財務研究方法（一）
METHODOLOGY FOR FINANCE (I)
tags: ['金融科技學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course is interdisciplinary and will cover the theories and practices of econometrics for finance. We will integrate the knowledge and practices including the models applying cross sectional, time series, and panel data. The Software of Econometric will be introduced as well. Students successfully completing this course will be familiar with the current practices of econometrics and have the capability to conduct empirical research.
objectives: This course will introduce the basic concepts of econometrics for finance. Students will learn to apply the methodology of econometrics to analysis the data they obtained. This course will enable students to analysis the data collected from real world, and made their forecast. Lastly, students will be trained to improve their logic to know if the estimation is reliable and suitable in real world.

name:
選擇權市場理論與策略
OPTIONS MARKETS:THEORY AND STRATEGY
tags: ['金融工程學程', '金融科技學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course aims to build foundations on options pricing methods. Various pricing techniques will be derived and elaborated throughout the semester. Theoretical and practical concerns in option pricing, product development, trading, and risk management will be emphasized. The workload from assignments and term project will be heavy.
objectives: This course is designed to familiarize students with the academic and institutional developments of options trading with emphasis on the oldest and largest segment of the options markets, options on common stocks. Nonetheless, most of our conclusions reached in the context of stock options can be easily modified to apply to other types of options. The material used in the course consists of a textbook and some papers and articles. You should read the assigned material before class and come to class prepared to answer and discuss the questions in the text. You are also advised to read the financial pages of the newspapers on a regular basis.

name:
證券市場微結構實務
SECURITIES MARKETS MICROSTRUCTURE PRACTICE
tags: ['金融工程學程', '金融科技與創新微學程', '金融科技學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\FM527.TXT1. Introduction to Trading System2. Call vs. Continuous Trading3. Price Limits, Trading Halts, short selling and Transaction Taxes4. Limit Order Book5. Market Fragmentation6. Market Making7. Efficiency8. Liquidity9. Volatility10. Cryptocurrency11. Bid-Ask Spread12. Transparency13. Information14. Algo Trading & High Frequency Trading15. Intraday Patterns16. Trading Volume and Return17. Intermarket Relation18. Institutional Trading / Individual Trading19. Regulation20. Robert Engle and related time varing intraday analysis21. Financial Crisis22. Bubble23. Network Analysis24. Big Data, text mining25. Behavioral, sentiment, attention26. Machine learing &Expert Advisor27. Methodology28. Other Market Microstructure Issue依上課時所發的課程大綱為主。
objectives: 本課程旨在介紹證券市場之結構、行為與績效 , 以使學生對於證券市場究竟如何運作、價格是受到那些因素所影響問題有較深入的了解。內容包括各交易制度及其對價格影響、行情締造 ( Market Making)、資訊與價格、市場績效之衡量、價格行為、投資人結構與行為、技術分析之有效性、融資與融券、高頻交易、證券網絡分析、機器學習預測市場、泡沫以及虛擬貨幣交易市場等議題。以授課及研討兩種方式同時進行。學生須執行日內資料的實證以及計量交易模型的建構，以從中學習處理日內資料，瞭解影響價格行為之各項重要因素。This course is designed to introduce the structure, behavior and performance of the securities market so that students have a better understanding of how the securities market operates and how the price is formed. The topics include trading systems and their impact on prices, market making, information and prices, measurement of market performance, price and volume patterns, investor structure and behavior, effectiveness of technical analysis, high frequency trading, securities network analysis, machine learning forecasting, bubbles, and cryptocurrency trading markets. Classes are taught in lectures and seminars. Students are required to implement the empirical analyses based on intraday data and to construct trading strategy models.

name:
財務報表分析與權益評價
FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS AND EQUITY VALUATION
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course aims to develop and advance students’ knowledge in financial statement analysis and equity valuation using techniques in financial accounting, management accounting and finance.The courses include:-	Understand the mechanism of financial statement analysis and equity valuation-	Analyze financial and market data-	Assess company performance and conduct prospective analysis
objectives: By the end of the course, students are expected to-	Discuss and compare different approaches in financial statement analysis-	Prepare quantitative analysis, in particular, reformulate financial statements to interpret and evaluate financial performance-	Conduct business equity valuation with forecasted information and market outlook

name:
投資銀行與法金實務
INVESTMENT BANKING AND CORPORATE FINANCING
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程透過密集授課及實務案例分析，提供學生關於投資銀行和法人金融實務的廣泛性知識。課程首先介紹投資銀行和法人金融業務的基本概念，接著深入探討資本市場的結構及其運作原理，包括IPO過程、企業籌資策略、併購實務，以及專案融資等核心主題。學生將有機會了解到如何在資本市場中評估和分析價值，並學習風險管理和永續金融的重要性。課程同時安排亞洲新興資本市場和國際聯貸模式的專題討論，以及台灣創投業的發展趨勢，旨在培養學生成為具有國際視野的投資銀行專業人才。期末的小組報告則讓學生將所學理論與實務相結合，進行深入分析和討論，全面提升解決實際問題的能力。
objectives: 本課程旨在深入探討投資銀行及法人金融的實務操作，藉由課程中的專業與實務性知識，使學生理解資本市場運作、IPO策略、企業併購及永續金融等核心議題，培養成為優秀的銀行家。

name:
行為財務學的應用
APPLICATIONS OF BEHAVIORAL FINANCE
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course is exclusive for post-graduate in the Department of Finance & exclusive for Industrial Technology Graduate Program in Finance Innovation. The course is taught in English.Behavior finance focuses on limited rational or irrational human behavior and its effects on asset prices and financial decisions. It can be divided into two categories: behavioral investment and behavioral corporate finance. This course is expected to discuss the findings of the academic literature of behavioral finance and the empirical evidence about the market anomaly in the Taiwan stock market.
objectives: Acquire systematic knowledge in behavioral finance theories and application.

name:
企業社會責任
CORPORATE SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\FM548.TXTIn recent years, corporate social responsibility (CSR) has become an important topic for enterprises. Both large and small enterprises engage in CSR actions such as the disclosure of related CSR information or the preparation of separate CSR reports. This course will include CSR issues related to economic, social, corporate governance, and environmental perspectives and the impact of CSR on companies, investors as well as stakeholders. This course will also involve recent development of CSR such as carbon trading institutions and the relevant decisions in the CDP26 meeting.
objectives: The course aims to enable students to comprehend issues related to CSR including economic, social, corporate governance, and environmental perspectives and the impact of CSR on companies, investors as well as stakeholders. This course will also involve recent development of CSR such as carbon trading institutions and the relevant decisions in the CDP26 meeting.

name:
永續投資與綠色金融創新
SUSTAINABLE INVESTMENT AND GREEN FINANCE INNOVATION
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Due to the impact of the pandemic and extreme weather, the World Economic Forum (WEF) released the *Global Risks Report*, warning that environmental and climate risks have become critical challenges that the world must address. ESG-related sustainability issues have also emerged as significant global development trends. Countries and companies worldwide are increasingly focusing on sustainable finance and investment. In response, financial markets are continuously introducing strategies and innovative green financial products to help businesses and individuals implement ESG principles. Additionally, global sovereign funds, pension funds, and financial institutions are signing up to the Principles for Responsible Investment (PRI). Many companies are incorporating ESG into their business strategies, actively pursuing digital sustainable transformation, and moving toward sustainable development.This course primarily covers the development trends in global and Taiwanese sustainable investment and green finance markets. It is based on the content of the international CFA Institute's *Certificate in ESG Investing* exam. We have invited renowned professors from various universities specializing in sustainable finance to deliver lectures. They will also share successful practical experiences from exemplary companies, both domestically and internationally, that have effectively implemented sustainable investments. This will equip students with an understanding of the latest trends in ESG sustainable investment, insights into innovative products in the sustainable finance market, and an analysis of how technology can be used for investment screening and asset allocation modeling.
objectives: 本課程設定目標如下:1. 培養學生具體瞭解國內外ESG永續投資與金融創新趨勢脈動。2. 融入CFA ESG 證照教材內容及產業實務分享，讓學生瞭解當前ESG相關議題與永續金融創新發展現況，鼓勵同學報考CFA永續投資國際證照。3. 針對「ESG永續投資與金融創新」提出理論與實務上的問題討論，指定重要主題由同學進行期末報告，共同討論交流，以利學生學習最佳化。

name:
盈餘管理
EARNINGS MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The course on earnings management primarily includes the following teaching methods:(1)Introduction to possible methods of earnings management by companies.(2)Discussion on the motivations behind earnings management by companies and its impact on corporate operations, with a focus on deepening understanding through literature.{NOTICE}#1 Students who are not from finance, accounting backgrounds, or those who have not taken accounting courses are advised against taking this course.#2 The course content will be rigorous, and it is not recommended for students outside of finance or accounting disciplines.#3 The course will be taught interchangeably in both Chinese and English, depending on the circumstances#4 The prerequisites for this course include Introductory and Intermediate Accounting, Financial Statement Analysis, and Managerial Accounting. These courses will provide you with the necessary foundational knowledge to better understand and apply the subsequent material. If you have already completed these courses, you will find it easier to grasp the advanced concepts in this course.#5 It is not recommended for undergraduate students to take this course.
objectives: By understanding earnings management techniques, students can gain a basic understanding of financial statements. Through reading literature, they can comprehend the motivations and reasons behind earnings management. This can further their understanding of potential theories or perspectives that might be employed in the field.

name:
國際財管理論與實務
INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\FM601.TXT1. Basics of international financial markets: foreign exchange (FX) bid-ask spread, triangular arbitrage, Purchasing Power Parity (PPP), inflation and real exchange rates;2. Information asymmetry in financial markets: the Glosten-Milgrom (1985) model and its extensions;3. Calculation of effective spread using daily (Roll 1984) and intra-day data (Corwin-Schultz 2012)4. The forward price and Covered Interest Parity (CIP): the forward contract, the interest rate markets and other derivatives (futures, options and swaps);5. The deviation of CIP after Global Financial Crisis (GFC) in 2008, and the modelling of interest rate changes by central banks after Covid-19.本課程一大特色為3次電腦上機實作課, 透過對實際金融 data數據(外匯價格, 股價與利率)的處理, 同學能練習包含三角套利, 價差估計以及對利率平價理論進行實證.
objectives: This course is intended to provide a comprehensive and critical review on international financial markets for students at master level. There are four learning objectives:(1) After the course, students will understand and can describe the functioning of spot FX markets, the interest rate markets and the forward and derivatives markets;(2) After the course, students can demonstrate the calculation of effective spread using daily and intra-day data, compare the empirical results with Glosten-Milgrom model and explain how/why the empirical results are consistent with theory;(3) After the course, students can evaluate critically the fundamental role of the Law of One Price (LOOP), apply it to the construction of Covered Interest Parity (CIP) and appraise the validity of CIP using recent FX and interest rate data;(4) Students will have many opportunities in practicing the learned models using real data, including detecting triangular arbitrage, estimating the proportion of informed traders, testing if CIP holds after the financial crisis in 2008 and the modelling of interest rate changes since Covid-19.除了以上四個學習目標, 亦希望能協助碩士班同學在完成課程後, 能從相關的國際金融理論與實證研究發想論文主題.

name:
財務工程與金融創新
FINANCIAL ENGINEERING AND FINANCIAL INNOVATION
tags: ['金融工程學程', '金融科技與創新微學程', '金融科技學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】1. Review on options markets (natural price bounds and put-call parity), the Binomial-Tree (BT) model and the derivation of Black-Scholes-Merton (BSM) option pricing formula from multi-step BT model;2. Introduction to Brownian motion: how it is discovered, its basic statistical properties and two methods in simulating the paths of Brownian motion;3. Basics of Stochastic Calculus: conditional expectation, martingale process, the construction of Ito Integral, an SDE (stochastic differential equation) and Ito's Lemma4. Pricing an option: use Ito’s Lemma to obtain the BSM formula when asset price is described by a geometric Brownian motion (GBM), and the method of Monte Carlo simulation5. Information in observed option prices: implied volatility surface, stochastic volatility model (Heston 1993), the risk-neutral density (RND) of underlying asset price and how RND can be transformed into real-world density (RWD)本課程一大特色為3次電腦上機實作課, 透過對實際金融 data數據(股價與選擇權市價)的處理, 以及模擬二項樹模型與蒙地卡羅法, 同學能練習選擇權二項樹定價, 選擇權幾何布朗尼運動定價, 與隱含波動率及風險中立機率密度函數的估計.
objectives: This course covers the fundamental concepts and programming techniques required for pricing derivatives, in particular an option. We begin with the Binomial Tree model in discrete time and move on to models constructed from Brownian motion in continuous time. The course is carefully designed to strike a balance between theory and application – students have many opportunities to practice learned theories in 4 computer workshops and can deepen their understanding in a video- watching activity. There are four learning objectives:(1) After this course, students will understand and appreciate the three different ways (Binomial-Tree model, geometric Brownian motion and risk-neutral pricing) in obtaining the Black-Scholes-Merton (BSM) pricing formula for a European option;(2) After this course, students can appraise the BSM formula and explain why it is not accurate enough by observing the so-called volatility smile, and investigate how to modify the BSM model with stochastic volatility and price jumps;(3) After this course, students will acquire the basic concepts in Stochastic Calculus, and this will help you read and understand the textbooks at elementary (Mikosch 1998) and advanced level (Shreve 2004) in your independent study;(4) Last but not the least, students can implement many interesting applications including risk-neutral density (RND) estimation, which can be used to predict the price of underlying asset like stock prices or exchange rates in the future.除了以上四個學習目標, 亦希望協助碩士班同學在完成課程後, 從相關的選擇權定價理論與市場波動率實證研究發想論文主題.

The main topics include applications of financial big data, Python programming, and machine learning.
objectives: 1. 了識金融大數據分析與處理2. 建立Python程式語言的基本技能3. 了解機器學習如何應用於金融大數據分析1. Understanding financial big data analysis and processing.2. Developing fundamental skills in Python programming.3. Understanding how machine learning is applied to financial big data analysis.

name:
金融投資與程式交易
FINANCIAL INVESTING AND PROGRAM TRADING
description:
《講授類》
『本課程之限修，於加退選2階段開放選修』。限財管碩、金融創新產業碩士專班及財管碩士在職專班
tags: ['金融工程學程', '人工智能投資微學程', '金融科技學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】FinTech的賦權投資人(Empowered Investor)概念，將導引未來金融市場朝向CS（Computer Science）與金融商品操作的整合發展上。因此，全方位個人理財人才的培養，不僅要瞭解市面上的金融工具外，更必須具備一定程度的資料處理與分析能力，以因應未來FinTech趨勢下的市場競爭。本課程的目標是以資料科學(Data Science)為主，透過R語言程式設計能力，培養全方位理財人才，從巨量的量化財務信息分析出合適的個人理財交易策略。FinTech's Empowered Investor concept will guide the future development of financial markets towards the integration of CS (Computer Science) and financial commodity operations. Therefore, the cultivation of all-round personal financial management talents must not only understand the financial instruments on the market, but also must have a certain degree of data processing and analysis capabilities in order to cope with the market competition under the trend of FinTech in the future. The goal of this course is to focus on Data Science, to develop a full range of financial management talents through R language programming skills, and to analyze appropriate personal financial trading strategies from a huge amount of quantitative financial information.
objectives: 因應未來FinTech趨勢，本課程的教學目標就是從資料科學(Data Science)角度出發，透過R語言程式教學，培養學生運用R程式能力，從量化財務信息分析出合適的個人理財交易策略，達到全方位理財能力。本課程前半段將專注在R語言教學，後半段專注在運用R語言分析相關交易策略之可行性。Cultivate the students have the ability of data science. Teach students R language and programing. Focus on R programing at the beginning, and use R to create trading strategy after that. Finally, cultivate students to be FinTech talents.

objectives: In this course, students will conduct empirical research in the fields of finance, economics, operations, and financial supply chain management. Additionally, students will learn how to conduct empirical research using a variety of models/methods.

name:
研究方法
RESEARCH METHODS
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】此課程主要協助同學瞭解社會科學研究方法。課程主要分下列單元: 問卷與量表設計; 信度與效度; 調查; 觀察; 實驗與準實驗; 論文與研究計畫寫作; 研究倫理。This course will focus on the following topics: design of questionnaires and scales, reliability and validity, survey, observation, experiment and quasi-experiment, writing of thesis and research proposals, research ethics, theoretically research and applied research.
objectives: 方法的學習，對思考訓練非常重要。社會科學的研究方法的學習，有助於學生對於社會科學的知識，進行有系統的累積、問題發掘與假設的驗證。此課程旨在培養同學系統思考的能力，並認識與掌握社會科學的研究方法。This course is aimed to teach students research methods for social sciences. The learning of such methods is good for training in critical thinking and problem solving.

name:
公共政策分析
PUBLIC POLICY ANALYSIS
tags: ['公民參與微學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Analyzing public policies entails scrutiny from multiple aspects including popular preferences, professional responsibility, ethics, values, etc. This course goes through these aspects, and therein discusses how policy makers, attempting to identify and pursue public interest, formulate policy problems in utility maximization by the tools of benefit-cost, decision, and multi-attribute analysis, valuate intangible and future benefits, address uncertainty in policy analysis and risk in policy making, apply behavioral decision theories related to micro-motives and macro-behavior, and thereby devise persuasive communication and social campaigns for public acceptance of policies.
objectives: This course has the following objectives to achieve for students:(1) Indicate policy analysis aspects and explain analysis approaches and contents.(2) Use policy analysis tools to evaluate public policies.(3) Critically review existing public policies and propose improvement alternatives.

name:
公共事務與管理
PUBLIC AFFAIRS AND MANAGEMENT
tags: ['公民參與微學程', '環境教育學程', '公共事務與企業社會責任微學程', '企業社會責任學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\PAM505.TXT因應武漢肺炎,以同步遠距上課( Google Meet 進行視訊上課)，課前 10 分鐘開放登入。使用者須先有 Google 帳號。上課連結：meet.google.com/hcb-bqya-cmo良善的公共事務管理可以積極帶動政府施政總體發展、促進公共服務傳遞品質、改善都市整體空間環境與復甦都市機能，進而促進居民的公共利益。同時，臺灣地方政府如要在全球化的競爭下在國際舞台占有一席之地，亦須仰賴運作良好的公共事務管理。90年代以降，由於政府低效率與無法及時回應社會變遷之問題，以市場邏輯為思維主軸的「新公共管理」（New Public Management, NPM）典範被引介到政府運作與公共服務傳遞。在經過多年的實踐後，新公共管理發展出不同主題與擴展其應用範圍，但也同時面臨許多挑戰。本課程將帶領同學探究公共事務背後的基本價值、新公共管理的發展與演變。透過不同公共管理途徑背景與發展之介紹、工具運用、個案探討，引導學生對當前公共事務管理的理論與實務有更為深入之認識，並理解政府在面臨治理危機時下，如何運用各項政策工具與技術，來管理公共事務各面向。We use Google Meet for the online courses, and the students should have the google account.Please click the link: meet.google.com/hcb-bqya-cmoThe purpose of this course is to provide aspiring EMPA students with the tools necessary to work with and within organizations. Students will be introduced to public management concepts and receive the competencies required to address the challenges in the public sector. Students will explore innovative related to the management of public sector organizations, such as: Artificial Intelligence (AI) issues in public affairs management; Network and collaborative governance; social enterprise; service coproduction; smart cities and the application of big data analysis. Using managerial perspectives, the course focuses on the structure and management function of public agencies. Because the increasingly complex nature of public service delivery, we will also address how the private and nonprofit sectors interact with public organizations to provide public services.
objectives: 1.帶領同學瞭解公共事務所涉及的根本價值之辯證、公共管理的發展與變遷，引導同學以批判的角度思考公共議題與政策。2.著重相關理論與文獻的探討，並輔以公共管理實務案例，來強化學生在理論與實務的結合。1.Identify the elements of public management from a theoretical and practical perspective.2.Understand what makes an effective public manager and how to apply tools and techniques presented to achieve organizational effectiveness to their work in public service.

objectives: 為因應地方創生政策及大學社會責任之趨勢，本課程提供公事所學生實習及其他學習機會，讓學生透過實際參與及行動，培養公共管理知能。In response to the regional revitalization policies and the trend of university social responsibility, this course provides internships and other learning opportunities for students in the workplace, and also enable students to enhance their public management knowledge through actual participation and action.

name:

ENVIRONMENTAL PSYCHOLOGY
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程將配合多篇的文獻閱讀和每週的讀書報告寫作，讓學生熟悉三大項目：環保行動的社會行銷、環境行為模式、環境行為模式在論文研究上的應用。This course has three main themes: the social marketing of proenvironmental actions, models of environmental behavior and their application in thesis.
objectives: 本課程旨在介紹環境心理學的範疇與內容，提供學生有關人類環境行為(environmental behavior)的心理及管理知識，訓練學生以社會行銷（social marketing)推動環保行動，並將環境行為模式應用在論文研究上。This course is aimed to introduce the scope and content of environmental psychology, give students knowledge on the psychology and management of environmental behavior. The course will also teach students how to promote proenvironmental actions through social marketing, and how to apply models of environmental behavior to their thesis.

name:

SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT AND GREEN MANAGEMENT

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\PAM534.TXTThis course aims to investigate the possibility of sustainable development in a post-growth economy. If you are looking for a touch of green to cover up all the brown jobs, this is not the course for you.This course discusses about the theories with respect to sustainable development and principles applied in green management. Cases are introduced to facilitate the understanding of relevant concepts.
objectives: 1. Participants will learn about topics that are important to a post-growth economy.2. Participants will obtain knowledge of theories and principles related to sustainable development and green management.3. Participants will have an opportunity to discuss about a path to move towards a post-growth economy.

name:
媒體與公共事務
MEDIA AND PUBLIC AFFAIRS
tags: ['地方創生與區域治理微學程', '地方創生與永續發展整合學程', '公共事務與企業社會責任微學程', '企業社會責任學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】認識媒體在公共事務上所扮演的角色，及對公共事務的影響；同時，從事公共事務者應如何看待與因應媒體所帶來的衝擊。Recognize the role of media and its influences on public affairs; at the same time, learning how the staff involved in public affairs should view and respond to the impacts brought by the media.
objectives: 從媒體性質、發展與生態出發，透過實際案例，說明從事公共事務者，該如何與媒體應對，如何培養專業的媒體公關能力，達到事半功倍的公關成果，以及危機處理等作為。以政治學、新聞學及社會學等理論出發，探討媒體與公共事務之間的互動，以及衍生的議題，讓學生對其有更深刻的認識。Combined with actual cases and angles of the nature, development and ecology of the media, this course aims at explaining to people engaged in public affairs to understand how to respond to the media, how to cultivate professional media public relations and crisis management capabilities, in order to achieve effective public relations results.Based on theories of political science, journalism, and sociology, this course is designed to explore the interaction between media and public affairs, as well as the issues that are derived, so that students have a deeper understanding of it.

INTERNATIONAL EXCHANGE ON NONPROFIT AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS
tags: ['非營利事業及社會創新微學程', '企業社會責任學程', '地方創生與區域治理微學程', '公共事務與企業社會責任微學程', '地方創生與永續發展整合學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】當前國際非營利/非政府組織（Nonprofit/Nongovernmental Organizations）研究與實務強調國際視野與跨國比較。各國非營利組織在不同社會經濟及文化系絡下形成多元的運作模式及策略，未來非營利組織管理者必須熟悉國際間非營利組織管理之發展與趨勢，並學習運用國際參訪經驗結合台灣在地行動。本學期課程將前往日本九州參訪見學，與當地非營利、社區組織、大學及社會企業進行交流學習。透過實地參訪及互動，培養具國際觀的非營利及社區管理人才。Current research and practice in international nonprofit/non-governmental organizations (Nonprofit/Nongovernmental Organizations) emphasize an international perspective and cross-national comparisons. Nonprofit organizations in various countries develop diverse operational models and strategies within different socio-economic and cultural contexts. Future nonprofit organization managers must be familiar with the development and trends of nonprofit management internationally and learn to integrate international experiences with local actions in Taiwan. This semester, the course will involve a study tour to Kyushu, Japan, where students will engage in exchanges and learning with local nonprofits, community organizations, universities, and social enterprises. Through site visits and interactions, the course aims to cultivate nonprofit and community management talents with a global perspective.
objectives: 1.與日本九州福岡縣、熊本縣之大學、地方自治團體、非營利及社區組織實地交流，了解其發展歷程及推動社區發展與共生（共老）社區之策略，特別關注高齡友善空間設計、地方創生、女性公共參與等議題，並共同探討推動公私協力時所面臨之困境與其解方，藉此拓展學生之國際視野。2.讓學生結合參訪經驗，思考日本經驗運用於台灣的可行性及其限制，並藉此激發學生設計更具國際觀之非營利及社區管理策略。Engage in on-site exchanges with universities, local governments, nonprofit, and community organizations in Fukuoka Prefecture and Kumamoto Prefecture, Kyushu, Japan, to understand their development processes and strategies for promoting community development and co-living (aging together) communities. Special attention will be paid to issues such as the design of friendly spaces, pedestrian rights, and women's public participation. The challenges and solutions in promoting public-private partnerships will also be discussed to broaden students' international perspectives.Encourage students to combine their visit experiences with reflections on the applicability and limitations of Japanese experiences in Taiwan. This process aims to inspire students to design nonprofit and community management strategies with a more global outlook.

SEMINAR IN NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION MANAGEMENT

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\PAM590.TXT1.界定非營利組織之概念、原則及相關理論。2.分析各類非營利組織(包括人民團體、基金會、社會企業等)及相關政策。3.討論非營利組織的各種管理知能(包括行政管理、人力資源管理、行銷管理、財務管理等)。4.研析非營利組織在實際運作上的現況。1. Define the concepts, principles, and related theories of nonprofit organizations.2. Analyze nonprofit organizations (including social groups, foundations, social enterprises, etc.) and related policies.3. Discuss management issues of nonprofit organizations (including administrative management, human resource management, marketing management, financial management, etc.).4. Explore the actual operation of nonprofit organizations.
objectives: 1.透過每週不同的非營利組織主題及相關研究的探討，去剖析NPO發展內容並啟發相關具體實踐思維；2.從跨國模式之思維加以比較，擴展對NPO研究的多元想像。3.透過專題探討NPO的運作模式與實務課題，思考行動策略。4.納入社會企業討論範疇，從社會創新與社會效益觀點探究NPO的永續性。1.Analyze NPO development content and inspire relevant practical thinking through different non-profit organization themes and related research.2. Compare the operation of multinational NPOs and expand the imagination of NPO research.3. Explore the NPO's operations and practical issues through a special topic and think about action strategies.4. Increase the scope of discussion of social enterprises, and explore the sustainability of NPO from the perspective of social innovation and social benefits

Students are required to conduct gendered analysis on their chosen topics and develop gendered innovations.本課程將介紹「性別化創新」的概念與操作方式。在介紹性別分析方法概念及回顧既有創新案例之後，同學需實際選擇一個研究或實務案例進行操作，讓同學在一學分的課程之後，可以掌握性別化創新的方法論而自主應用。

name:
城市治理：危機與創新
URBAN GOVERNANCE: CONTINGENCY AND INNOVATION
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】全球化浪潮下，城市間競爭日趨白熱化，「城市治理」是驅動城市轉型的動能，更是現代化公共事務管理與國家發展的核心，攸關我們的日常生活、形塑我們的未來。然而，「從政府到治理」（From Government to Governance）的推進力量是什麼？「城市治理」能否實現每一個不同的城市願景？「城市治理」是「新瓶裝舊酒」的管制手段，還是各種複雜能量、行動者與網絡的匯聚？我們能否透過「城市治理」來打造獨特而創新的價值？我們如何以不同的治理模式重新定義公共生活中的各種情感和利害問題？我們如何「抗拒共同方向的迷失」，重新定位自己的城市？本課程在於提升及強化選課學生在城市治理領域的專業知能、文獻整合歸納、獨立研究及應用能力。除了嫻熟相關理論及國際趨勢，並能透過全面、多元、具批判性的視角深入理解城市治理的本質與樣態，從而精準而有效率的結合理論與實務，成為能夠實際解決問題的頂尖治理人才。本課程除了介紹「城市治理」的相關理論與國內外發展趨勢，更著重於學術研究與實務應用的連結，透過經典城市個案的分析，探索城市發展與轉型的動力，並針對各種危機與風險的樣態進行深入討論，深化學生的理論基礎與社會實踐能力。課程內容涵蓋全球化與地方治理、公共服務與基礎建設、空間規劃與都市更新、社群媒體與治理轉型、循證治理、智慧治理、協力治理、情感治理等不同面向，引領學生從複雜多變的城市重要議題中思辨治理的本質、運作、構成、產出以及影響，培養跨界、跨領域、跨同溫層、跨世代的對話及創新能力。另外，學期中也會邀請校外專業人士進行專題演講，並安排學生實地參訪政策相關機構或場域，實際了解城市治理的動態過程。Urban governance comprises the various dynamics, models, and movements that guide economic and physical revitalisation, the distribution and mobilisation of resources, the creation of new values, the configuration of policy networks, and other aspects of everyday life in different cities. This course examines governance from political, social, physical and economic perspectives. In addition, we will discuss how affective dynamics drive urban transformation making about particular urban risks and important issues. This course enables students to understand the process, dynamics and scales of urban governance, and its implications for policy innovation and urban vision in the context of globalization. It will explore the major factors contributing to physical and economic transformation in different urban areas. Diverse urban systems and governance models in different cities will be examined. The course will equip students with knowledge to explore how hidden forces influences people’s livelihood, decision-making, social and cultural innovation, economic transition, institutional and political change in their urban life.
objectives: 1.	理解城市治理的不同類型、構成、以及可能衍生的風險2.	整合跨領域的觀點與思考模式，深入理解城市治理的相關議題3.	評估並掌握城市治理的動態複雜性1.	Cope with different forms, configurations, and risks of urban governance2.	Consider issues of urban governance from a range of disciplinary perspective, and integrate different forms of thinking3.	Evaluate and grasp the implications of dynamic complexities in urban governance

name:
永續報告書寫作
WRITING OF SUSTAINABILITY REPORT
tags: ['永續管理微學程', '地方創生與永續發展整合學程', '公共事務與企業社會責任微學程', '企業社會責任學程', '淨零轉型微學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】課程主題分成GRI及相關國際標準之介紹、各國ESG發展趨勢及案例研討、國內ESG績優企業案例研討。透過這些資料學習和瞭解撰寫一本企業的永續報告書（ESG Report）應該注意的事情。This course has the following main themes: Introduction to GRI and related international standards, ESG development trends and cases in various countries, and cases of excellent ESG-performing Taiwan enterprises.
objectives: 透過國際標準瞭解永續報告書之現況，並了解如何撰寫一本企業的永續報告書。期末考試達 70分者另可申請加發「領導力企業管理顧問公司」的「ESG永續管理師合格證書」，但出席須達一定次數以上。This course is aimed to teach students the international standards about sustainability report (previously known as corporate social responsibility report) and learn how to write a sustainability report for companies.Students who have good attendance record and reach 70 points in the final exam could apply for the "ESG Practice Training Course Certificate" of the Leadership Consulting Company.

name:
城市災害管理
URBAN DISASTER MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\PAM615.TXT本課程旨在全面探討災害管理的多元面向，涵蓋從災害管理者的職責到利害關係人的協調、災害規劃與脆弱度分析等關鍵議題。課程將強調公民和企業參與在災害管理中的核心角色，並深入探討有效的災害整備與應對策略。課程進一步聚焦於災後韌性與復原策略，並從永續發展目標（SDGs）的角度，分析氣候變遷引發的災害問題及其應對成本。透過實例與個案研究，學生將能夠將所學理論應用於實際情境中，特別是企業防災與公私協力的實務操作，為未來應對災害管理的專業挑戰做好準備。本課程強調學生的參與和課程討論，並會進行實際案例的探討。若對課程內容或討論環節不感興趣或不願積極參與的同學，建議謹慎選課，以免影響學習效果。This course aims to comprehensively explore the multifaceted aspects of disaster management, covering key topics such as the responsibilities of disaster managers, stakeholder coordination, disaster planning, and vulnerability analysis.The course will emphasize the central roles of citizen and corporate participation in disaster management and will delve into effective disaster preparedness and response strategies. Additionally, it will focus on resilience and post-disaster recovery strategies, analyzing climate-related disaster issues and their associated costs through the lens of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Through real-world examples and case studies, students will learn to apply theoretical knowledge to practical situations, particularly in corporate disaster prevention and public-private collaboration, equipping them to face professional challenges in disaster management.This course prioritizes active student participation and discussion, with a strong emphasis on case studies. Students who are not interested in the course content or unwilling to engage actively in discussions are encouraged to consider their enrollment carefully to avoid impacting their learning experience.
objectives: 修課學員在課程中學習災害管理核心概念，應用於實際情境，提升組織防災與公私協力的能力。Students in this course will learn the core concepts of disaster management, apply them to real-world situations, and enhance their ability in organizational disaster prevention and public-private collaboration.

name:
組織理論與管理
ORGANIZATION THEORY & MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】這門課程以組織理論為基礎，聚焦於組織設計與管理。其主要目標是通過各種視角加強學生對組織本質的理解，從而使他們能夠解釋、分析和預測組織的複雜世界。請查看下方的課程目標、教學方法、要求和主題。如果您有任何問題，請聯繫授課教師以獲取詳情。This course is based on organization theory and focuses on organizational design and management. Its primary goal is to enhance students' understanding of the nature of organizations through various perspectives and subsequently enable them to explain, analyze, and predict the complex world of organizations. Please find the module objectives, methods, requirments and topics below. If you have any question, please get in touch with the instructor for details.
objectives: 本課程將聚焦於組織研究的宏觀層面，整個框架分為18個課程單元，分別圍繞理性系統、開放系統、以及控制與自然系統三大類別。理性系統部分旨在使學生深入理解組織如何形成其戰略目的和結構設計。內容涵蓋組織的經濟視角，包括代理理論和交易成本觀點，並引入組織學習和能力概念，為學生提供組織結構和設計思維的基礎理解。開放系統部分探討塑造組織界限和對環境適應的外部力量。它包括對制度觀點、組織間動態、合作以及生態系統分析的討論，為學生提供一個關於組織環境影響的全面視角。控制與自然系統部分著重於內部設計和控制機制，應用設計思維於實際挑戰中，增強學生的變革管理能力。最後，課程鼓勵學生批判性地審視當代組織，整合有關技術進步、數字化轉型、不同的組織形式以及可持續性的討論。課程結束時，學生將能熟練應用所學概念，對不同組織環境進行診斷並制定戰略干預，以實現最佳性能和可持續增長。This module will focus on the macro-level of organizational studies, structured into 18 sessions categorized under rational systems, open systems, and control and natural systems.The rational system aims to equip students with a nuanced understanding of how organizations formulate their strategic purposes and structural designs. Through a blend of theoretical frameworks including economic perspective of an organization (e.g. agency theory and transaction cost perspective) and organizational learning and capacility, students will have a basic understanding of organizational structure and design thinking. The open system delves into the external forces shaping organizational boundaries and adaptation to the surrounded environment, focusing on the topics such as institutional perspectives, inter-organizational dynamics, collaborations, and ecosystem analyses. The control and natural system emphasizes internal design and control mechanism. Particularly, we will delve into the application of design thinking to address real-world challenges, enhancing students' ability to manage change.Last, students will critically examine contemporary organization, with a focus on integrating technological advancements and digital transformation, different forms of organization, as well as organizational sustainability. By the end of the course, students will be proficient in applying learned concepts to diagnose and devise strategic interventions across diverse organizational settings, aiming for optimal performance and sustainable growth.

objectives: The purposes of this source include: (1) introducing the theory and practices of important HR functions; (2) showing that how HR functions can collectively help companies to achieve strategical goals and enhance the competitiveness; (3) teaching students how to use these knowledge and skills to set up HR practices and solve HR-related problems

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】1. The reasons for studying research methods; Major elements of an academic paper2. How to generate the research questions and framework?3. Issues of sampling, questionnaire survey, and common method variance4. Causal relationship and experimental design5. Scale development, validity and reliability6. Data coding, reliability and exploratory factor analyses7. The application of correlation in management research8. The application of regression analysis in management research9. Hypothesis testing (1): mediating effects10. Hypothesis testing (2): moderating effects11. Tips for writing a good academic papers and academic ethics
objectives: The purpose of this course is to provide students a understanding of various research methods so that they can: (1) develop interesting research questions; (2) effectively use the database to find out useful literature; (3) appreciate the strengths and comment the limitations of each academic paper; (4) propose rigorous research design based on the interested research questions; (5) understand the strengths and limitations of each statistical programs and choose appropriate statistical analyses based on the research design; (6) effectively perform the statistical programs (SPSS) to test hypotheses; (7) correctly interpret the meanings of results and discuss the implications of the findings. Hopefully, the students can apply these techniques to their thesis writing.

name:
策略性任用管理
STRATEGIC STAFFING
tags: ['人力資源管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\HRM642.TXT任用是企業對人力資源實際執行進行管理的第一步，隨著全球經濟競爭的加劇、國內勞動法令的完備、及人力市場中知識工作者的興起，不但對企業在經營上產生莫大的影響，也進而對企業在人力的任用上引發極大的變局。在面對國際企業的激烈競爭中，企業勢必需要採用更有效率與效益的經營方式，而如何使企業在人力的任用上能更有彈性，就成為企業增進績效的重要方式之一。在面對雇用與勞退相關法令的不斷增修中，企業勢必需要有效回應法令對經營成本所造成的影響，而如何採用非典型的雇用方式，就成為企業因應法令與成本兩難局勢的重要方式之一。在面對知識極易伴隨知識工作者在職場中流動，企業勢必需要能更有策略性的找尋與維持企業的核心人力，而如何採用更吸引人的招募與工作變更方式，就成為企業吸引高素質知識工作的重要方式之一。The contents in this course includes employment model and strategy, human resource planning, job analysis, recruitment, measurement, selection, employment, retention, and employment system.
objectives: 本課程的內容將包括用人模式與策略、人力資源規劃、工作分析、招募、測量、甄選、雇用、留任、用人系統、及雇用法令等議題，讓修習同學進行研讀與探討，一方面增進修習者對任用的瞭解與掌握，一方面協助修習者思索未來進行研究或碩士論文的可能方向。To know the functions and operations of staffing in business organizations

name:
應用統計與資料分析
APPLIED STATISTICS AND DATA ANALYSIS
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程是統計學習的入門課程。學生將通過理解關鍵概念,將概念應用於分析數據, 以及清楚地呈現結果 來培養基礎的數據分析技能。在課程結束時，學生將能夠：•	以量化和資料視覺化方式描述數據。•	匹配研究問題與適當的分析方法。•	熟練使用軟體工具進行分析。•	準確解釋及報告數據分析結果。•	以專業的方式呈現統計報告。課程涵蓋主要主題包括描述性統計、概率與抽樣分佈、統計推論、假設檢定、相關分析、變異數分析和迴歸分析。會使用SPSS, JASP, R, 生成式人工智慧 進行不同模型的資料分析This course is an introductory course for learning statistics.. Students will develop foundational skills in data analysis by understanding key concepts, applying these concepts to real-world data, analyzing data effectively, and presenting their findings clearly.By the end of the course, students will be able to:•	Describe data quantitatively and graphically.•	Align research questions with the appropriate analytical methods.•	Use software tools proficiently to conduct analyses.•	Interpret and report data analysis results accurately.•	Communicate statistical findings in a professional manner.The course covers essential topics, including Descriptive Statistics, Probability & Sampling Distributions, Statistical Inference, Hypothesis Testing, Correlation, ANOVA, and Regression. SPSS, JASP, R, and Generative AI will be used to perform data analyses.
objectives: • 了解基本統計概念，包括標準誤差和置信區間。• 熟悉針對連續和類別數據的推論統計方法。• 熟悉一般線性模型的應用。• 掌握估計和假設檢驗程序，並能夠對分析結果進行實質性解釋。• 熟練設置和使用統計軟件程序——SPSS、JASP 和 R，生成式人工智慧來運用不同的分析技術進行數據分析。• Gain a foundational understanding of basic statistical concepts, including standard errors and confidence intervals.• Develop proficiency in inferential statistics for both continuous and categorical data.• Acquire familiarity with the applications of the general linear model.• Master the use of estimation and hypothesis testing procedures, and provide a substantive interpretation of analytic results.• Become proficient in setting up and utilizing statistical software programs—SPSS, JASP, R and Generative AI—to conduct data analyses.

This course demonstrates some data analysis procedures based on commonly used statistical computer software SPSS. Proper interpretation of the statistical analysis results is also one of the course emphases.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\ICM532.TXT線上世界和真實世界中的社交有甚麼不同? 線上世界中的自己和真實世界中的自己一樣嗎? AI能代表我的形象發言嗎? AI跟人類如何溝通並傳播訊息?AR、VR、元宇宙世界裡的消費行為有什麼不同?線上世界中有真友情真愛情嗎? 我的線上履歷該怎樣才能吸引未來雇主? 我要如何在線上展現出職場專業形象? 網紅如何擄獲粉絲的心? 消費者的評論有影響力嗎?約會軟體裡面暗藏了甚麼人性的真(黑)實(暗)面? 偷吃有幾種而誰又最可能偷吃? 網路霸凌和暗黑人格是怎麼回事?他/她為什麼"塑膠"我? 分手還是"社群"朋友嗎? 我為什麼會從社群偷看前任現在在幹嘛? Instagram上的"照騙"到底傳達了甚麼訊息? COVID-19改變了我們哪些網路行為?The digital networked era that is based on consuming ever-increasing content has allowed relationship to be largely built and information to be wildly distributed. This course will examine fundamental aspects of interpersonal communication from the socio-psychological perspectives and consider how different types of computer-mediated communications (CMC) tools such as mobile communication apps, social networking sites, and video and photo sharing platforms may affect communication processes.
objectives: 本課程幫助同學掌握中介傳播(透過電腦、行動載具、AI等科技中介)領域最新研究趨勢，了解各種新興時尚的線上行為背後的理論意涵，建立對新傳播媒體科技使用現象的批判性思考能力，發展出相關的研究主題或方向，並且讓我們能更了解彼此、貼近人性。The goal of this course is to understand how information driven by new communication technology can influence who we are and the relationships we have with others.

name:

MEDIA TECHNOLOGY AND SOCIETY
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程將廣泛及深入地以主流的量化理論與批判的質化理論，來探討大眾傳播發生的過程與效果。大眾傳播理論的根源最初是心理學、社會學、政治學所交會的一個十字路口，然後逐漸蔚然成一專門的領域。因此，本課程將以大眾傳播理論的基礎根源與運用做為開始，再逐次進入不同的各別領域，也就是將傳播的過程分為媒介的制度、組織、內容、閱聽人、及效果等層次，來分別加以討論。
objectives: 課程的進行主要在鼓勵同學主動的閱讀、思考與討論，其目的不在要求同學找尋一個正確的標準答案，而是期望思考過程的豐富與多元。本課程期望能在一學期之內，盡量完成對於大眾傳播理論中量化及批判兩大領域的蒐尋及瞭解。並幫助同學在此一過程中，尋找到可以繼續探尋研究的興趣領域。本課程的設計，是針對傳播理論已有基礎瞭解的同學，提供更進一步的理論探討，課程的進行主要在鼓勵同學主動的閱讀、思考與討論，其目的不在要求同學找尋一個正確的標準答案，而是期望思考過程的豐富與多元。本課程期望能在一學期之內，盡量完成對於媒體科技與社會相關議題的收尋及瞭解，並幫助同學在此一過程中，尋找到可以繼續探尋研究的興趣領域。

INFORMATION LITERACY AND ETHICS
tags: ['資通安全學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course includes the following topics:1.Catalysts for change2.Introduction to ethics(relativism, egoism, utilitarianism, Kant’s categorical imperative, and social contract theory, etc.)3.Networked communications/Social Networks4.Intellectual property5.Information democracy6.Privacy7.Computer and network security8.Information reliability/False news9.Professional ethics
objectives: 本課程綜合探討資訊科技在資訊社會中所引發的諸多倫理議題，包含網路傳播、社群網路、假新聞、智慧財產權、隱私權、電腦與網路安全等主題。課堂中，學生將學習倫理相關理論，如功利主義、社會契約論、康德絕對道德義務論及羅爾斯的正義論等，並利用上述理論分析現今社會之資訊與媒體的相關議題，探討面臨倫理抉擇時應有的反思與應對，藉由個案的分析與研究報告的撰寫，培養學生資訊素養與使用媒體之態度，並建立尊重他人的價值判斷，適切扮演好兼顧個人倫理與專業倫理的角色。The course will help students to identify key problems in the ethics of information technology and propose solutions to those problems, articulate their own values as well as understand and appreciate the values of others within our diverse and multicultural society, and develop ethical problem-solving abilities.

name:

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\ICM557.TXT本課程旨在介紹從事行銷傳播管理相關議題的研究時，所會使用到的研究方法，並以量化研究為核心焦點。This course mainly introduced the research methods adopted in the field of marketing communication, with emphasis on quantitative research.
objectives: 1. 何謂研究方法 (特別是企業研究、行銷研究)？量化研究法 (調查法/實驗法的取捨、執行、抽樣)？研究方法的重要性？什麼是一個好的研究？論文寫作注意事項有哪些？論文題目從哪來？研究架構/研究假說是什麼？... 本課程將深入討論上述議題。2. 使修課學生瞭解執行研究的必備觀念，知曉整個研究流程，能依研究主題採取適當的研究方法與設計、並能有效進行資料的蒐集與分析，俾完成結案報告等。3. 課程修習完畢後，學生應能夠學會如何進行量化研究與分析，並具備獨力完成碩士論文的能力。4. 藉由期末報告的撰寫，真實操作一次實驗設計的流程與結果分析、討論，實際利用課程所學之研究方法，初步完成一個基礎導向型的研究。The purpose of this course is to provide students with a managerial overview of research methods (especially in marketing and communication areas). The course will employ a mix of lectures, discussion of cases, and students’ oral presentation of their final projects. The case write-ups and final projects are conducted by groups. The final project may involve the analysis of datasets and thus some computer packages (i.e., SPSS) need be used.Why study marketing communication research methods? Qualitative versus Quantitative research? The importance of research methods? What is good research? How to write research report? The language of research?to familiarize students with the quantitative techniques and data interpretation of marketing communication researchThe key to familiarizing research methods is “learning by doing”. Only through hands-on experiments, the students could realize the possible knowledge gap and difficulties in executing experiments. Therefore, the topic of the term paper was set to be “Experimental imitation and extension”, which involved experimental design and questionnaires that measured participant response. These ensured their practice of the two main methods of quantitative research (i.e. experiments and questionnaires).

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】課程介紹、內容分析法、傳播理論與應用、文字探勘基礎知識、關鍵字和字典、情緒分析、共詞分析、主題建模、社會網絡資料的轉換和分析、語義網絡分析等This course is designed to introduce the methodology of computerized content analysis and its application in communication theory and research. Main topics include basics of text mining, word frequency, keyword identification, dictionary construction, sentiment analysis, concurrence of words, topic modeling and social network analysis of semantic networks.
objectives: 本課程旨在訓練學生使用電腦（R語言和軟體），分析數位化的媒體內容、網友貼文内容等文字資料及其所包含的語意網絡。通過課堂講授演示、個人練習和小組專題等方式，引導學生使用大數據和文字探勘來檢驗和發展行銷傳播學和其他社會科學的重要理論。This course aims to introduce students the methodology of analyzing text data that retrieved from online media with text mining skills and social network analysis. This class also provides the opportunity for developing a research project that using the text mining skills and social network analysis to test and develop theories in the fields of marketing communication and other social sciences.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=CM503&Crsname=大數據分析、機器學習、與人工智慧方法
name:
大數據分析、機器學習、與人工智慧方法
BIG DATA ANALYTICS, MACHINE LEARNING, AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE
description:
《講授類》
本課程與MIS572併班上課/本課程為商業大數據系列課程之一
tags: ['跨領域智慧製造學程', '製造與大數據分析微學程', '半導體設備工程學程', '永續能源學程', '機器學習與多媒體技術學程', '機器學習與應用微學程', '商業數據分析與創新微學程', '金融數據分析與創新微學程', '計算物理及人工智慧微學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】*** 本課程採「同步遠距含錄影」上課，課程與連線相關資訊將置於本校網路大學課程頁面, 請至本校圖資處首頁網路大學登入****** 未選上課無法登入的同學，第一堂課上課請至 https://meet.google.com/qii-pwtd-ofj ****** 本課程有多個課號(MIS 413/572, CM 503)，請修習相關學程的同學注意 ***Prerequisite:* Programming Proficiency: It is essential for students to have familiarity with at least one high-level programming language.Expertise in scientific programming languages, such as R, Matlab, Python, Julia, or SAS, will be especially beneficial.* Relational Databases & SQL: Students must possess a foundational understanding of relational databases and the Structured QueryLanguage (SQL). This knowledge is pivotal for many data engineering components within the course.* Data Structures Fundamentals: A grasp of basic data structures, including but not limited to arrays, lists, sets, and dictionaries,is vital. This understanding will serve students well as they delve into the intricacies of Data Engineering and Analytics.* Introductory Statistics: A solid grounding in statistical concepts is required. This includes understanding descriptive analytics,which encompasses measures of data dispersion and central tendency, as well as diagnostic analytics, such as hypothesis testing. Suchknowledge will pave the way for a deeper comprehension of data analytics methodologies and statistical machine learning algorithms.* Analytical & Problem-solving Skills: The practical aspects of this course necessitate strong analytical thinking andproblem-solving abilities. Students should be prepared to apply their knowledge to tackle real-world challenges.For those students who may find themselves lacking in any of the outlined prerequisites, it is strongly advised to pursue supplementarycoursework or dedicated self-study. This proactive approach will ensure a richer and more effective learning experience throughout the course.
objectives: This course offers an in-depth exploration of the multifaceted domains of AI, Machine Learning (ML), and Big Data Analytics. Students will gain afoundational understanding of Data Science, tracing its evolution and significance across diverse sectors such as business, healthcare, insurance, and finance.The curriculum addresses essential topics, encompassing Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Analytics, Machine Learning Design Patterns, and the nuancesbetween Supervised & Unsupervised Learning. Enhancing the course content, students will explore foundational concepts like deep neural networks, model architecturedesign, functional programming, and ML Interpretability, which aim to demystify the black-box nature of many ML models. A central component of our curriculumis the transformative potential of large language models, such as the GPT-series, Gemini, and Claude. Students will appreciate how these models are pivotal in data analytics,especially in their capacity to generate R and Python code for streamlined and automated data processing.Throughout the course, the emphasis on practical applications ensures that students garner hands-on experience with the R and Python programming languages,addressing modern data analytics challenges. This course is tailored for those eager to both grasp and apply the principles of data science and ML/AI in concretereal-world contexts.

name:
倫理與社會責任
ETHICS AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
teacher: 謝慧賢,王致遠,鄭安授,陳世哲

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】藉由四大模組（倫理原則、企業社會責任、工作倫理、學術及研究倫理）培養學生對倫理、社會議題的意識。 本課程影片請由網大登入，並於學期規定時程內觀看完畢。https://cu.nsysu.edu.tw/mooc/index.phpThe course is aimed at developing students’ awareness of ethics and social issues by providing four modules (ethical theories, corporate social responsibility, work ethics, academic and research ethics).
objectives: 培養學生對倫理與社會責任相關議題之意識。This course is aimed to foster students’ awareness about ethics and social responsibility issues.

name:
職涯準備
CAREER PREPAREDNESS
tags: ['人力資源管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程為一學分之課程，主要以講授與學生演練方式進行，並搭配來自不同產業及學術背景的業界講者分享創業經驗與職涯規劃的演講，加深修課學生對生涯規劃與發展的思考與準備。課程安排為每周兩小時授課時間，連續進行九週，共十八小時。課程包括以下三個目標，首先讓修課學生進行自我探索，了解其人格特質及個人職業適性後，對應選修科系的專業職能，評估生涯發展。課程的第二部分著重讓修課學生增強個人職涯發展的知識與技能，包括職前的自我評估、求職的專業形象、撰寫專業並個人化的履歷表、面試時的口語與文字表達、職場所需的團隊合作溝通、跨文化及國際化素養等，將職涯準備實際運用於未來的實習與就業上。課程第三大部分，將學習目標著重在結合前兩部分的職涯探索與準備後，進一步透過業界專業人士到課演講，以講者多年的業界經驗、職場實務與時事案例，提供自我探索與職涯準備的方向和建議本課程邀請的三位業界講師分別為阿默蛋糕周守訓董事長、智慧行動公司創辦人暨人權律師童文薰以及澎湖Bunny Café創辦人林育賢，將分享他們創業、跨業經營、生涯發展及職涯規劃的點滴。三位講者其學術養成來自不同領域，共同點卻都有跨領域發展與創業的職涯發展。藉由業界講者的實務經營及創業過程的分享，期能透過課程互動與討論，讓修課學生對職涯發展有更多元、開放的想法與擘劃。另外，本課程也與溫世仁文教基金會合作，以職場即戰力為主軸，透過職場專業展現、提升職場良好形象，以及職場表達與說話技巧等主題，穿插在本課程授課內容以及自主學習的教材中。修課學生也將透過撰寫履歷與自傳、自我表達、模擬面試等實作，做好職涯準備。This course is taught and practiced by students, and is matched with industry speakers to share entrepreneurial experience and career planning. The course includes the following three goals. First, let the students in the course conduct self-exploration, understand their personality traits and personal professional suitability, and then use the analysis results to increase professional functions. The second course goal is to combine workplace practices and current affairs cases. Three guest speakers are inviting to the class, including (1) Mr. Chou, CEO of AMO Cake, (2) Ms. Winifred Tung, Attorney and Founder of Smart Mobile Broadcasting Technology Inc. (SMBT), and (3) Mr. Kelvin Lin, Chairman of Bunny Cafe to share their entrepreneurial, business, life, career planning and development. The third part focuses on enabling students to enhance their personal career development knowledge and skills, including pre-employment self-assessment, professional image of job search, writing professional and personalized resumes, oral and written expressions during interviews, and workplace needs Teamwork communication, cross-cultural and international literacy, etc., will practically apply career preparation to future internships and employment.In addition, this course cooperates with Sayling Wen Cultural and Educational Foundation. It focuses on sustainable competitiveness in the workplace, through professional presentation, building the good image, development expression and speaking skills, etc. Students taking the course will be prepared for their careers through practical exercises such as writing resumes and autobiographies, delivering a TED-like talk, leaving good first impression, establishing personal image to be ready for the career.
objectives: 1 . 探索人格特質及個人職業適性：「你想做什麼？你想變成什麼樣的人？你的人格特質與你的人生方向，就是你的風格。了解自我的優勢與弱點，充實並經營自我特色，建立個人品牌與增強自我行銷力。2. 掌握全球職場趨勢與產業動脈：在國際化浪潮中，每個人都是跨國人才， 如何掌握產業脈動與趨勢，是競爭力與決策的關鍵。3. 養成職場軟實力及專業職能：培育學生軟實力，包含人際關係、時間管理、團隊合作、情緒智商、國際禮儀等。

syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CM512.TXT本課程是【智慧創新跨域人才培育計畫 (https://bap.cm.nsysu.edu.tw/?page_id=5146)】之下三個微學程的第一個共同課程，這個計畫不限系所招收對智慧創新有興趣，願意投入時間學習程式設計和商業數據分析的同學，中山大學所有系所大三以上的在校生都可以參加；對於沒寫過程式的同學，在這一個課程之中妳將學會在R語言的環境之下實際操作各種分析方法，並依據分析的結果來做商業決策；對於資工、資管科系的同學，你將學會如何將你的資訊專長應用到財務會計、人力資源、產品規劃 、定價與競爭等等，這一些公司層級的策略管理活動上面，讓你有更多的機會從機房走進辦公室，從系統管理員晉升為高階經理人。這一個課程同時也為：。 商業大數據分析 (https://bap.cm.nsysu.edu.tw/?page_id=5113)，。 金融科技與服務創新 (https://bap.cm.nsysu.edu.tw/?page_id=802)這三個微學程奠定基礎，為學習大數據、雲端運算、機器學習和人工智慧這一些先進技術和它們的商業應用做好準備。【課程大綱】PART-I 程式語言與機率統計 PROGRAMMING & STATISTICS+ R語言與基本程式設計 Intro. R Language. 。 R語言簡介 Intro. R & RStudio. 。 資料整理與資料探索 Data Manipulation & Exploration. 。 資料視覺化 Data Visualization. 。 基礎機率與統計 Probability & Statistics. 。 機率概論 Fundamental Probability+ 推論統計與模型 Inferential Statistics & Model. 。 尺度縮減與集群分析 Dimension & Cluster. 。 線性回歸與邏輯式回歸 Linear & Logistics Regression.PART-II 商業數據分析實務 BUSINESS ANALYTICS PRACTICES+ 商業數據分析方法的基本應用. 。 資料探索 Exploratory Data Analysis. 。 預測數量 Regression & Predicting Numeric Outcome. 。 預測類別(機率) Classification & Predicting Probability. 。 市場區隔 Clustering Analysis, Market Segmentation+ 顧客價值管理資料案例 CASE: Market Simulation & Marketing Plan. 。 交易紀錄 Transaction Log. 。 經營狀況分析 Trend & Cross Analysis. 。 顧客分群與標籤 Segmentation, Clustering & Tagging. 。 群組特徵、群間流量 Group Characteristics & Group Dynamics. 。 預測回購機率與營收貢獻 Re-Purchase Prob. & Exp. Revenue. 。 計算顧客終生價值. 。 從預測到決策 Prediction vs. Decision. 。 假設與模擬 Assumption and Simulation. 。 設定行銷標的 Target Customers & Marketing Objectives. 。 設計行銷工具 Marketing Instrument Design (with Assumption). 。 市場模擬 Marketing Simulation. 。 預估績效 Performance Evaluation【選修條件】 這是一個內容份量相當重的課程，每一週上課之前妳需要先做課前預習(YouTube預習影片或Readings)，聽完指定的線上課程單元，每一單元上完課都會有好幾份程式要寫，隨著課程的進度會有一系列的線上測驗和認證，妳常會需要在助教時間到教室來跟大家一起討論才能完成，期中、期末的小組專案作業的份量也會很重，整個學期妳需要跟不同系所的同學(我們會強制跨系所分組)分工合作、互補專長、互助學習，才會有好的成績；取決於妳原來對程式語言和機率統計的熟悉程度，平均每一週妳會需要預留9到12個小時(含上課)的時間在這個課程裡面，所以雖然我們沒有【限修條件】，我們希望妳詳細考慮過妳的時間安排之後再來選修。No Pain, No Gain! 不論妳原來的背景和基礎，只要妳付出足夠多的時間，妳就能夠在這一系列課程之中學會程式設計、機率統計、大數據、雲端運算、人工智慧以及它們的商業實務應用，增加妳在數位社會之中的價值、提高妳在就業市場的競爭力。【Course Web Page】 https://bap.cm.nsysu.edu.tw/?page_id=1558Capitalizing the business school’s Big Data Computation Platform, in this course we teach: (1) R Language Basics, (2) Data Visualization and Exploration, (3) Basic Statistics Methods, (4) High-Level Application R-Packages, and (5) Optimization & Strategic Planning. Besides business analysis, this course also prepares the students for advanced technical courses related to big data, machine learning and artificial intelligence.【Course Outlines】PART-I PROGRAMMING & STATISTICS+ Intro. R Language. 。 Intro. R & RStudio. 。 Data Manipulation & Exploration. 。 Data Visualization. 。 Probability & Statistics. 。 Fundamental Probability+ Inferential Statistics & Model. 。 Dimension & Cluster. 。 Linear & Logistics Regression.PART-II BUSINESS ANALYTICS PRACTICES+ Fundamental Analytics. 。 Exploratory Data Analysis. 。 Regression & Predicting Numeric Outcome. 。 Classification & Predicting Probability. 。 Clustering Analysis, Market Segmentation+ CASE : Market Simulation & Marketing Plan. 。 Transaction Log. 。 Trend & Cross Analysis. 。 Segmentation, Clustering & Tagging. 。 Group Characteristics & Group Dynamics. 。 Re-Purchase Prob. & Exp. Revenue. 。 Customer Lifetime Value. 。 Prediction vs. Decision. 。 Assumption and Simulation. 。 Target Customers & Marketing Objectives. 。 Marketing Instrument Design (with Assumption). 。 Marketing Simulation. 。 Performance Evaluation【Prerequisite】Although there is no mandatory prerequisite items, this course loading is quite heavy. For those who do not have programming experience, it'd take about 6 ~ 10 hours per week to finish the personal and team assignments.
objectives: 本課程的首要目標是【1】幫助非資訊領域的同學跨越程式語言的進入障礙，我們認為學習程式語言的重點在於實作，所以簡單介紹完R語言之後，我們會 【2】在R語言的環境下幫同學複習基本的機率與統計分析方法，然後我們會使用實際的資料案例，讓同學們 【3】學習如何使用程式語言和機率統計來幫助我們處理重要的商業實務，如：市場區隔、品牌定位、價量關係、定價策略、產品設計、市場競爭等等。在我們正式介紹大數據相關的技術之前，我們計畫透過這一系列的資料案例讓同學們親身【4】體驗程式語言、機率統計和商管知識這三者之間的強大綜效。There're three major course objectives :1. Introduce R Language. Overcome the entry barrier of programming language with interactive notebooks, web-pages and web-based simulation tools.2. Prepare the students for advanced analytics courses that involve big-data, ma-chine learning and/or artificial intelligence, e.g., the summer class offered by the college of management.3. Develop major business analytics skills, including market segmentation, brand positioning, customer value management, revenue management, new product development, product design, product line planning, price discrimination, and competitive/dynamic pricing.4. To experience the synergy among programming language, statistics and managerial knowledge.

name:
商管軟體設計
BUSINESS MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE DESIGN
description:
《講授類》
本課程為商業大數據系列課程之一
tags: ['商業數據分析與創新微學程', '金融數據分析與創新微學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程為教育部智慧創新關鍵人才躍升計畫所支援開設課程，期望透過課程的設計能培育非資訊相關系所潛力菁英學生，具備以資訊軟體核心技術解決領域問題能力。This course is offered with support from the Ministry of Education's Smart Innovation Key Talent Advancement Program. The aim is to cultivate promising elite students from non-information-related departments, equipping them with the ability to address domain-specific issues using core information software technologies.課程初期會先傳遞設計思考理念，培養學生以人為本的觀點，透過使用者的角度去體驗，以達到真正最符合使用者的設計，從而運用設計思考於解決商業與科技相關問題，課程中後階段將帶學生進入UI/UX和Python的實務操作，包含基礎的程式設計到商業上的各種應用，此外，在教學過程中也會加入軟體工程實務。In the initial phase of the course, the design thinking concept will be introduced, fostering a human-centered perspective among students. This will enable them to empathize from the user's standpoint and achieve designs that truly cater to users' needs. Subsequently, the course will progress to hands-on practices in UI/UX and Python. This includes foundational programming skills as well as various business applications. Additionally, the instructional process will incorporate software engineering practices.
objectives: 本課程訓練學生了解商業場域需求並具備程式能力來實作方案，將介紹如何透過設計思考來找出需求並提出解決方案，並教授使用者介面設計（UI）以落實方案的親和性，最後教授Python程式設計來落實方案的邏輯和程序。This course aims to train students in understanding business domain requirements and equipping them with programming capabilities to implement solutions. It will introduce how to use design thinking to identify needs and propose solutions. The course will cover user interface design (UI) to enhance the user-friendliness of solutions. Finally, it will teach Python programming to implement the logic and processes of the solutions.

name:
金融數據分析
FINANCIAL DATA ANALYSIS
description:
《講授類》
本課程與FM617併班上課。本課程為商業大數據系列課程之一
tags: ['金融數據分析與創新微學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】FinTech的賦權投資人(Empowered Investor)概念，將導引未來金融市場朝向CS（Computer Science）與金融商品操作的整合發展上。因此，全方位個人理財人才的培養，不僅要瞭解市面上的金融工具外，更必須具備一定程度的資料處理與分析能力，以因應未來FinTech趨勢下的市場競爭。本課程的目標是以資料科學(Data Science)為主，透過R語言程式設計能力，培養全方位理財人才，從巨量的量化財務信息分析出合適的個人理財交易策略。FinTech's Empowered Investor concept will guide the future development of financial markets towards the integration of CS (Computer Science) and financial commodity operations. Therefore, the cultivation of all-round personal financial management talents must not only understand the financial instruments on the market, but also must have a certain degree of data processing and analysis capabilities in order to cope with the market competition under the trend of FinTech in the future. The goal of this course is to focus on Data Science, to develop a full range of financial management talents through R language programming skills, and to analyze appropriate personal financial trading strategies from a huge amount of quantitative financial information.
objectives: 因應未來FinTech趨勢，本課程的教學目標就是從資料科學(Data Science)角度出發，透過R語言程式教學，培養學生運用R程式能力，從量化財務信息分析出合適的個人理財交易策略，達到全方位理財能力。本課程前半段將專注在R語言教學，後半段專注在運用R語言分析相關交易策略之可行性。Cultivate the students have the ability of data science. Teach students R language and programing. Focus on R programing at the beginning, and use R to create trading strategy after that. Finally, cultivate students to be FinTech talents.

name:

SUSTAINABLE FINANCE
description:
《講授類》
永續管理微學程課程之一
tags: ['企業社會責任學程', '永續管理微學程', '地方創生與永續發展整合學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CM515.TXT本課程是「永續管理微學程」的一門核心課程，而永續金融則是目前最夯的永續議題之一，因為它不僅涉及金融業，也影響到企業是否能順利獲得融資和投資。本課程涵蓋永續金融的概念與實務，包括永續金融的概念與其對生態永續和企業發展的影響、有關的國際趨勢與規範、永續金融的運作方式等。授課師資除國際資產管理研究所所長王昭文和中山管院永續與社會責任辦公室主任林新沛以外，並有校外專家協同教學，藉此提供學生對永續金融更全面的認識，增進就業競爭力，尤其是在銀行與保險業的就業優勢。有關「永續管理微學程」的詳情請參見https://cutt.ly/e2ut1O4This course is to introduce the concept and practices of sustainable finance, as well as its related international trends and regulations. It is also a core course of the Miniprogram for Sustainable Management, as explained in https://cutt.ly/e2ut1O4
objectives: 增進學生就業機會及競爭力，培養學生對永續金融和有關變革趨勢的認識，以利他們進入金融、保險或其他企業任職，並在永續發展的議題上發揮更大影響力。This course is aim to enhance students’ competitiveness and employment opportunity. Through this course, students will learn (1) the meaning and trends of sustainable finance and (2) the challenges and opportunities to banks and insurance companies under such trends. This knowledge will help students acquire jobs in banks, insurance companies, or other corporations.

name:
ESG永續資產管理
ESG SUSTAINABLE ASSET MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
每次2-3小時密集授課，共7次
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Besides seeking investment returns under limited risk control, ESG (environment, social, governance) asset management involves sustainability and social responsibility. As a result, it is gaining increasing value in the financial industry today. Professional fund managers from Fubon Asset Management Co., Ltd. were invited to deliver lectures on asset management to students. The course covers how to use ESG to implement asset management strategies, introduction to ETFs, integrating ESG factors into active/passive investment processes, the driving force and application of sustainable investments, sustainable stock investment research methods, asset allocation practices, industry analysis, bond market analysis, cross-school competitions for sustainable investment portfolios, company visits, etc. Students should be able to understand the importance of ESG sustainable asset management after taking this course.
objectives: The objective of this course is to introduce sustainable asset management through cooperation with Fubon Asset Management Co., Ltd. Students are able to gain a better understanding of sustainable development and consolidate the application and trends of ESG in investment by taking courses like ESG sustainable investment, technology assessment in asset management, and group practical competitions. Additionally, this course combines company visits with career sharing to help students gain a deeper understanding of asset management careers and prepare them for their future career goals.

name:
組織理論與管理
ORGANIZATIONAL THEORY & MANAGEMENT
tags: ['人力資源管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Organizational Theory and Management is a fundamental course in the field of management. The concept of “Organization” involves not only “hard” elements such as structure and rules/regulations but also “soft” elements such as human and interpersonal concerns. Moreover, “Organizational Design” is a strategic rather than an operational issue only. As a result, participants should remain a flexible mindset in order to learn more from this course•This course intends to balance theories and practices. It highlights the practical implications of organizational theories in order for participants to understand the operational logics and success/failure factors of various organizations. Participants will know the principles/rules of organizational design and some important issues such as culture, learning, innovation, politics, and change etc. from this course.
objectives: 1. Help participants understand the core concepts of organizational theories and their implications2. Help participants understand the fundamental logics and principles of organizational design and operation.3. Advance participants’ capabilities in leading organizational renewal and transformation in the future.

name:
人力資源管理
HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
與GHRM併班
※英語授課
tags: ['人力資源管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\BM506.TXTThis course provides an overview of the essential practices for managing human resources. Throughout the semester, students will learn how to make theoretically and empirically sound decisions on how to design a job, how to attract talent, whom to hire, what to pay, how to train and develop employees, and how to evaluate performance. These practices are important because they affect employees’ motivation and ability to provide products and services that customers value, which in turn impacts an organization’s performance.Through the years, human resource management (HRM) has evolved from an administrative function (focusing on filling out forms and processing paperwork) into a more active role in supporting the organization’s strategy. Therefore, we will also discuss how effective HR strategies can be crafted to help organizations gain sustainable competitive advantages.
objectives: Goal #1: Increase content knowledge relevant to the field of HRMGoal #2: Learn to apply HRM theories and research to “real” world contextGoal #3: Gain hands-on experience in HR consulting— apply theories and practices to an HR issue faced by an organization and provide professional recommendations for addressing the issues

Topics covered include descriptive statistics, probability and sampling distributions, point and interval estimation, hypothesis testing, and regression modeling. Statistical software packages are introduced to provide students hand-on experience.
objectives: Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:•	Perform descriptive and inferential statistics correctly with clear interpretation•	Apply statistical skills instructed from the class to develop and detect statistical hypothesis in response to managerial business problems•	Apply statistical software packages to perform statistical analysis
