INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS MANAGEMENT
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】隨疫情影響逐漸降低，全球經貿往來漸趨熱絡，且因國和國間的貿易障礙逐漸降低、以及相關區域型經濟整合協議的簽訂 (例如 RCEP與USMCA等)，許多企業將其經營觸角延伸至海外範疇與市場，如此除可將其所創造的產品與服務銷售到海外顧客，並以更具有效率與效能之方式取得來自海外的資源、技術、科技與資本 (包括人力資源與原物料等)，進而強化所具有的競爭優勢。然雖國際企業模式可為企業帶來許多競爭優勢，但同時間也須面臨到許多挑戰與困難，此係因每個國家之產業環境與文化特色均有所不同，且通常會與企業的母國產業環境與文化特色相異，也因如此，國際企業須針對不同國家的產業與文化環境來規劃、制定與執行適合的國際競爭策略，相關程序包含國際企業策略規劃與執行兩部分，唯有適當地運用國際企業策略管理程序，國際企業才能有效建構競爭優勢。考量於此，本課程著重於介紹與分析國際企業管理之內涵與本質，並透過Kahoot、樂高模擬與個案討論方式，來讓修課同學深入了解管理國際企業所需的策略思維與技巧。Globalization has become increasingly important in today’s economy. Not surprisingly, a large number of firms have developed their businesses into foreign markets and become multinational corporations in order to build strong competitive advantage. However, there are differences in different countries’ cultures, natures and features, etc. Multinational corporations could face challenges in managing international businesses. In this context, this course is designed to deepen students’ understandings of international business management especially paying attention to three parts. First of all, insights into international business management are introduced. Second, approaches and strategies to analyse international businesses are elaborated. Third, important cases and issues relating to international businesses are discussed.
objectives: Upon completion of this course, students will have a good understanding of international business management.

name:
倫理與領導
ETHICS AND LEADERSHIP
tags: ['科技創新與服務業管理學程', '人力資源管理學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】企業倫理在企業經營過程中扮演非常重要的角色，企業是否具備良好的倫理，會影響其經營績效。為深入探討企業倫理與經營策略運用之關係，本課程將著重於探索企業倫理之內涵與重要理論，並深入解釋此概念與企業經營模式之關係，並將透過Kahoot與個案討論之方式來探討重要之企業倫理議題，如此修課同學將對於企業倫理之概念有更深入的理解與認識。During the past few years, the idea of business ethics has received much attention from industries and academia. Such an idea has played an important role in determining firms’ performance. Accordingly, this course puts an emphasis on introducing the nature of business ethics and its relationship with strategy formation and implementation. It consists of three parts. The first part is to introduce insights into business ethics. The second part is to clarify the linkages between business ethics and management. Finally, important cases and issues relating to business ethics are analysed and discussed.
objectives: Upon completion of this course, students will have a good understanding of business ethics and can take such a concept into account in conducting business management.

name:
倫理與領導
ETHICS AND LEADERSHIP

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程為企業管理研究所碩士班二年級的課程，主要介紹企業倫理的基本概念，主要內容包含以下四大議題1. 規範倫理學的基本概念2. 企業社會責任的概念3. 行為倫理學4. 組織倫理學This course will not discuss the basic concept of business ethics. The following areas will be included1. Normative ethics2. The basic concept of corporate social responsibility.3. Behavioral ethics.4. Organizational ethics.尚未輸入
objectives: 修習完本課程後，學生應該可以：1) 從非經濟觀點瞭解企業是什麼，以及其該有的社會責任2) 從行為倫理學觀點，瞭解個人倫理行為的構成與影響因素3 )從組織設計與行為觀點，瞭解領導者可如何影響組織成員的價值觀與建立倫理文化After studying this course, students are expected to1) Understand the business organization and its social responsibility from a non-economic perspective.2) understand how an individual’s ethical attitudes and behaviors are affected from a behavioral ethics perspective.3) understand how leaders can affect subordinates’ value systems and establish an ethical organization.

name:
市場與法律
MARKET AND LAW
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Part I. The Analytical Framework1. Governments and the Macro-Organization of Economic Activity: A Historical and Spatial Perspective2. Globalization and National Government Policies: An Economist's View3. A Business Analytic Approach to Governments and Globalization4. An International Political Economy Perspective5. The Architecture of Globalization: State Sovereignty in a Networked Global EconomyPart II. Country Case Studies (Team Essays by Students in this Class.)1. Fair trade law2. Consumer protection statutePart III. Implications for National and Supra-National Governance1. Implications for National Governments2. Should there be Multilateral Rules on Foreign Direct Investment?自2019年美中貿易戰爭爆發，接著新的國際競爭又以科技為核心，而企業在新的科技創新和競爭下，面臨不斷的挑戰，經營的戰略與手法不斷更新。今日，每一個「決策管理」過程，企業管理者都面對了市場與法律的糾結；尤其在行銷與通路、人力資源，甚至是策略管理的實務上！但是，另一方面，市場的風險也大量提高，而「商業間諜」與「黑心企業」永遠存在嗎？暗黑勢力永遠蠢動在資本與國家的結合過程嗎？例如，企業勝出先以營業秘密得失做表現嗎？法律真能保護消費者與勞工嗎？* 本學期此一課程以「營業秘密法」和「消費者保護法」兩套法律與實例與趨勢為主題，而內容主要含括5項問題的討論：問題1：法律 vs. 市場～市場與法律的關係為何？是干涉？還是助長呢？經濟(或者市場)是一個獨立運作的系統，或是有其他條件確保其存在，例如政策與法律？問題2：當代的市場樣貌？～在討論經濟相關議題時，常聽到凱恩斯主義、新自由主義這些名詞，這些概念內容為何？如何落實為具體的經濟活動呢？依循這些原則下的經濟就是好的經濟嗎？我們何妨以營業秘密法和消費者保護法兩項，進行檢驗和討論？問題3：（利害關係的管理？）國家、市場、企業與消費者，哪種關係？～如果說，一個管理者在「決策選擇」的關頭，面對國家、市場、企業與消費大眾四者互相影響，那麼這些影響的因素與機制為何？問題4：國際市場？管理的組織及其角色？～關於商務決策管理，「國家、市場、(其他)企業與消費大眾」四者的關係與互動，各種國際市場中，管理組織的作用有哪些呢？問題5：如何評價當代市場發展？～經過前面四項主題的討論後，企業管理者都面對了市場與法律的糾結，我們如何評價今日的市場商品化之發展？其次，關於法律與市場的脈絡分析，本學期課程的主軸以「營業秘密法」和「消費者保護法」兩套法律與實例為主題，而歷史發展的命題依序為：第1部分：總論～經濟需要市場嗎？需要法律嗎？第2部分：台灣對照歐美：經濟的法律環境與秩序第3部分：西方法律系統對現代經濟與社會的影響歡迎喜歡討論「企業管理者如何面對市場與法律的糾結？」命題的同學們，一起加入。
objectives: The subject provides a strong overview of the global marketplace in which governments interact with international corporations, and the seminars present up-to-date analysis of recent changes in governmental regulation of business. Especially for the topics of fair trade law and consumer protection statute.本課程以「營業秘密法」和「消費者保護法」兩套法律與實例與趨勢為主題，透過各週逐項議題討論，希冀修課同學能：1.洞察基礎概念：理解課程介紹之理論的基礎概念，並能加以應用「商務決策」；同時對現象面有更深入的剖析能力。2.增進個案研究：透過「個案研究」對實例的研讀，體認「決策管理的市場與法律之雙重基礎」，促進同學個案剖析與寫作能力。3.鍛鍊決策管理：經由時代演變，針對「決策管理」過程，對於市場與法律糾結之研究問題的發想、研究方法的設計。

name:
產業競爭分析
INDUSTRIAL COMPETITION ANALYSIS
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\BM661.TXT近年來，隨科技進步與產業環境變化，讓產業競爭漸趨激烈，為在此競爭情況下建構競爭優勢，企業之管理者與相關人員須針對所處的內外部環境與競爭態勢執行分析，而後進一步發展適當的競爭策略，如此強化企業競爭力。為協助建構所需分析與規劃能力，本課程著重於針對產業競爭分析之內涵與本質做深入的探討，並透過Kahoot、樂高模擬與個案討論方式，來讓修課同學進一步認識產業競爭分析的策略思維與技巧。In recent years, industrial competition has become intense. In respond, firms have to carefully conduct an industrial analysis and then make use of suitable strategies to build strong competitive advantage. However, their managers could face challenges in selecting and deploying the right and appropriate competitive strategies. In this context, this course is designed to deepen students’ understandings of industrial competition analysis.
objectives: Upon completion of this course, students will have a good understanding of industrial competition analysis.

name:
企業分析與諮詢
BUSINESS ANALYSIS AND CONSULTANCY
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Business diagnosis is a process of working backwards to identify reasons for unsatisfactory performance by making the appropriate links between causes and effects. And, Management consulting is the practice of providing consulting services to organizations to improve their performance or in any way to assist in achieving organizational objectives. This course offer students to identify business problem(s), to collect data from the field, to utilized qualitative and quantitative analysis on your data, and then, to draw conclusions for improving your business operations. This class is taught in small group style with your own case. Cases from manufacturing, marketing, healthcare, finance, strategy planning, and others are all welcomed.本學期（113-1）課程內容針對企業經營系統的全部或局部，進行客觀性的檢視、分析、評估，找出問題點，並據以研擬改進方案或建議，提供企業經理人參酌改進，以提升企業經營績效，並增加獲利及降低成本之機會。因此，企業分析主要包括：1.綜合診斷(general diagnosis)：（1）營運特性診斷，（2）基本管理診斷，（3）管理功能診斷；2.專門診斷(special diagnosis)。而運用課堂討論的8件個案研究，從企業下市啟示、台積電外移設廠、豐田集團問題清單增加、蘋果電動車泰坦計劃、巴林銀行與里森、戴爾如何從傳統走向敏捷？到環球晶併購世創、NVIDIA 與 ARM 的失敗收購案，現況與爭議，課程將逐步重點討論：經營危機、制度危機、倫理危機、安全危機、競爭危機、解決問題的模式、技巧與步驟等面向。接著，企業諮詢則著重於：1.重點導向與集中處理原則：應置於主要的問題之上。2.考慮問題之間的互動層面：針對前項關鍵性的問題來探討。3.分辨癥候與問題根本原因：需要詳細分辨其間的因果關係。4.注意系統化原則：提供企業經理人參酌改進。5.重視比較分析機制：以提升企業經營績效。
objectives: Students will be developed with problem solving skills which are widely used for continuous improvement in all industries. Also, students are expected to approach the sound decisions in operations within the complex and uncertain business environment.本學期（113-1）課程目的在於協助學生培養以下管理能力，包括：1.偵測內外環境的變化，指出管理實況的癥候及待改善之問題。2.分析經營問題的根因，檢討經營策略的方向並加以修正。3.健全整個企業的運作，提高長期財務的收益及企業的利潤。4.確保整體目標的達成，防範企業危機的發生及控管可預期之風險。5.達成企業的永續經營，並藉以阻止企業的舞弊及財務風險發生。

健康服務流程管理
OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT IN HEALTHCARE
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】健康服務流程管理主要講授有關醫療精實的現況，在醫療人力不足的現況，醫院除了對外應徵專業人才外，更要努力留住現有員工。本課程探討醫療作業流程中存在許多的浪費，而這些浪費的降低，能使整個流程更為順暢，讓整個工作的環境變得更為友善，做到「降低浪費、創造價值」的最終目的。課程中也會探討「持續改善」與「對人的尊重」兩個非常重要的核心價值，也期許學生能實現「終生學習」的人生目標。Healthcare Service Process Management primarily addresses the current state of Lean Healthcare. In the context of healthcare workforce shortages, hospitals not only need to actively recruit professional talent but must also strive to retain their existing staff. This course explores the various inefficiencies within healthcare operational processes, highlighting how reducing these inefficiencies can streamline the entire workflow, create a more friendly work environment, and ultimately achieve the goal of "reducing waste and creating value." The course also delves into two critical core values: "continuous improvement" and "respect for people." Students are encouraged to embrace these principles and pursue the lifelong learning goal.
objectives: 一、了解什麼是「精實」二、了解醫院進行「精實管理」會遇到的瓶頸與解決之道。三、了解「自働化」的真正意涵。四、透過期中報告與期未報告中主要練習表達與溝通的能力。五、透過生成式人工智慧的協助，讓學生在課程中能有所創造力。1.Understand the concept of "Lean."2.Understand the challenges hospitals face in implementing "Lean Management" and the strategies to overcome them.3.Understand the true meaning of "Jidoka" (Autonomation).4.Practice and enhance communication and presentation skills through mid-term and final reports.5.Foster creativity in students during the course with the assistance of generative artificial intelligence.

The corresponding elderly industries are also booming, bringing endless business opportunities. This course will be combined with practical aspects to provide students with first-hand experience in the operation and management of the elderly industry, learn and practice how to efficiently operate and manage the elderly industry, and cultivate the necessary experience and connections for students to actively enter this industry, so that they can smoothly enter the industry. Design and implement business models that promote the well-being of elderly clients while ensuring profitability and sustainability.

The curriculum centers on fostering adeptness in planning and decision-making for health services managers. Encompassed within are subjects such as values inhealth, healthcare and health insurance demand, cost and pricing dynamics within the healthcare sector, comparative static analysis, asymmetric information,barriers to entry, government intervention, and economic evaluation, among others. By assimilating these economic theories, students will be empowered toadeptly apply their knowledge to current healthcare policy and management quandaries.
objectives: This course is for students who are interested in health economics, health policy and health care management. At the end of the course, students are expected toapply economic theory to address policy and management issues with global perspectives and critical thinking.

They can also delay the need for long-term care for the elderly through preventive strategies. This course discusses all issues related to long-term care from both micro and macro perspectives.中文說明：不必先上過任何醫管的課程，也能修課。本課程有規劃參訪活動（計算課程分數），如果無法撥出時間參與參訪的同學，請勿選修。然若因疫情關係，無法順利參訪時，改成上課。
objectives: Upon completing this course, students will be prepared to:‧	Demonstrate an understanding of the system of long-term care services and how it has been shaped by historical, political, demographic and economic factors;‧	Compare the long-term care system in Taiwan with systems in other parts of the world;‧	Analyze the variety of long-term care services available for people of different ages:‧	Describe and differentiate the various “facilities” that combine housing and services for older adults; and‧	Understand management issues for long term care‧	Identify and analyze ethical values and legal issues related to many long-term care issues.

name:
醫療監管科學
REGULATORY SCIENCE OF MEDICAL HEALTHCARE
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】For the current regulatory agencies in the United States, China, the European Union and Japan, due to the formal launch of the Regulatory Science Program, as the target research object of the course, the government documents, data compilations and related literature of these countries and regions are analyzed and reviewed. Key topics include:1. Making and evolution of Regulatory Science;2. Regulatory agencies of medical healthcare;3. Policy and legal alignment;4. Talent development;5. Innovative models expanding scientific collaboration;6. Regulatory metrics and guidelines.醫療監管科學是近期越發重要而有趣的學門。基本上，監管科學中存在差距，因此需要解決這些差距，以改善藥物開發和評估，最終使其獲得滿足患者需求的創新藥物成為可能。因此，不同於過往以看守和監控為主，至少3個正向的新導向值得我們研究：(1)激勵藥物開發研究人員和資助組織，(2)提供新的主題和相關研究的參考資料，(3)加速藥物開發的創新並轉化為有效、高品質的療法。針對當前美國、中國、歐盟和日本的藥品監管機構，因正式啟動了監管科學計劃，而做為課程的目標研究對象，對這些國家與地區的政府文件、數據彙編和相關文獻進行分析和審查。本學期（113-1）課程，運用課堂討論的16件個案研究，從醫護人員欠缺、勞資爭議、用藥的短缺、醫療產業關於創新科技…，到企業併購或策略聯盟的實例，現況與爭議，主要內容包括：1.	科學的形成與沿革：關於醫療監管科學的定義尚無共識，但發展和應用監管科學的願景卻是相同的，即開發新的工具、標準和指南，以提高評估受管制產品的風險和收益的有效性和效率。2.	藥品監管機構：每個藥品監管機構都確定了各自監管科學發展的優先領域和特定目標，這些目標是基於技術（例如毒理學、臨床評估）、過程（例如與醫療保健系統的伙伴關係）或產品（例如藥物設備組合產品）的目標集合。3.	政策與法制的配合：持續支持和定期審查監管科學的發展，對於藥品監管機構更加有效地應對法規方面，建置健全體制的科學性挑戰至關重要。4.	人才培育：增強工作人員能力，提高監管效率和透明度，以及改善跨境溝通能力被認為是監管科學發展的主要成果。5.	創新模式擴大科學合作：為了推進醫療監管科學，藥品監管機構已為員工培訓、研究項目資金、信息技術建設和實驗室基礎設施提供了大量資源，同時通過多種創新模式擴大科學合作。6.	監管衡量與準則：衡量監管科學的產出包括科學出版物、受資助項目、監管機構交互、評估方法和監管準則。
objectives: Regulatory science of medical healthcare refers to the scientific and technical underpinnings on which regulations in various industries, especially those involving health or safety, are based. This course tends to provide students with a basic understanding of the development and application of regulatory science, and to analyze the practical implementation experience of developing regulatory science in specific countries, including the experience of drug regulatory agencies in the United States, China, the European Union and Japan.醫療監管科學是指各種行業（尤其是涉及健康或安全的行業）法規所依據的科學和技術基礎。本課程提供學生對於發展和應用醫療監管科學的基本瞭解，並且分析特定國家推行發展監管科學的實際執行經驗，包括美國、中國、歐盟和日本的醫療監管機構的經驗。

Be able to set up and execute the statistical software program SPSS to perform data analysis using different analytical techniques

ACCOUNTING
description:
《講授類》

tags: ['金融工程學程']
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course aims to provide a comprehensive introduction to accounting and financial management concepts and techniques.In the first section, we will cover the basics of accounting and introduce financial statements, including the statement of financial position, statement of financial performance, and statement of cash flow. We will also discuss accrual accounting concepts and how they are used in the preparation of financial statements.Next, we will delve into financial statement analysis, including how to interpret and analyze financial statements to assess the financial health of a company. We will also cover budgeting and cost volume profit analysis, including break-even analysis and product mix decisions.We will also examine the concept of capital investment, including how to evaluate and make informed decisions about potential investments. Finally, we will discuss performance evaluation and the balanced scorecard, which provides a holistic approach to measuring and managing organizational performance.Throughout the course, we will use real-world examples and case studies to apply the concepts and techniques learned. By the end of this course, you will have a solid foundation in accounting and financial management and be well-equipped to make informed financial decisions in your business career.
objectives: Learning Outcomes1 Understand financial statement preparation and analysis, including the use of accrual accounting concepts.2 Develop technical skills in accounting, including the ability to interpret financial statements.3 Understand the use of budgeting in business planning and decision making.4 Analyze the impact of cost, volume, and profit on business operations, including the use of break-even analysis and product mix decisions.5 Understand capital investment decisions, including the use of performance evaluation techniques such as the balanced scorecard.

name:
社會企業商業模式發展與實作
BUSINESS MODEL DEVELOPMENT AND PRACTICE OF SOCIAL ENTERPRISES
description:
《講授類》
限IBMBA學程及GHRM MBA學程學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理時加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The objective of this subject is to familiarize students with the concept and case studies in relation to social enterprises (SEs). Under the design of course, students will be exposed to real world practices of how to produce business proposal of SEs, through which learners are encouraged to develop SEs as well as contribute their creativities to the solution of social problems. In addition, the course also addresses impact assessment using the Social Return on Investment framework to analyze the impact of social enterprises, encouraging students to propose strategies for maximizing impact through quantitative impact management.This course will organize activities under the 2024 Higher Education Sprout Project at National Sun Yat-sen University, including an 'Innovation Proposal Competition for an Aging Society,' guest lectures in English, and visits to social enterprises.Teams selected to participate in the finals of the innovation proposal competition will be able to register for the Social Innovation Business Model Workshop for free. Through group discussions and creative brainstorming, participants will engage in cross-disciplinary exchanges, learning, interaction, and sharing. With guidance from industry experts and advisory/mentoring committees, they will receive support in business model development and entrepreneurship, ultimately completing a comprehensive plan for a social innovation business model.
objectives: On the completion of the course, students will be able to:• Understand the development and practices of social enterprise business models, grasp the application and innovations of assistive technology, and become familiar with entrepreneurial management.• Sharpen students' abilities in critical thinking, innovation, entrepreneurship, and their awareness of social issues, encouraging them to dedicate themselves to addressing these problems.• Generate a marketable business proposal that will greatly contribute to solving social problems.

INTERNATIONAL ECONOMICS
description:

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course deals with competitiveness and interactivity in the global economy. The first part of the course covers theoretical and applied aspects of international trade such as comparative and competitive advantage, as well as trade policy and the role of multinational corporations. The second part covers the institutional foundations of national and regional competitiveness, with a focus on processes of interjurisdictional competition and cooperation.
objectives: Upon completion of this course students will be able to:1. Understand the basic theory of international trade2. Apply theories of international trade to real-world problems3. Understand the spatial relationships between different factors of production4. Understand the role of multinational corporations and foreign direct investments in the world economy5. Identify the factors that influence national and regional competitiveness6. Pinpoint the organizational, locational, and institutional factors that jointlyinfluence a firm’s competitiveness in global and regional markets

name:
企業倫理與社會責任實踐
THE PRACTICE OF CORPORATE ETHICS AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
description:
《講授類》
與GHRM併班上課，限IBMBA及GHRM學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理時加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】People don't always agree on what is right or wrong! Do we (or can we) know what is right or wrong? This course will help you develop an understanding of business ethics and current debates in this field. The course will explore what ethical and unethical business practice consists of by providing clear explanations of a number of ethics theories, demonstrating how they can be used to analyze the ethicality of business activity.This course will help students develop views and opinions of what ‘ethical decision making’ is, and how logical and reasonable decisions can be made and justified. Students will be encouraged to think independently, challenge established theory, reflect on the subjects discussed, and develop views and perspectives on ethical business and management. The course will integrate documentaries, films, debates and news items (where possible) to help students think about real-life ethical dilemmas.Sustainable Leadership Forum (IB539): On six days this course will follow a seminar style with invited speakers. The aim is to prepare students to be future leaders who are not only proficient in managing the complexities of international business but also committed to leading with a vision that ensures the well-being of future generations. Through engaging in discussions on real-world cases and interactions with industry leaders, students will learn about strategic decision-making, fostering resilient and adaptable organizations.
objectives: 1. Understand, explain and analyse academic theory and evidence relating to ethics and the application of ethics in business decision making.2. Demonstrate analytical capabilities and critical understanding of ethical theories, their application to the workplace, and topical business issues.3. Develop awareness and understanding of how other people may think about ethical issues.4. Develop communication skills, including the ability to articulate well-reasoned, logical views clearly.5. Enhance employability, critical thinking, global awareness and teamwork skills.6. Develop research skills and the ability to analyse and interpret information.

name:

BUSINESS STRATEGY
description:
《講授類》
限IBMBA學程及GHRM MBA學程學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理時加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This is an integrative and interdisciplinary course, drawing together the ideas, concepts, and theories from cross-functional knowledge such as marketing, human resources, public relations, services, and event management. It takes a general management perspective, viewing the firm as a whole, and demonstrates the necessity of coordinating and integrating different functional strategies into an overall competitive strategy. It takes a broad view of the dynamic business environment that includes buyers, suppliers, competitors, technology, the economy, government, and uncertain global forces that affect the successful execution of a company’s strategic plan.
objectives: Learning OutcomesThe objectives of this course are to develop the following:Analyze an industry's competitive environment using frameworks like Porter's 5 ForcesConduct an internal analysis of a company's resources, capabilities, and value chainRecommend business-level strategies based on cost leadership, differentiation or focusEvaluate corporate-level strategies such as vertical integration, diversification, and strategic alliancesDevelop an international market entry and expansion strategyFormulate financial strategies involving capital structure, budgets, and dividendsAssess how technology and information systems enable strategic prioritiesDesign human resource strategies for recruiting, development, and retentionCraft a strategic marketing mix involving segmentation, targeting, product, pricing, and promotionSynthesize analyses into comprehensive strategic plans for an organizationApply strategic management concepts to real-world business scenarios and casesCommunicate strategic analysis and recommendations effectively in written and oral formatsWork collaboratively to make sound strategic decisions for an organization.

name:
組織理論與管理
ORGANIZATION THEORY & MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
與IBMBA併班上課，限IBMBA及GHRM學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理時加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】After completing this course, you should become familiar with the major concepts of organization theories, and the issues managers encounter within organizations.
objectives: Through studying various organization theories, you develop an understanding of (1) the principles of organization structure and design, (2) the impact of environment, strategy, technology, organizational culture, change, and organizational size on organizational and inter-organizational relationships, (3) the decision-making hierarchies, bureaucracy, power, and politics within organizations, and (4) the complex issues faced by managers in the area of globalization and social responsibility in organizational development.

name:
組織行為
ORGANIZATIONAL BEHAVIOR
description:
《講授類》
限IBMBA學程及GHRM MBA學程學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理階段辦理加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】Organizational behavior (OB) is the study of how individuals and groups interact within an organization, and how these interactions influence an organization’s performance toward its goal. Understanding OB is to exam the impact of various factors on behaviors within an organization. This course addresses a selected set of topics focusing on understanding human and organizational processes that facilitate or hinder work performance. The emphasis is on human behavior in relation to management practices with special emphasis on teamwork.
objectives: With class lectures, in-class activities, presentations, group discussion, case studies and other teaching methods, this course covers major concepts of organizational behavior (OB), and the issues managers encounter within the organizations. What is it that we do as managers that help our people perform better and what do we do that gets in their way? Within this framework, this class will try to accomplish several things:1. Expose you to ideas and literature that will enrich your thinking about these OB topics;2. Give you an opportunity to apply some of these ideas and case study analysis to your work experience;3. Provide a forum for exploring the OB issues with other students.

name:
人力資源管理
HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
與企管碩BM506併班上課，限IBMBA及GHRM學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理時加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】\\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\GHRM503.TXTThis course provides an overview of the essential practices for managing human resources. Throughout the semester, students will learn how to make theoretically and empirically sound decisions on how to design a job, how to attract talent, whom to hire, what to pay, how to train and develop employees, and how to evaluate performance. These practices are important because they affect employees’ motivation and ability to provide products and services that customers value, which in turn impacts an organization’s performance.Through the years, human resource management (HRM) has evolved from an administrative function (focusing on filling out forms and processing paperwork) into a more active role in supporting the organization’s strategy. Therefore, we will also discuss how effective HR strategies can be crafted to help organizations gain sustainable competitive advantages.
objectives: Goal #1: Increase content knowledge relevant to the field of HRMGoal #2: Learn to apply HRM theories and research to “real” world contextGoal #3: Gain hands-on experience in HR consulting— apply theories and practices to an HR issue faced by an organization and provide professional recommendations for addressing the issues

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】You will explore different ways of finding information, defining the scope of a project and doing research, as well as different ways of communicating the results. The Master's thesis course includes the stages of defining a topic and formulating a problem statement, selecting and reviewing relevant literature, designing an empirical study as well as performing it, including data collection and analysis, analysing the empirical data, make theoretical conclusions and finally writing and rewriting a written report called a Master's thesis.
objectives: Demonstrate the ability to critically and systematically integrate knowledge and to analyse, assess and deal with complex phenomena, issues and situations even with limited information.Demonstrate the ability to identify and formulate issues critically, independently and creatively as well as to plan and use appropriate methods, undertake advanced tasks within predetermined time frames, and to contribute to the formation of knowledge as well as the ability to evaluate this work.Demonstrate the ability in speech and writing, to report clearly and discuss his or her conclusions and the knowledge and arguments on which they are based in dialogue with different audiences, both in a national and international context.Demonstrate the skills required for participation in research and development work or for independent work in other advanced contexts.

name:
創業精神與人力資源管理
ENTREPRENEURSHIP AND HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
限IBMBA學程及GHRM MBA學程學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理階段辦理加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】尚未輸入 This purpose of this course is to examine the interaction between entrepreneurship and human resource management. By drawing particular attention to the ‘people’ in the emergence and development of business operations, it offers an insight into the role of Human Resource Management (HRM) in small and entrepreneurial firms. It is designed to give participants practical insights that are particularly important during a firm’s early development phases. This course will cover numerous topics in the context of entrepreneurial and smaller firms. Specifically, the topics include promoting creativity; gaining strategic advantage; building business plan; intellectual capital; knowledge management; and HRM issues in entrepreneurship. The course is suitable for Master students (future managers or entrepreneurs) wishing to pursue careers in venture firm or to start their own business.
objectives: This course provides a comprehensive evaluation of the multiple intrinsic power transactions taking place in a wide range of contexts. These operations influence innovative thinking, product and services development and business operations – from global to local levels.

name:
國際行銷管理
INTERNATIONAL MARKETING MANAGEMENT
description:
《講授類》
限IBMBA學程及GHRM MBA學程學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理階段辦理加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The course aims to provide the student a comprehensive overview of essential topics in the field of international marketing management. Those essential topics include global marketing environment, global market entry modes, global segmentation and positioning, as well as marketing mix strategy (4Ps) in the global context. They should help the student to gain an in-depth understanding of how to better manage marketing principles and practices in today’s increasingly competitive, globalized marketplaces.
objectives: •​Establish a fundamental understanding of international marketing principles•​Analyze contemporary and emerging strategic issues of international marketplaces•​Apply international marketing principles to the global business environment•​Develop a marketing management plan for prospective international business

name:
工作與文化
WORK AND CULTURE
description:
《講授類》
限IBMBA學程及GHRM MBA學程學生修習，欲加選學生請於異常處理階段辦理加選。
syllabus: 本課程教學大綱已提供完整英文資訊（本選項僅供統計使用，未提供完整英文資訊者，得免勾記）【Provide information of course syllabus in English.(This is for statistical use only. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】The course examines a range of ideas that provide insights into how people behave at work and provide managers with the opportunity to apply theoretical principles to real life organisational issues. These include understanding why people behave the way they do, what motivates people at work, how to develop and manage effective teams in diverse settings, how to design an effective structure and create a stimulating organisational culture, how to drive organisational change and leverage social networks, among others.
objectives: At its core, the course aims to equip students with the skills and knowledge to positively impact on individual, team and organisational performance in a variety of dynamic organisational contexts. The goal is to develop a detailed appreciation of factors influencing how people behave at work and how these link to performance. "Work and culture" focuses on understanding individual differences, how these differences affect group dynamics and how organisational factors affect individual behaviour.

SEMINAR IN MARINE ECOLOGY (I)

syllabus: This course will provide students with the opportunity to practice their presentation skills as well as gain exposure to other unique presentation styles from their peers and guest speakers. Fundamental techniques for effective communication will be introduced and discussed ranging from clearly expressing scientific content to logistical considerations such as introducing speakers, responding to audience questions, and giving/receiving constructive feedback.
objectives: After this course students will have:1) Developed a good understanding of the characteristics of an effective presentation.2) Acquired the ability to introduce fellow speakers and chair question/answer periods.3) Gained experience presenting a marine ecology-based paper and have harnessed the capacity to answer questions related to the paper's content.

objectives: 傳授學生了解分子細胞生物學之基本知識。

name:
珊瑚資源特論
SPECIAL TOPICS IN CORAL RESOURCES
syllabus: This course will provide a general introduction to the biotic and abiotic components of coral reefs. Emphasis will be placed on understanding ecosystem function as well as ecosystem service provision. Students will gain a clear understanding of the current impacts/threats to corals (and associated reef organisms) and will be exploring the most recent literature focused on developing the means to maintain these important ecosystems into the future.
objectives: After this course students will be able to:1) Describe the fundamental biology of corals and the role of major reef-associated organisms2) Outline key examples of symbiosis and invasive species on reefs3) Understand local and global stressors impacting coral reef ecosystems4) Describe potential drivers and mechanisms of reef resilience

name:
生物科學寫作及簡報概論
INTRODUCTORY GUIDE TO SCIENTIFIC WRITING AND ORAL PRESENTATION IN BIOLOGICAL RESEARCH
syllabus: The course aims to guide bioscience undergraduate students in research writing/presentation and transition them into independent scientists.
objectives: 1. The course will prepare students in science field ready for their future research and accelerate the publication in quality and quantity. 2. The skills students learn here will also prepare them to apply for various research funding. 3. Students will produce manuscript from the data from research seminar lab they stay in which it helps lab productivities. 4. Oral presentation practice will help students develop their presentation skills for attending conference and other occasions. The class structure will involve : 1. Scientific paper analysis: structure and key words 2. Logical and scientific writing 3. Graphs, tables, images that are convincing 4. Successful oral presentation

name:
天然物化學（一）
NATURAL PRODUCT CHEMISTRY(I)
tags: ['天然藥物合成學程']
syllabus: 本課程設計以碩士班一年級、具有"有機化學"或"生物化學"等課程基礎之學生為對象，課程內容介紹天然物生合成之途徑，包含陸地、海洋天然物與微生物天然物的生合成，並以期刊論文中發表之新骨架化合物為例，解說生合成之機轉，讓同學對於生物合成二次代謝產物有深入的了解。
objectives: 1.深化同學天然物代謝之知識。2.培養同學閱讀與理解專業論文之能力。3.培養同學應用課程知識推導生合成途徑之能力。

name:
天然藥物特論
SPECIAL TOPICS IN MEDICINAL NATURAL PRODUCTS
tags: ['生物技術學程', '海洋生物資源開發學程']
syllabus: 本課程設計以碩士班一年級、具有"有機化學"或"群論"等課程基礎之學生為對象，課程內容介紹多種有機光譜，並以常見天然物骨架為例，解說結構鑑定之方法，讓同學對於小分子天然物之結構鑑定方法有深入的了解。另外也讓丙組同學能初步認識抗癌及抗發炎等活性篩選之方法，並介紹相關之天然藥物。
objectives: 1.深化同學天然藥物結構鑑定與活性篩選之知識。2.培養同學閱讀與理解專業論文之能力。3.培養同學應用課程知識解析天然藥物結構之能力。

name:
色層分析
CHROMATOGRAPHY
tags: ['生物技術學程', '天然藥物合成學程']
syllabus: Chromatography is an important education course for students intending to major in organic chemistry, life science, and drug discovery. In the lecture, students will learn the principles of modern chromatography, including liquid/liquid or solid/liquid chromatographies, and use different instruments along with various gels to separate unknown compounds. Applications to real world chemistry are emphasized. Problem solving in the lecture and teamwork are key components for students in the class to fully understand and practice the knowledge from the class.
objectives: The class will introduce the isolation principles, methodolodies, such as TLC, CC, CPC, HPLC, UPLC,and so on, to analyse the organic compounds from natural sources. Besides, we will show case learning from our experiments and literatures. Moreover, we will also introduce the modern technologies, such as LC-tandem MS, and LC-SPE-NMR, and softwares about mass and nmr data analysis.

name:
珊瑚基因體學
CORAL GENOMICS
tags: ['生物資訊與演化生態微學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MBR552.TXT課程包含介紹珊瑚基因體定序計畫, 以及基因體學於珊瑚生物學之應用，包含(1) 共生關係, (2) 珊瑚骨骼鈣化機制, (3) 生殖, (4) 珊瑚疾病, 並以序列分析實作了解目前珊瑚基因體研究近況。This course will provide students with general knowledge about the develepment of coral genome sequecing projects. It will cover specific topics in coral biology, including symbiosis, coral calcification, reproduction, and coral disease. It will also focus on in silico (computer-based) approaches for studying biological problems.
objectives: 課程介紹珊瑚基因體學，並以實際研究案例介紹定序技術在珊瑚生物學上之應用。並且以海葵和石珊瑚基因體研究為例，介紹基因體學於了解珊瑚共生，珊瑚疾病，珊瑚白化機制，珊瑚免疫機制的應用。透過生物資訊學工具，讓修課學生學習基因體分析於珊瑚生物學上之基本操作。This course will enable students to learn the general knowledge of coral genomics and learn how genome projects are organised and run. Students will explore the Aiptasia and Acropora genome to examine questions on coral symbiosis, disease, bleaching, and immune system, and use bioinformatic tools in coral genomics.

name:
海洋動物演化學
MARINE ANIMAL EVOLUTION
tags: ['生物資訊與演化生態微學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MBR554.TXT課程包含介紹以分子生物學了解海洋生物細胞組織，生長發育和演化之研究。特別著重於海洋無脊椎動物之演化關係，型態多樣性，生態功能以及生長史。This course will provide a general introduction to marine organism organization, development, and evolution on the basis of molecular biology. Evolutionary relationships among major invertebrate taxa, diversity in morphological features, functional aspects, and life histories will be covered in the course.
objectives: 課程介紹主要海洋古老生物之親緣演化關係，探討多細胞動物的細胞組織演化和神經起源。特別著重探討演化史上古老生物之細胞組織和生長發育。藉由親緣關係分析實作，了解動物形態和生態生長之關係。From this course, students will be able to describe evolutionary relationships among major early-branching phyla, discuss evolution of animal body plans and nervous systems, and discuss cellular organization of marine invertebrates with the focus of early-branching animals. It will also guide students to examine the phylogenetic relationships of organisms for their anatomical, physiological, and ecological characteristics.

name:
分子病毒學特論
SPECIAL TOPICS IN MOLECULAR VIROLOGY
syllabus: 課程分為三個部分：病毒學培養與診斷、病毒分子生物學、發病機制和控制。 在第一部分，我們將描述病毒學的基礎知識和研究病毒的方法。 第二部分描述了病毒的繁殖，從基因複制、基因轉錄、翻譯和病毒顆粒釋放。 第三部分介紹了免疫系統和病毒進化的策略以及感染的治療和控制。
objectives: 病毒是目前重要的新興感染症的病原體，除了嚴重影響人類的健康，尤其水產養殖也因病毒感染造成經濟上重大的損失。因此瞭解病毒的分子生物學是預防及治療病毒染重要的知識。本課程藉由瞭解病毒生活史、病毒感染與疾病關係、病毒與免疫的關係、病毒基因演化與流行的關係及病毒致病的分子機制，進而啟發對開發抗病毒策略的研究。

name:
海洋生物多樣性與保育（一）
MARINE BIODIVERSITY AND CONSERVATION （1）
tags: ['生物多樣性學程']
syllabus: 從有生物多樣性研究以來，海洋生態系的研究一直明顯落後於陸域生態系，雖然其所佔面積是地球的百分之七十，但也因為不易研究，因此許多基本的調查皆闕如，本門課主主要將強調生物多樣性在海洋生態系中的所扮演的角色、影響因子、如何量化並了解政策對管理生物多樣性的重要性。藉由文獻導讀與討論使修課學生除了瞭解海洋生物多樣性之外，還能進一步了解生物多樣性背後的意義。 This course will focus on several aspects of marine biodiversity and conservation. Through this serious of lectures, students can learn how to measure marine biodiversity, understanding threats of marine biodiversity and how to protect marine biodiversity.
objectives: 藉由文獻導讀與討論使修課學生除了瞭解海洋生物多樣性之外，還能進一步了解生物多樣性背後的意義。

name:
海洋生物多樣性與保育（一）
MARINE BIODIVERSITY AND CONSERVATION （1）
room: 三3,4(海生館第二研究大樓R 2002)
description:
《講授類》
上課地點在海生館
※英語授課
tags: ['生物多樣性學程']
syllabus: 海洋佔地球表面約71%的面積，不僅是生命的發源地，也是生物多樣性的大本營。然而，海洋生物受到人類活動影響甚鉅，人為活動與開發帶來的環境衝擊對海洋生物多樣性與保育造成嚴重的威脅。本課程將介紹不同海洋生態系中的生物多樣性，討論其價值、受到的威脅與保育的方式，並藉由文獻閱讀使修課學生更能了解現今海洋生物多樣性與保育的發展歷程。
objectives: 藉由授課、文獻閱讀使學生了解海洋生物多樣性與保育的意義與目的。

name:
海洋天然物與化學分析（一）
MARINE NATURAL PRODUCTS AND CHEMICAL ANALYSIS I
syllabus: 本課程內容將包含1.天然物之篩選 2.高通量篩選分析 3.蛋白質體學 4.DNA定序 5.生物活性分析 6.螢光分析標記
objectives: 本課程想探討海洋天然物以化學方法協助解決化合物骨架與相關基團的確認及其活性導向之相關主題，以便提供給學生應用於海洋生技之藥物開發，並希望學生可藉此瞭解化學分析方法於現今應用於海洋天然物的知識。

name:
高等流體力學
ADVANCED FLUID MECHANICS
tags: ['半導體製程模組學程', '半導體設備工程學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MAEV521.TXT高等流體力學為延伸本系大學部流體力學課程，本課程著重於流體的動力分析，其中則進一步導入基本方程式之數學列式與流場物理概念，探討流體的動力機制。
objectives: 透過本課程，期能使學生對流體運動有正確的觀念，掌握其完整的運動機制。亦希望藉由本課程，訓練學生理論推演的能力。

name:
海洋系統模擬（一）
MARINE SYSTEM MODELING(I)
syllabus: This is an introductory course on ocean modelling. Governing equations describing dynamic processes in the ocean are presented, and approximations to simpler forms are discussed. Numerical schemes are introduced using prototypical equations that are representative of marine transport processes and shallow water phenomena. Special emphasis is put on the convergence and stability properties. The course contains laboratory practice where students will implement and solve basic hydrodynamic models. Applications include:- Diffusion and advection of tracers- Storm surges- Tsunami- Tidal flooding
objectives: The students will have a first-hand experience with the computational simulation of marine systems. Basic principles and limitations of numerical approximation schemes will be understood.

name:
應用工程水力學
APPLIED ENGINEERING HYDRAULICS
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: The course surveys the application of hydrodynamic principles and approximations to pipelines, open channels, coastlines, etc. Fundamentals of incompressible fluid dynamics are reviewed. Physical reasonings and insights behind the engineering designs are discussed, and the underlying practical assumptions in the modelling process are elaborated. Topics include:- Basics of fluid flow (Bernoulli principle, Reynolds Transport Theorem, viscous effects and turbulence, boundary layers)- Parameterization of hydrodynamic losses- Flows in closed conduits and pipes- Pipe networks- Hydraulic machinery- Open channel flow- Hydraulic structures- Introduction to coastal hydraulics
objectives: The students will develop basic understanding of underlying hydraulic concepts used in water resources, coastal and offshore engineering, and practice the design of some basic flow systems.

name:
離岸結構矩陣分析
MATRIX ANALYSIS OF OFFSHORE STRUCTURES
syllabus: Offshore structures have been affected by different environmental external forces for a long time. Engineers usually use structural matrix analysis to understand the internal forces and deformations of offshore structures under the influence of environmental external forces. This course will introduce the matrix displacement method, which takes the node displacement as the basic unknown quantity, and then organizes and arranges the stiffness of its basic structure (truss structure, beam structure and rigid frame structure) and offshore structure in the form of matrix. , to obtain the node displacement and the internal force and deformation of the structure in the presence of external forces.
objectives: 1. Establish the concept of structural matrix2. Structural matrix analysis truss structure3. Structural Matrix Analysis Beam Structure4. Structural matrix analysis of rigid frame structures5. Structural matrix analysis of offshore structures

name:
廢水生物處理方法
BIOLOGICAL TREATMENT FOR WASTEWATER
tags: ['環境科技與管理學程']
syllabus: 本教學課程主要內容係講授與探討各類廢水之生物處理方法，包括活性污泥法、滴濾池法、生物圓板法、氧化塘法、接觸曝氣法、氧化渠法、污泥厭氧消化、厭氣濾床法、厭氣向上流污泥毯法、好氧及厭氧流體化床法等。此外，對於廢水生物處理之各項機制、模式及工程設計等亦將加以探討。
objectives: 本課程之教學目標在於教導學生對三大廢水處理方法中，有關生物處理的部分，能透徹了解其去除污染物之原理，以及工程設計所需考量之原則及方法，以利於未來在實際從事設計或操作廢水生物處理廠時，能加以運用並解決問題。

name:
海岸變遷專題研究
INDEPENDENT STUDIES IN COASTAL PROCESSES
syllabus: 透過現場觀測、理論解析、數值模擬與水工模型試驗的方式，分析海岸漂砂行為，在自然海岸或佈置海岸結構物之情況下，探討短期與長期海岸地形變化的特性。
objectives: 1.透過文獻討論，引導初學者瞭解海岸地形變遷數值模式學理基礎。2.培養初學者計算波場、流場及地形變遷的能力。3.以工程實例計探討短、長期海岸地形變化的影響。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=MAEV5600&Crsname=海洋及森林碳匯與碳權概論
name:
海洋及森林碳匯與碳權概論
INTRODUCTION TO MARINE AND FOREST CARBON SINKS AND CARBON CREDITS
tags: ['淨零轉型微學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MAEV5600.TXT1. Introduction to Climate Change and Global Response- Current status of climate change- International agreements and consensus2. Natural Carbon Sinks- Forest carbon sinks- Marine carbon sinks- Role in mitigating climate change3. Taiwan's Climate Change Response- "Taiwan 2050 Net-Zero Emissions Pathway"- Climate Change Response Act (2023)- Pathway to net-zero emissions4. Carbon Management Fundamentals- Carbon inventory- Carbon credits- Methodologies for carbon reduction- Carbon trading5. Economic and Sustainable Development Aspects- Carbon fees- Carbon tariffs- Sustainable development- Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG)6. Industry Transformation and Opportunities- Green transformation in industries- Career opportunities in net-zero and carbon management
objectives: By the end of this course, students will be able to:1. Understand the current state of climate change and international efforts to address it.2. Explain the roles of forest and ocean carbon sinks in mitigating climate change.3. Describe Taiwan's approach to achieving net-zero emissions, including key legislation and policies.4. Demonstrate knowledge of fundamental carbon management concepts, including inventory, credits, reduction methodologies, and trading.5. Analyze the economic implications of carbon management, including fees, tariffs, and their impact on sustainable development.6. Evaluate the importance of ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) in the context of climate change response.7. Identify potential career opportunities in carbon management and related fields within the corporate sector.8. Develop a holistic understanding of the challenges and opportunities presented by the transition to a net-zero economy.This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive introduction to Nature-Based Solutions and carbon management, with a focus on Taiwan's context and global trends. It is designed to enhance students' future employment prospects in the rapidly growing field of carbon management.

name:
高等環境系統分析（一）
ADVANCED ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEM ANALYSIS (I)
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MAEV561.TXTSystem analysis, which is different from traditional Descriptive models, belongs to the Prescriptive Model because it plans courses of action, designs, or policies to make the system run more efficiently. Applying system analysis to solve environmental management problems is called environmental system analysis. The course will cover relevant system analysis methodologies and practical application cases in environmental management.
objectives: For students to understand：1. Methodologies of system analysis2. Applications of environmnetal management

name:
多相流理論
MULTI-PHASE FLOW THEORY
syllabus: This course covers continuum mechanics, volume averaging approaches, solid-liquid flows, solid-gas-liquid flows, turbulent flows, turbulent dispersion, turbulence modulations.
objectives: After completing this course, students will:1. Be knowledgeable about multi-phase flow, including sediment transport;2. Be capable of solving multi-phase flow problems numerically.

name:
離岸浮式構造物工程導論
INTRODUCTION TO MARITIME AND OCEAN ENGINEERING OF FLOATING OFFSHORE STRUCTURES
tags: ['海事工程學程']
syllabus: 離岸工程產業發展現況與展望、離岸浮式構造物系統簡介、台灣離岸工程發展與政策、基礎海洋學與海洋環境載荷、海洋物理與海洋地質、水下量測技術、海域地工及土壤實驗、海洋工程軟體使用實務、海洋動力學基礎、浮台試驗簡介、離岸浮式風機介紹、離岸浮式構造物系統運作與維護、產業參訪
objectives: 以海洋為主體之各項再生能源開發(例如離岸風場、潮波流能等)於國際間日漸受到重視，四面環海之臺灣亦在此領域中投入大量經費，隨著開發環境的水深增加，離岸浮式構造物之技術應用越顯重要，本課程著重在離岸風機及浮式平台設置安裝所需之實務與理論，包括海洋環境之調查、浮式平台之運動特性與分析以及繫纜系統等進行基礎專業知能培養。

name:

name:
海洋動力學
MARINE FLUID DYNAMIC MECHANICS
syllabus: This course is a survey of principal concepts and methods of fluid dynamics and Waves in the Ocean. Topics include mass conservation, momentum, and energy equations for continua; Navier-Stokes equation for viscous flows. The course covers the behavior of waves of hyperbolic type and addressing also dispersive waves in the Ocean. The mathematical principles are presented along with examples of specific cases in communications and specific physical fields, including flood waves in rivers, waves in glaciers, and surface and internal ocean waves from storms and in the coastal areas.
objectives: The main purpose of this course is to study the basic laws of fluid mechanics and waves in the Ocean. It is designed to help students develop a mastery of the underlying principles and the ability to solve, quickly and efficiently, a variety of real fluid mechanics and wave propagation problems from first principles. The lectures present and illustrate the fundamental laws and the methods and modeling approximations that form the basis of fluid wave mechanics.

name:
海面實際波浪現象專研
INDEPENDENT STUDIES IN FILED OCEAN WAVES
syllabus: 1.海面實際波浪資料之如何取得與研判2.海面實際波浪資料之分析處理3.各成份波之解讀及其波譜分佈4.海面實際波浪造成之水位與波高之分佈特性5.造成海岸地區之衝擊現象
objectives: 海面實際波浪現象專研

name:
海岸現場試驗
COASTAL FIELD EXPERIMENT
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MAEV648.TXT傳統的海岸工程規劃，均以數值模擬或水工模型試驗的方式進行分析。本課程直接透過現場試驗的方式，以中山大學海科院海域為研究區，實際觀測海象與海域地形，在自然海岸或具有海岸設施情況下，探討海域潮波流特性與地形變化現象。
objectives: 1.專題計畫擬定，2.背景資料蒐集，3.儀器整備與架設，4.海岸地形測量，5.海象觀測調查，6.漂沙調查，7.觀測資料品管，8.成果綜合分析。

name:
水化學
WATER CHEMISTRY
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MAEV652.TXTThe main purpose of this course is to introduce fundamental principles of aquatic chemistry. Homework, mid-term and final exams will be assigned to evaluate the understanding of students to the course materials.One midterm and one final exam will be carried out to determine their overall understanding in hydrochemistry in this course.Attendance at all lectures is required and will be documented as a credit to award students who attend every lecture but not doing well in examinations.
objectives: Students will learn concepts of water chemistry and related applications.

name:
應用Python於海洋環境資料分析
PYTHON FOR MARINE ENVIRONMENTAL DATA ANALYSIS
syllabus: This course introduces the basics of data analysis with Python.
objectives: Get familiar with the Python language, practice English and data analysis. Enhance your critical thinking skills by working on your own data project.

INDEPENDENT STUDIES IN WAVE-POROUS STRUCTURE (I)
syllabus: 依規定免登

name:
專題討論
SEMINAR
syllabus: 本課程聚焦於海洋生態保育與管理，旨在透過論文研讀及專題研究，深化學生從學術視角探討此議題的各面向的能力。透過學術論文之理論學習、案例分析和實踐研究，期望學生能了解海洋生態保育與管理的複雜性，並培養學術探討的能力。
objectives: 學生透過閱讀學術論文及專題研究，以培養從學術視角探討議題各面向的能力。

name:
海洋事務總論
MARINE AFFAIRS
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 本課程將藉由聯合國秘書長「海洋及海洋法」之年度報告書（Oceans and the Law of the Sea: Report of the Secretary-General）來建立學生對於海洋事務的內涵與範疇之基礎，再由「我們共同的未來」（Our Common Future）、「廿一世紀議程」第17章、及永續海洋經濟高層委員會發布之藍碳手冊（The Blue Carbon Handbook）等出版品，讓學生接觸各類領域之際，於學期末發表合乎專業與興趣的海洋事務之研究。
objectives: 本課程旨在使學生不僅能對於「海洋事務」能具有一總體性之瞭解，亦能接觸有關海洋事務之各類領域，以讓學生對於將來修課、論文研究、及職涯選擇時，能結合學識與興趣來判斷未來發展方向。

name:
海洋學導論
INTRODUCTION TO OCEANOGRAPHY
teacher: 李逸環,劉莉蓮,張詠斌,雷漢杰
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 分別就海洋地質、海洋化學、海洋生物及海洋物理等海洋科學四大領域，做完整而深入淺出的系統性介紹。
objectives: 介紹學生認識海洋科學四大領域，包括海洋地質、海洋化學、海洋生物及海洋物理的相關基礎知識，並能應用於個人論文研究。

name:
論文研究
THESIS RESEARCH
syllabus: 依規定免登
objectives: 依規定免登

name:
公共政策
INTRODUCTION TO PUBLIC POLICY
tags: ['公民參與微學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MA581.TXT本課程所將涵蓋之內容包括：政策失敗之根由、政策過程之概念、公共問題之本質、將問題帶至政府、政策形成、政策方案之合法化、政策方案所需預算之編列、方案之執行、方案之評估等。上述諸議題均屬公共政策之內涵，對這些議題之理解將可提供學生對公共政策議題進行觀察、分析、評估之能力。
objectives: 本課程旨在提供（海洋）法政社會科學領域之碩士班研究生對公共政策學門的初步認識與理解，而使學生具備進一步修習海洋政策、公共政策分析、或其他公共政策專題領域之能力。本課程以Charles O. Jones 所著之公共政策研究概論一書為基礎，依該書之章節順序詳細講授該書之內容，並輔以國內公共政策實際案例之研讀與分析，使學生除認識與理解公共政策之學理外，並得以活用至實際之公共政策議題。

name:
國際漁業法
INTERNATIONAL FISHERIES LAW
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\MA587.TXT國際漁業法律體制自二次大戰後迄今，已有長足之演進。本課程係針對國際間涉及漁業之文件（包括具法律約束力之硬法及不具法律約束力之軟法）進行介紹，並瞭解其間之變化。前者包括1958年日內瓦公海生物資源漁捕與養護公約、1982年聯合國海洋法公約、1993聯合國糧農組織（FAO）公海遵守協定、1995年聯合國魚群協定及2009年FAO港口國措施等；後者包括1992年21世紀議程第17章、1995年FAO責任漁業行為規約及其四個國際行動計畫等文件。The international fisheries legal regime has evolved considerably since the Second World War. This course introduces basic elements of the international fisheries legal regime, including both legally binding hard law and non-legally binding soft law, and examines the evolution and changes that have taken place. The former includes the 1958 Convention on Fishing and Conservation of the Living Resources of the High Seas, the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, the 1993 FAO Agreement to Promote Compliance with International Conservation and Management Measures by Fishing Vessels on the High Seas, the 1995 United Nations Fish Stocks Agreement, and the 2009 FAO Port State Measures Agreement, etc. The latter includes the Chapter 17 of the Agenda 21, the 1995 FAO Code of Conduct for Responsible Fisheries and its four International Plans of Action (IPOAs).
objectives: 本課程之主旨在於使學生瞭解國際漁業法之演進與重要規範，包括全球性國際漁業法律文件及區域漁業管理組織之設立公約與其所通過之建決議案等。This course is designed to provide students with an understanding of the evolution and important regulations of the international fisheries legal regime, including global international fisheries legal instruments, constitutional conventions and resolutions adopted by regional fisheries management organizations (RFMOs).

name:
南海議題特論
SPECIAL TOPICS ON THE SOUTH CHINA SEA ISSUES
syllabus: 1.南海島礁主權主張爭議介紹。2.海域主權及管轄權主張爭議介紹。3.U型線之法律定位探討。4.1982年聯合國海洋法公約在南海議題之適用。5.中、菲仲裁案研析。6.南海區域合作之可行潛在主題及合作機制。
objectives: 本課程在於使學生瞭解南海相關爭議之內涵、現況及未來展望，以及探討南海週邊國家進行區域合作之可行潛在主題與合作機制等。

name:
我國水下文化資產保存法令
LAWS AND REGULATIONS CONCERNING UNDERWATER CULTURAL HERITAGE
syllabus: 我國管轄權水域（例如內水、領海、鄰接區、專屬經濟海域或大陸礁層上）存有起源於我國、他國或起源國不明之水下文化遺產（underwater cultural heritage, UCH），乃至他國管轄權水域或「區域」（the Area）亦可能存有起源於我國之水下文化遺產。因此，我國有妥善治理水下文化治理的重要實際利益，並需要反映於國內的法令、政策及行政措施。例如，與他國合作進行水下考古（underwater archaeologic operation）、打擊盜掘、文物走私等新興海上犯罪，或追討返還流失海外水下文化遺產等新興議題，係屬海洋文化外交（maritime cultural diplomacy）的操作，即有賴國內法律的授權與支持，乃至於相關國際法政文件的綜合運用。水下文化遺產的治理，是「海洋」與「文化」兩大領域的交錯議題。水下文化遺產多位處海域環境，因此會受到海洋環境的高度影響（例如海流沖刷、氣候變遷、海平面上升等）。對於水下文化遺產的研究，有助於進一步掌握氣候變遷、海平面上升的變化，進而強化對海洋環境的永續照管（stewardship）。因此，聯合國教科文組織（UNESCO）指出「海洋的過去即為我們的未來」（The Ocean’s past is our future）。此外，水下文化遺產同時也可能影響周邊海洋環境。例如，成為海洋生物的庇護場所，或因持續漏油而污染周邊海洋生態。因此，水下文化遺產的治理，需要海洋科學研究（marine scientific research, MSR）的投入，例如水下科學儀器或技術的運用、深海考古的發展。由此可見，對於水下文化遺產的治理，早已非單純「文化」議題，更可能對國家的安全及永續有所貢獻，例如文化安全（cultural security）。當然，水下文化遺產的治理，在本質上仍不離文化此一特性。多數社會大眾所認知的水下文化遺產，主要是「有形文化遺產」（tangible cultural heritage），例如沉船（shipwreck）、遺址（site）、人類遺骸（human remains）或貨物（cargo）等。若從「海洋文化地景」（maritime cultural landscape, MCL）角度以觀，水下文化遺產僅為其中「位於水下」（under water）的部分，其他還包括陸域環境中人類與海洋互動關係（例如岸際的地名與港口的形成、造船工藝的發展等）、人類在海洋水表上與海洋間的互動關係（例如航海技術、海上交通貿易習慣等）。這些則多屬於「無形文化遺產」（intangible cultural heritage）。再者，臺灣也具有相當的海洋文化多樣性（cultural diversity），而反映於包括水下文化遺產在內等標的中。例如，歷史上受到西班牙、葡萄牙、荷蘭、日本乃至中國大陸等各方的殖民或統治，因而與東亞乃至全球海洋貿易、歷史、文化產生連結，或者與南島語系文化間的聯繫，此觀目前已發現或研究所悉沉船，已可見到部分線索。根據前述背景，水下文化遺產的治理，是高度跨領域的議題。我國為回應前述國際與國內的治理需求，已於2015年制定公布施行「水下文化資產保存法」，隔年發布相關子法，與其他相關法令共同「由內而外」、「一層一層」構成我國水下文化遺產治理的整體法政架構。例如，文化資產保存法、中華民國領海及鄰接區法、海洋基本法、海洋保育法等，乃至於未來可能推動制（訂）定的海洋空間規劃法令。本課程作為我國大學中最早針對水下文化遺產所開設一系列完整專業課程之一，且為該系列課程的第三堂，將賡續第二堂有關聯合國教科文組織水下文化遺產保護公約（Convention on the Protection of the Underwater Cultural Heritage）之講授基礎，進一步本於授課教師過去多年來參與我國水下文化遺產保存法令研究、行政院版本草案起草及諮詢等權威實務經驗，帶領同學重返並見證我國推動制（訂）定水下文化遺產保存、保護與管理相關法令的歷史現場，精確掌握該等核心法令之發展、解釋及適用相關能力，乃至向外觸及其他間接有關的法令，以作為未來參與水下文化遺產治理，乃至於其他所涉海洋事務相關議題所需專業法政基礎。本課程的進行，一貫包括但不限於「法條的解釋」。因此，修課學生亦不限於法政領域背景。為反映水下文化遺產的跨領域特性，本課程一貫高度歡迎包括海洋事務研究所在內多元領域學生選修，亦即包括自然科學、人文及社會科學所有領域。唯有多元專業的投入，才能有效治理、保護我國的水下文化遺產，甚至參與或推動國際合作。
objectives: 一、水下文化遺產保存、保護與管理之重要原則與實踐二、我國水下文化遺產保存、保護與管理相關法令之發展、解釋與適用

name:
海洋空間規劃
MARINE SPATIAL PLANNING
syllabus: 海洋空間規劃 (Marine Spatial Planning)為聯合國落實永續海洋治理的重要措施。課程將以海域利用爭端、環境保護與管理實務等三面向的國際發展為架構，說明海洋空間規劃之發展歷程、推動理念與規劃方法。課程中將以歐盟與英國推動之海洋空間規劃為例，帶領修課學生模擬特定議題實際操作空間規劃與計畫研擬。
objectives: 本課程設計先由海域空間規劃的制度設計入門，再延伸至政策方針、法規競合、管理計畫實務等三項層面逐步說明海洋事務學習範疇，強化海洋空間規劃理念目標與規劃實務能力。

name:
海洋產業經濟理論與實務
ENVIRONMENTAL TRANSFORMATIONS AND CULTURAL RESPONSES IN OCEANIA
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: ***Prerequisites: MA577 and MA628 ******Students must meet course prerequisites.***This course is a third class that will make use of natural resource economic theory andfield survey tools to estimate economic value of the marine environment, policies, and blue economy.
objectives: To understand the meaning of economic value.To estimate value of ocean resources.To estimate value of blue economy.

name:
海洋環境變遷與南島民族
ENVIRONMENTAL TRANSFORMATIONS AND CULTURAL RESPONSES IN OCEANIA
syllabus: ***Prerequisites: MA627 ******Students must meet course prerequisites.***This course will use theory, cases, and field survey to help students understand environmental transformations and cultural responses in Oceania and learn how to plan for environmental change/climate change with traditional wisdom.
objectives: Help students understand environmental transformations and cultural responses in Oceania and learn how to plan for environmental change/climate change with traditional wisdom.

name:
永續發展
SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT
tags: ['公共事務與企業社會責任微學程', '企業社會責任學程', '淨零轉型微學程']
syllabus: 根據聯合國文獻檢討「永續發展」的歷史演變階段，並檢視台灣目前的永續發展與淨零減碳現況。課程第一部分閱讀1987年的「我們共同的未來」，分析此份聯合國文件的代表性意義；第二部分閱讀1992年的「廿一世紀議程」，這份文件對永續發展的解決方案呈現與「我們共同的未來」不同的取向，反映當時主流的國際政治經濟制度；第三部分討論CSR、ESG、SDGs為何出現的歷史變化，並精讀《翻轉世界：2030年永續發展議程》此一聯合國文獻；第四部分討論臺灣 2050 淨零排放路徑及策略，以及淨零減碳作為永續發展案例。
objectives: 本課程將仔細分析「永續發展（sustainable development）」的三面向：經濟、社會與環境，包括其歷史演變，以及這些概念所鑲嵌的全球政治經濟基礎。據此評估2015年聯合國永續發展目標其適切性。最後以淨零減碳做為案例來檢驗國際與國內的永續發展所涉及到的各種制度與實踐上的問題。

name:
海洋學導論
INTRODUCTION TO OCEANOGRAPHY
teacher: 李逸環,劉莉蓮,張詠斌,雷漢杰
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 分別就海洋地質、海洋化學、海洋生物及海洋物理等海洋科學四大領域，做完整而深入淺出的系統性介紹。
objectives: 介紹學生認識海洋科學四大領域，包括海洋地質、海洋化學、海洋生物及海洋物理的相關基礎知識，並能應用於個人論文研究。

name:
海洋學導論
INTRODUCTION TO OCEANOGRAPHY
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: This course provides a comprehensive yet easily accessible introduction to this captivating field. Its content spans the four core disciplines of oceanography, examining in turn the geological and geophysical setting of the ocean floor, the chemical properties of seawater and sediments, the circulation and hydrodynamic properties of ocean basins, the biology and ecology of marine systems, and concluding with an assessment of human impacts on the ocean. Linkages between these areas will be emphasized at every opportunity, thus revealing the multidisciplinary nature of oceanography. It is hoped that this approach will give future marine engineers and developers the basic tools to make sound decisions in the management of the marine environment while helping prospective researchers to select their specific research area.
objectives: •	To understand oceanographic concepts such as global plate tectonics, steady state, residence time, biogeochemical cycles, progressive waves, biological habitats, food chains, ecosystem functioning and coastal dynamics.•	To integrate the above physical, chemical, and biological information to examine the intricacies of dynamic coastal environments, using examples drawn from various parts of Taiwan's coastline.•	To understand the nature and scale of contemporary environmental issues such as climate change, ocean acidification and marine plastic pollution.

OCEANOGRAPHIC CRUISE

name:
環礁生態研究
ATOLL ECOLOGY RESEARCH
description:
《講授類》
限有參與東沙環礁實地訓練者選修。寒假期間在東沙上課，受限機位、空間因素，限修人數為5人。
syllabus: 課程內容包含東沙環礁介紹、海洋生物多樣性危機探討以及東沙國際海洋研究站參訪，暸解目前東沙環礁生態系的現況。課程要求：1.	修課學生須於113學年的寒假期間參與東沙島野外課程，目前暫定上島時間為2024年12月26日至2025年1月2日（但實際上島時間可能依申請狀況而有所微調）。東沙島野外課程結束後需針對東沙野外實習繳交報告。113-1學期中，修課學生須參與東沙環礁課程介紹內容，學期中須繳交相關作業。2.	因東沙研究站目前可容納人數有限，因此本學期課程最多可容納學生人數為5人，修課學生需自行負擔，上島所需來回機票費用（約7,300元）以及在島上的餐費（約每日208元）。
objectives: 透過實驗設計、實地調查以及實驗驗證了解東沙環礁的海草床生態系

name:
軟體動物學
MOLLUSCS
tags: ['生物多樣性學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\DO528.TXT1.General molluscan plan2.Early molluscan development3.Marine Environments & adaptation4.Class Introduction:Bivalvia, Gastropoda,Cephalopoda,Scaphopoda,Monoplacophora,Polypdacophora,Soleno yaster,Caudofoveata.5.Laboratory practice and experimental design
objectives: 認識軟體動物之生物學,分類及親源關係及具體設計執行軟體動物實驗

name:
海洋生物生理學
PHYSIOLOGY OF MARINE ORGANISMS
tags: ['生物多樣性學程', '海洋生物資源開發學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\DO539.TXTThe contents of physiology of marine organisms will cover three levels: body, organs and cells. Physiological functions discussed in this semester will begin with a general introduction, and following with include cellular signaling and endocrine regulation, nerve function, muscle and movement, circulation system, respiration system, ion/water balance, digestion and energy metabolism, and thermal physiology.海洋生物生理學將涵蓋個體，器官與細胞3個層級來說明，本學期將先簡介生理學的基本內容，然後分別討論以下主題，(1) 訊息傳遞(包括細胞訊息傳遞，內分泌系統，神經傳導)；(2) 運動生理(包括細胞層級移動與肌肉運動)；(3)循環系統；(4)呼吸系統；(5)離子與水的平衡；(6) 消化與能量代謝；(7)熱生理學。
objectives: 1. To know how marine lives perform their biological functions in marine ecosystem: This course will provide students with basic knowledge to know how marine organisms survive in this planet, which will be an important foundation to explore the complicate marine ecosystem and interactions between organisms, or between organisms and environment.2. To intensify the awareness of the importance of marine life protection. The more our students know how marine organisms evolve to adapt to the environment of this planet by developing amazing physiological functions, the more our students will respect the meaning of life and willing to protect our home of living.1. 了解海洋生物如何適應環境的生理功能相關知識: 這方面的知識是深入探討海洋生物物種間或生物與環境互動關係的重要基礎知識。2. 加強對海洋生物保育的認知: 透過了解海洋生物為了適應各種環境選態壓力所演化出的精妙生理機制，讓學生更尊重生命並願意關心與投入海洋的研究與生態保育的工作。

name:
高等海洋地質學
ADVANCED MARINE GEOLOGY
tags: ['環境科技與管理學程']
syllabus: Plate tectonicsEarthquake +TsunamiPractice: distribution of recent earthquakes and their mechanism.Stratigraphy and correlationGeophysicsPaleomagnetismIntroduction to GeophysicsGas hydrateDeep sea sedimentsMarine microfossilsDeep sea sedimentsPractice: digital X-ray scanner and sedimentary facesPaleoclimatologyPaleoceanographyOral report
objectives: 瞭解當前海陸分布的形成過程，包括其間所牽涉的地質作用和所造成的影響；認識全球（藉由深海鑽探計畫的執行）以及台灣附近海域的地質狀況、地球歷史以及最新的研究成果。

name:
海洋沉積物分析
ANALYSES OF MARINE SEDIMENTS
syllabus: 沈積物分析課程大綱這學期的課程將是很特別、而且只有一次機會的上課方式：藉由學習過程、探討我個人多年來收藏的沈積物、包括澳洲黃金海岸、雪梨、西班牙巴賽隆那、金門、馬祖、澎湖、東沙、美國Lake Tahoe等地的標本，藉以理解母岩的岩性以及搬運、傳輸的過程，以及所隱含的地質意義。認識沈積物來源及分布採樣方式 – 視研究目標而定介紹不同方式的取得討論各項參數的代表意義參數所代表的意義：
objectives: 海洋沈積物是海洋地質學研究的主要材料、蘊含豐富的訊息，如何針對沈積物組成的差異、利用不同的分析方法以解讀最多的記錄是授課的主題，其次則是協助學生以有限標本取得最大的沈積物分析效益。協助以沈積物為論文研究材料的修課學生為主要目標，提升並強化標本的利用價值。

name:
海洋汙染
MARINE POLLUTION
syllabus: 以海洋化學、地球科學、人文角度，探討海洋污染。內容涵蓋二氧化碳相關問題、放射性污染、海洋廢棄物、熱廢水掛放、塑膠污染、環境激素...等等。
objectives: 讓學生熟悉當前全球性及地區性之海洋污染，並提高獨立思考環境議題的能力。

name:
古氣候學概論
INTRODUCTION TO PALEOCLIMATOLOGY
tags: ['環境教育學程', '氣候變遷與調適學分學程']
syllabus: 本課程旨在探討驅動並影響地球氣候系統短期及長期變化的動力機制，包含討論大氣圈與水圈、岩石圈及生物圈的交互作用。此外，課程中也會介紹氣候與海洋系統短週期的震盪反應對環境的影響，及人類活動對氣候及環境的衝擊效應，以及目前新的研究成果與發現。
objectives: 1. 使學生暸解控制地球氣候系統的機制與作用力2. 使學生暸解地球氣候統的長期與短期表現3. 使學生暸解區域性的氣候變化對地球氣候系統的影響

name:
現場觀測與資料分析
FIELD OBSERVATIONS AND DATA ANALYSIS
syllabus: 本課程教授海洋資料之觀測方式與處理方法，運用Matlab 程式讀取分析資料並進一步繪圖。分析方法包括基本資料統計、調和分析(Harmonic analysis)、主軸分析(EOF)、小波分析(Wavelet analysis)、頻譜分析(FFT)、率波分析(Bandpass analysis)。
objectives: 本課程之教學目標在於教導與啟發學生如何探討海洋現象，具備從規劃實驗、取得資料、分析資料到結果呈現與報告撰寫的能力，本課程亦著重討論與文章閱讀，培養學生獨立思考之能力。

name:
進階科學英文
ADVANCED SCIENTIFIC ENGLISH
description:
《講授類》
1. 與DO405併班上課。 2. TOEIC above 600 or equivalent
syllabus: This course aims to equip the students with the English language and communication skills that scientists and technologists need to communicate with fellow scientists and technologists as well as with non-scientists.The first few lectures will cover the main steps in building up basic but logical discourses in Scientific English. This will include acquiring some basic building blocks such as vocabulary, syntax and tenses, and how to use them. These building blocks will then be used to describe the elements of a graph such as trends, changes, rate of change, variations, correlations etc.The second phase of the course (after the mid-term exam) will consist of research paper discussions. Informal feedback will be given to the students after each paper discussion so that they may improve their reading strategy and become better able to distil the information contained in a scientific paper. Students will choose their paper topics among a list provided by the Course Instructor.In the third and last phase of the course, the students will be asked to produce a poster from reading materials provided by the Course Instructor and to present their poster in front of their peers. General guidelines for preparing and presenting the poster will be provided in advance during a special class session.
objectives: 1.	To expand the students' vocabulary and language skills that they need to share scientific information in their respective fields.2.	To guide the students through the process of dissecting and analysing a scientific paper.3.	To give the student the opportunity to practice their newly acquired language skills through class discussions and workshops.

name:
珊瑚礁生物學
BIOLOGY OF CORAL REEFS
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\DO711.TXT珊瑚礁是海洋中最炫目、歧異度最高、生物種類最多且最複雜的生態系統，孕育數十萬種已知和超過數百萬種未 知的海洋生物，超過數十億人口的生計與珊瑚礁生態穩定有關，但海水暖化正以頻繁且日益嚴重的珊瑚白化現象 威脅珊瑚礁生態，因此本課程將從珊瑚礁的生化、生理與生態說明珊瑚礁的功能性與全球氣候變遷影響的各個層 面，並提及珊瑚礁生態保育與管理。主要內容包括:1.熱帶海洋生態系中珊瑚礁的獨特多樣性與生產力。2.造礁生物與棲地競爭。3.棲地型態。4.共生互動模式。5.珊瑚礁生態中的微生物、單胞藻與其他浮游生物的角色。6.珊瑚礁魚類。7.遊憩、漁業和養殖的影響。8.環境壓力種類及對珊瑚礁的影響。9.珊瑚礁保育與管理的策略。
objectives: 1. 了解珊瑚礁的生態角色與特性2. 提升對海洋生態保育的認知

name:
海洋基礎生產力
MARINE PRIMARY PRODUCTIVITY
syllabus: 1. To introduce the biology and ecology of marine primary producers, as well as their roles in oceanography.2. To compare the methods to measure primary productivity and new productivity, and their roles in marine ecosystems.3. To analyze the dynamics and controls of primary productivity in the seas off Taiwan.4. To discuss the current research topics focused on primary productivity and primary producers in the world.
objectives: To understand the knowledge about marine primary producers, primary productivity and new productivity, and their related research in the present. The graduate students can develop their expertise to research topics related to marine primary productivity and new productivity during the training in this course.

name:
應用統計學（一）
APPLIED STATISTICS (I)
description:
《講授類》
選修「應用統計學(一)」課程需同時選修「應用統計學實習(一)」課程。與DO206併班上課。
tags: ['環境教育學程', '擁海學程', '半導體製程模組學程']
syllabus: 1. 正課與實習課進度完全配合，必需同時修讀"應用統計學實習（一）"，但已修過"應用統計學實習（一）" 者除外。2. 課程內容包括常態分布、趨中心定理、擬說測驗、t分布及測驗、駢對t測驗、卡方分布及測驗、F分布及測驗、單分類變方分析、正交比較、事後檢定、直線迴歸分析、相關係數。
objectives: 學習針對研究目的，體材，使用不同的實驗設計，配合不同的統計分析方法，及對分析結果的判斷等一系列的整體統計學訓練。

name:
應用統計學實習（一）
APPLIED STATISTICS PRACTICE (I)
description:
《實習類》
選修「應用統計學實習(一)」課程需同時選修「應用統計學(一)」課程。與DO207併班上課。
syllabus: １。電腦之操作運用；套裝程式SPSS之應用；２。配合應用統計學（一）進度相關題目之演練；３。針對主題設計實驗、收集資料及上台報告討論：包括駢對ｔ測驗,ｔ測驗。４。必需同時修讀本系“應用統計學（一）“。
objectives: 活用並熟練應用統計學（一）。配合電腦套裝程式SPSS之應用﹐演練應用統計學（一）進度相關題目外﹐並實地進行不同研究題材之實驗設計、資料收集及上台報告﹐提供全班討論﹐由實際案例﹐檢討錯誤關念﹐達到活用目的。

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=DO720&Crsname=機器學習概論及其在海洋科學的應用
name:
機器學習概論及其在海洋科學的應用
INTRODUCTORY MACHINE LEARNING AND ITS APPLICATION IN MARINE SCIENCES
syllabus: 1. First part of the course focuses on the machine learning concepts and implementation with scikit-learn.2. The second part focuses on the basics of deep learning and implementation with Keras/Tensorflow.3. We will discuss some case studies in marine applications throughout the courses.
objectives: This course introduces students to machine learning and its applications. Upon completion, students will be able to implement various ML models, from simple linear models to deep learning models, and apply the models on problems in marine sciences.

name:
海上實習（一）
CRUISE PRACTICE (I)
description:
《實習類》
本課程限海下科技研究所碩士班研究生及已取得海下科技研究所五學年學碩士資格之大學部學生選修。
syllabus: 海洋儀器使用與實習,訓練學生熟悉各種海研儀器，並體驗海上作業。本課程所需熟稔的海洋探測儀器包括：GPS、CTD、ADCPS、Echo Sounder(EK500)、Magnetometer、ROV、Sonar、Ultra Short Baseline Positioning System、Surface Buoy、Abyss Twisted-pair Imaging System、Fiber-optical Instrumentation Towed System。
objectives: 本課程主要的目的在於訓練學生熟悉各種海研儀器（如Echo Sounder、CTD、Magnetometer、ROV、Sonar、Underwater Tracking System），先藉由課堂進行儀器講解與操作，再輔以實際出海作業的方式，完成資料擷取、資料分析與探討，讓學生瞭解海上及水下作業程序、海洋環境、相關海洋探測儀器設備之功能與操作等，並體驗海洋探測研究之過程。

name:
工程聲學
ENGINEERING ACOUSTICS
tags: ['南星產業樞紐學程', '環境教育學程', '海事工程學程']
syllabus: 本課程將以工程應用的觀點，根據基礎聲學理論來探討噪音及聲學環境問題，並提供噪音減量的準則，及聲學環境設計的依據。
objectives: 建立工程噪音量測及改善的理論與實務基礎

name:
電腦語言與數值模擬
COMPUTER LANGUAGE AND SIMULATION
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\UT513.TXT電腦語言扮演人與電腦之間溝通的介面，也是呈現撰寫者思維的。與自然語言間要如何做轉換是本課程的重點。我們將進行以下項目：電腦語言簡介：變數種類、資料結構、流程控制、副程式暨函數之撰寫除錯概念、工具與技巧資料處理之演算概念或制御方程式(governing equations)結構與電腦程式之轉換模擬程式數據輸出與圖形介面樹莓派電腦之簡介與應用人機介面與受控電路之架構網路遠端控制之建置
objectives: 建立將思考流程轉成電腦程式之表達能力培養C（或python）語言之基礎使用能力

name:
數值方法與軟體應用
NUMERICAL METHODS WITH MATLAB
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\UT514.TXTNumerical methods are used frequently in all areas of science and engineering. Moreover, techniques from numerical analysis play an important role in mathematical research on differential equations, stochastics, optimization, etc. We focus on the introduction to numerical methods with an emphasis on mathematical models. The list of subjects includes (1) nonlinear equations, (2) sets of equations, (3) interpolation and curve fitting, (4) function approximation, numerical differentiation and integration, (5) ordinary differential equations, and (6) eigenvalue problem.
objectives: The goal of the course is to provide the students with a strong background on numerical approximation strategies and a basic knowledge on the theory that supports numerical algorithms. Students will demonstrate the ability to translate numerical problems into a computational algorithm.

name:
訊號與系統
SIGNALS AND SYSTEMS
tags: ['南星產業樞紐學程', '海事工程學程']
syllabus: 本課程主要探討在非時變的線性系統中，各種輸入及輸出訊號的特性與處理技術，同時亦討論此類線性系統對訊號的影響。課程重要內容將包括：線性系統特性、連續及離散訊號、傅立葉分析、快速傅立葉轉換、頻率域分析、時間域分析、濾波及取樣技巧等。此外，為了增進對課程理論的了解，本課程也將以MATLAB來進行數值模擬演練，特別是針對離散訊號的分析。
objectives: 提供基礎訊號與系統分析訓練

name:
海下科技研討（一）
SEMINAR IN UNDERSEA TECHNOLOGY (I)
syllabus: 邀請學者專家專題演講；學生進行學術論文報告；英文聽講、背誦與測驗。遠距教學使用Google Meet進行，另行公告課程網址連結。
objectives: 透過邀請國內外專家學者和產業界人士進行專題研討，使學生得以與產業界、研究機構及國際潮流接軌，瞭解當前之研究趨勢、產業狀態、以及就業方向。透過口頭報告培養學生演講技巧及表達能力。透過英文聽講、背誦與測驗，加強學生英文能力。

name:
海下科技研討（三）
SEMINAR IN UNDERSEA TECHNOLOGY (III)
syllabus: 18週的外邀演講及學生上台簡報研究進度。若需遠距教學，將使用google meet線上軟體：視訊通話連結：海下科技研討視訊通話連結：https://meet.google.com/svw-wwpq-upu
objectives: 透過一系列外邀學術界和產業界學者專家演講，讓學生接觸瞭解海下科技國內外研究現狀與產業發展趨勢。同時藉由學生上台公開演講的機會，訓練他們的組織及口語表達能力。

name:
水下光電
UNDERWATER OPTOELECTRONICS
tags: ['海事工程學程']
syllabus: 1. 屈光度、阿貝係數、數值孔徑與焦比介紹Introduction of diopter, Abbe number, numerical aperture, and F-number2. 水下望遠鏡與顯微鏡原理Principles of underwater telescope and microscope3. 偏振光、波片與外差干涉術Polarization light, wave plate, and heterodyne interferometry4. 全內反射Total internal reflection5. 表面電漿共振感測器Surface plasma resonance sensors6. 光纖原理、光纖感測器與通訊Principles of optical fiber, optical fiber sensor and communication7. 光纖布拉格光柵海洋應用Applications of fiber Bragg grating in ocean8. 高靈敏度光柵光譜儀High-sensitivity grating spectrometer9. 光學濾波器與水下拉曼光譜應用Optical filter and underwater Raman spectroscopy applications10.離子感測場效電晶體在海水ph值檢測Ion- sensitive field effect transistor (ISFET) in the ph measuring of seawater11.外差干涉術之海水鹽度感測Seawater salinity sensing by heterodyne interferometry12.水下壓力與折射率之關係The relationship between underwater pressure and refractive index若需遠距教學，將使用google meet線上軟體：視訊通話連結：meet.google.com/scz-wamu-yuv
objectives: 此課程教授基礎光學與水下光電之應用，以及水下光電感測器原理；課程結合海下光機電整合所需的相關知識。This course cultivates the concepts of basic optics and underwater optoelectronics applications as well as the principle of underwater photoelectric sensors. This course combines with the relevant knowledge required for undersea opto- electromechanical integration.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=UT543&Crsname=模糊邏輯控制與水下載具應用
name:
模糊邏輯控制與水下載具應用
FUZZY LOGIC CONTROL AND ITS APPLICATION TO UNDERWATER VEHICLES
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\UT543.TXT本課程講授模糊邏輯之數學理論及其在水下載具控制方面之應用。This course illustrates mathematical theory of fuzzy logic and its application to control of underwater vehicles.
objectives: 1. 模糊集合與歸屬函數Fuzzy sets and membership functions2. 模糊關係Fuzzy relations3. 模糊邏輯Fuzzy logic4. 基於模糊規則之系統Fuzzy rule-based systems5. 模糊控制系統Fuzzy control systems6. 模糊分類與圖樣辨識Fuzzy classification and pattern recognition7. 模糊非線性模擬Fuzzy nonlinear simulation8. 水下載具動態系統數學建模Dynamic system modeling of underwater vehicles9. 水下載具運動控制器設計Design of motion controllers for underwater vehicles10. 水下載具模糊控制案例探討Case studies on fuzzy control of underwater vehicles
