objectives: 本課程進行方式以課前閱讀、上課討論和實地操作為主。每一位修課學生皆需在該學期找到自己的研究題目和一個質性的研究方法，並實際進行研究的操作，和最後撰寫研究報告。在課程中除了將討論本課程的指定閱讀書目外，期末每位學生都要找出自己的研究主題並進行研究，並撰寫研究結果。期末報告的內容需含研究問題、問題意識、文獻回顧，並找到一個質性研究的方法，以進行資料的收集分析與寫。

name:
專題研討（一）
SEMINAR IN EDUCATIONAL RESEARCH
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IOE749.TXT本課程主要為參與學者專家之專題演講與博士生之專題報告，以理解現今教育相關領域研究趨勢與方法，進而培育自身相關知識與技巧。
objectives: 透過參與多元教育相關專題領域研討，增進對於教育與心理專業之認識與實踐。

name:
網路心理文化與行為
CYBER PSYCHOLOGY, CULTURE AND BEHAVIOR
description:
《講授類》
限教育所學生修習
syllabus: 課程之主軸為網路心理文化與相關行為之探討，著重線上社群、媒體素養、網路交友、網路成癮、網路霸凌、社會網絡、網路謠言等議題；並對於學術倫理做深入探討。各週授課內容與主題將視修課同學的興趣予以調整
objectives: 瞭解網路對使用者的認知與行為影響；反思網路媒體對社會公民多元價值的影響；學習思辨社會性科技議題；培養學生的媒體素養知能。

name:
生命教育研究
STUDIES IN LIFE EDUCATION
syllabus: 生命教育的重點在於認識生命、建構生命意義，透過終極關懷與實踐、倫理思考與反省、人格統整與靈性發展，以逐步開啟個人生命智慧。本課程旨在探究生命教育與生命意義研究領域的重要理論、研究方法及最新研究成果。透過跨領域的討論，以擷取新知，並能進一步激盪及貢獻新知。就實際層面而言，期能透過對生命教育及生命意義的探討，以開啟追求人生智慧之契機。
objectives: 1.	瞭解生命教育與生命意義的基本理論知識與研究方法。2.	能知悉生命教育與生命意義的最新研究發展與趨勢。3.	能針對生命教育與生命意義進行跨領域的融合，建立個人信念並貢獻新知。4.	將課程內容運用於生活之中，結合理論與實際，以趣向有智慧的人生。

name:
多元文化教育研究
RESEARCH ON MULTICULTURAL EDUCATION
syllabus: The course aims to help students understand the issues of equity, diversity, and social justice in education.
objectives: The course has three main goals: 1) to study the fundamental concepts of multicultural education, 2) to use multicultural perspectives to study how diverse students groups learn with a specific focus on the indigenous communities, and 3) to extend the multicultural perspectives to culturally responsive curriculum, teaching, and evaluation.

name:
課程發展與設計
CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND DESIGN
tags: ['環境教育學程']
syllabus: 一、課程發展與設計的基本概念二、十二年國教課程的要旨與特色三、永續發展目標四、課程目標的分析與撰寫五、學習內容與課程活動的選擇與組織六、學習表現與學習評量設計七、課程評鑑的設計八、課程實施策略的規劃九、學校總體課程計畫之規劃十、課程設計實作與演示
objectives: 本課程在於協助學生發展課程設計的實作能力，了解我國當前課程設計的趨勢與重要議題，並能妥善規劃與運用課程設計的基本模式、課程目標、課程選擇、課程組織、課程評鑑與課程實施等要素，希望藉由相關單元的講述、討論與報告，透過教學單元設計演練，協助學生熟悉並統整課程設計的理論與實務。

name:
永續發展教育研究
EDUCATION FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT RESEARCH
tags: ['環境教育學程', 'STREAM永續發展培力微學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IOE778.TXT教育是實現永續發展的基礎，從永續發展概述、永續發展教育的歷史演變和核心內涵加以理解，並探討永續發展教育與永續發展目標的關聯。從探討氣候變遷、循環經濟、消除貧窮以及企業永續等關鍵議題，進一步從經濟、社會與環境層面來翻轉我們的全球，為全球人類的永續發展向下扎根。
objectives: 永續發展是當前全球最迫切的議題之一，永續發展的根本在教育。本課程旨在探討攸關永續發展的關鍵議題，提升對永續發展教育內涵與價值的理解，從經濟、社會與環境層面運用教育核心能力與素養，成為具備永續發展思維的全球公民。

name:
人工智慧教育
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IN EDUCATION
syllabus: This course explores the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) in educational settings, examining both theoretical frameworks and practical applications.Students will learn about AI technologies, their impact on learning and teaching, and ethical considerations. The course combines lectures, discussions, hands-onactivities, and project-based learning.
objectives: 1. Understand the fundamentals of AI and its applications in education.2. Analyze the impact of AI on teaching, learning, and educational outcomes.3. Explore AI tools and technologies used in educational settings.4. Develop critical thinking skills regarding ethical and practical issues in AI in education.5. Design and implement AI-based projects to enhance learning experiences.

name:
教育學方法論研究
SPECIAL TOPICS IN METHODOLOGY OF EDUCATIONAL STUDIES
syllabus: 本科目將先針對學哲學、研究典範與教育研究之關係加以探究，再就教育研究之主要方法論問題與研究效度加以討論，並進一步教育研究科學化之歷史進程進行分析，進而探討當代社會科學方法論對教育研究之影響，最後對質性研究與量化研究進行對話與整合。
objectives: 了解各種教育研究方法之理論基礎，使學生在實際進行教育研究時，能適切掌握教育問題、解決教育問題，進而導向新教育理論之建立。

name:
獨立研究（一）
INDEPENDENT STUDIES
teacher: 謝百淇,周珮儀,宋宥賢,施慶麟,林靜慧,楊淑晴,莊雪華,陳利銘
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IOE802.TXT依規定免登
objectives: 依規定免登

name:
專題研討（三）
SEMINAR IN EDUCATIONAL RESEARCH
syllabus: 本課程主要為參與學者專家之專題演講與博士生之專題報告，以理解現今教育相關領域研究趨勢與方法，進而培育自身相關知識與技巧。
objectives: 透過參與多元教育相關專題領域研討，增進對於教育與心理專業之認識與實踐。

name:
高等教育統計學研究
RESEARCH IN ADVANCED STATISTICS IN EDUCATION
syllabus: 1.基本操作與資料處理2.統計分析的原理與技術3.單變量與多變量4.資料簡化分析5.預測分析技術6.因果關係分析
objectives: 瞭解高等統計學的概念和運用時機，熟悉 SPSS 統計軟體操作且能正確解釋統計報表，並能在研究實務上作適當的應用

name:
高等教育測驗學
HIGH EDUCATION PSYCHOLOGICAL TESTING
syllabus: 修習完本課程後，學生能夠：1.說明試題反應理論的概念及意涵2.說明本課程之概念對於其研究主題之助益3.應用本課程習得之概念進行資料分析及解釋
objectives: 透過講解試題反應理論(IRT)的概念以及關連性，引導學生將所學到之知識應用於相關研究並進行發表。

name:
高等教育校務研究專題
THE FOUNDATIONS OF INSTITUTIONAL RESEARCH
syllabus: INTRODUCTION:This course is intended to design for students interested in developing a scholarly understanding of institutional research. This is an introductory course acquaints students with IR issues that are considered in greater depth and also to develop basic skills and abilities required of IR practitioners. It provides the foundational concepts, practices and techniques of institutional research and a general approach to understanding and improving institutional effectiveness and accountability in higher education institutions.
objectives: 1. Develop the fundamental knowledge about the work of institutional research and understand concepts, methodologies, research practices, and information system that support campus decision making.2. Be able to utilize effectively the resources provided by the office of institutional research, such as being able to define the types of information and analyses needed to address questions associated with institutional planning and implementation.3. Know where to find and how to manage and use relevant data resources to address typical institutional research topics.4. Critique the rigor and quality of institutional research reports based on statistical rigor, appropriate use of data, and effective data reporting skills.

name:
教育創新管理
MANAGEMENT OF INNOVATION IN EDUCATION
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IOE823.TXTThis course is focused on innovation and how it can be strategically managed in the educational contexts.
objectives: Objectives1.To understand the role of innovation in educational setting2.To understand various strategies for exploiting innovations3.To formulate recommendations on solving issues related to poor innovative performance

name:
研究方法論
RESEARCH METHODOLOGY
syllabus: This Course1. help students learn about the role of theories and paradigms in the organization and the production of knowledge.2. explore the validity issues of quantitative and qualitative research.3. address basic concepts employed in quantitative and qualitative research methods.
objectives: After completing the course, students will1. understand the competing paradigms of educational research.2. understand the macro-perspective of methods associated with conducting educational research.3. learn how to plan and conduct quantitative and qualitative methods applied to the prospective and key issues in education research.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=IOE840&Crsname=全球研究、全球教育與全球學習
name:
全球研究、全球教育與全球學習
GLOBAL STUDIES, GLOBAL EDUCATION, AND GLOBAL LEARNING
syllabus: MODULE I: Students will encounter Global Studies as a discipline and learn to think with theoretical and methodological approaches associated with global studies to shed light on major issues faced by humanity and gain a basic understanding of the ways thinkers in economics, political science, environmental science, and cultural studies have engaged with educational issues. These disciplinary lenses will be applied to consideration of policy, practice, and changes in education.MODULE II: Students will explore various cases of global learning in academic and professional contexts and consider their relationship to diverse global issues broached in the earlier part of the class.MODULE III: Students will encounter various studies from educational psychology and philosophy discussing learning in cross-cultural contexts or for global orientation.
objectives: The objectives of this course are: 1) (MODULE I) to familiarize students with major theories of globalization and methodologies and methods for conducting global studies as an academic field, particularly as pertains to education; 2) (MODULE II) to explore with students various modes of global education, from study abroad, to academic exchange, and international internships and professional development; 3) (MODULE III) to offer an overview of and opportunities to experientially engage with practices of global learning.

name:
知識創新教育研討
SPECIAL TOPICS IN KNOWLEDGE CREATION
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IOE853.TXTHow is learning changing in the knowledge age and digital world? What does the lifelong learner mean to address global issues and respond to real-world problems? This course offers weekly topics to explore educational issues, followed by tracing its foundations, paradigms, and applications of knowledge creation in education. Contemporary issues and methodologies will be addressed and included to broaden the perspectives of learning in the knowledge/digital age. This course also provides collaborative learning opportunities and group discussions to help you develop instructional design and research ideas based on your research interest.Please attend the Week 1 class overview if you are interested in taking this course.
objectives: 1. Understand the foundations and paradigms of knowledge creation2. Apply theoretical groundwork to educational practices3. Integrate contemporary research results and their practical applications into teaching and learning4. Develop instructional and research designs for knowledge learning environments

name:
跨領域對話教育研究
RESEARCH ON INTERDISCIPLINARY DIALOGIC EDUCATION
syllabus: This course explores the theoretical foundations and practical applications of dialogic edu-cation across disciplines. We will study key scholars who have significantly contributed to the understanding of dialogic processes in educational settings. Additionally, the course will cover research methodologies for investigating classroom dialogue, with a focus on both qualitative and quantitative approaches. The course will culminate in a final project where students design a strategy or intervention to promote effective classroom dialogue. This course invites you to critically engage with the concept of dialogue in education and to think creatively about how to apply these ideas in your own educational practice and even your own daily life. Your active participation and thoughtful contributions are essential to the success of the course.
objectives: By the end of this course, students will be able to:1. Understand and articulate the theoretical foundations of dialogic education.2. Identify and analyze the contributions of key scholars in the field.3. Develop and apply research methodologies to study classroom dialogue.4. Design and propose strategies for promoting effective classroom dialogue in diverse educational settings.

name:
政治學研究方法
POLITICAL SCIENCE RESEARCH METHODS
syllabus: 透過相關的閱讀與討論，本課程將教導學生一步步進行屬於自己的學術研究。從發掘疑問與研究議題、收集資料與相關的論文、閱讀與批判資料、到學習如何建立研究與理論架構，並大量收集證據來檢驗所建立之理論與主要論點。最後亦將練習如何將論點與證據清楚呈現於報告與論文的撰寫。
objectives: （一）使學生了解學術研究的過程。（二）教導學生收集研究資料之方法。（三）訓練學生客觀評估現有學術研究的貢獻與缺點。（四）引導學生建立自己的研究與理論架構。（五）使學生練習將論點與證據清楚呈現於報告與論文的撰寫。

name:
法學研究方法
COMPARATIVE LEGAL RESEARCH METHODOLOGY
syllabus: 本課程旨在讓同學了解法律的本質與功能，並在此基礎上學習正確思辨法律知識的方法和論文寫作的研究方法。教學方式包括教師講授、學生撰擬報告並口頭報告、評論他人報告。課程各階段安排如下：第一階段將透過閱讀文獻和書籍，由教師帶領討論，學生須閱讀指定教材並於課堂報告並參與討論。藉此使學生理解法律體系的本質和功能，並學習法學研究及解釋方法。第二階段將透過論文主題設定、大綱撰擬、文獻蒐集、瞭解學術論文撰擬格式及學術倫理要求，使學生具備法律研究者之基本能力。本課堂要求學生完成六小時之學術倫理教育課程訓練並於期末檢附相關證明文件。第三階段將由學生撰擬學術文章，並以模擬研討會方式安排口頭發表及同儕互評，藉此訓練學生學術發表及評論之能力。本課程鼓勵學生將研究成果發表於研討會或期刊。書面及口頭報告要求將於課堂上公告。※教師有調整授課進度與內容之權利，會事先告知學生※※本課程注重出席及討論，若因故無法前來上課，請於事前、當天或缺席一週內以電郵告知事由(病、公、喪、事假等)。逾期不予請假。事假過多者將酌扣出席成績(教師電郵：chyang@g-mail.nsysu.edu.tw)※※請勿以自己或他人之他課程作業、已發表或未發表文章，或任何非出於本學期己手完成之報告搪塞。違者將以不及格計※
objectives: 本課程的設計目標是引導學習者了解法學的學科屬性，掌握法學專業研究的基本原理，使其熟悉系統性研究的專業知識，並藉此培養正確的研究態度，以期順利完成基於法學專業的學位論文。

name:
美國外交政策
AMERICAN FOREIGN POLICY
syllabus: The ultimate question of this course is what the most important factor is to explain the shift and variation of American foreign policy. In other words, this is not a course to introduce the historical development of American foreign policy. The goal of this course is to assess the applicability and generalizability of international relations theories on the making of American foreign policy. We will also take the on-going US-China strategic competition as an important topic to verify and evaluate the gap between theory and reality.This course will cover topics ranging from the level-of-analysis problem, structural and neo-classical realism, power transition, domestic politics, decision-making process, sharp power, and offshore balance.
objectives: This course hopes to lay down the theoretical foundation for students and cultivate their ability to apply sophisticated methods of inquiry in the field of international relations for further research.

name:
美日關係與軍事同盟
US-JAPAN RELATIONS AND MILITARY ALLIANCE
tags: ['日本研究學程']
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CAPS775.TXTThis course is designed to deepen students’ understanding on the U.S.-Japan relations, particularly on the origins, development, current status, future challenges, and impacts to Asia-Pacific region as a whole. Therefore, there are four main themes of this class: the historical background of U.S.-Japan relations; the U.S.-Japan relations and military alliance in the postwar and during Cold War eras; the redefinition of U.S.-Japan military alliance under new international orders; and conclusions. In addition, this course requires students to have some background education on Japanese politics before taking this class.
objectives: 1.Deepen students’ understanding on the origins, development, and current changes of U.S.-Japan relations, as well as the impacts to the Asia-Pacific region.2.Allow students to be familiar with alliance theories of international relations3.Enable students to criticize current literatures and theories4.Guide students to establish their own theoretical frameworks and views

name:
亞太國家憲政發展
CONSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF ASIA-PACIFIC COUNTRIES
tags: ['日本研究學程']
syllabus: 本課程將藉由對日本、韓國、新加坡、馬來西亞、泰國等亞太國家憲政的探討，以及對不同體制的相互比較對照，以促進對各該國家近年經社發展歷程和憲政體制的理解。This semester's courses of Constitutional Development of Asia-Pacific Countries will be focused on the development of constitutional law and constitutional system in Taiwan, Japan, South Korea, Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand, and adress the constituitonal culture, constituional making history, government and seperation of powers, constitutional change etc. in these countries.
objectives: 使學生能探究並分析比較亞太國家的憲政發展過程及憲政制度To provide a more dynamic and contextual perspective on the theory and practice of constitional law in Asia; to compare and analyze constitutional issues in Taiwan and in other Asian states

name:
國際經濟趨勢分析
ANALYSIS OF INTERNATIONAL ECONOMIC TRENDS
syllabus: This course aims to present the contemporaneous financial economic issues. The topics cover three perspectives: (1) Bank diversification and global banking industry. (2) FinTech and financial markets. (3) Fintech and financial inclusion. We will be reading and discussing academic articles on the first topic which explains why and how the banks operate on diversification activities and their performance on those activities. In the second topic, we will be learning with the online course and academic articles. A few financial innovations will be covered and discussed. The third topic discuss about how the new financial technology can improve the access of financial services for households in developing countries. The class will review and discuss about the operation of global financial system and how the system affects modern economic activities. We will also be learning how to access and analyze related empirical data on each topic.
objectives: Students who take this course will benefit from the economic point of views from the multiple and contemporaneous financial issues. They shall learn tools and methods which help the further research ability in the related fields. Students are assumed to have taken an introductory course in principles of economics and statistics.Online learning on Coursera at home is required. The material in the online course will be discussed briefly in class. Papers will be assigned and distributed in class. There will be assignment almost every week. The assignment is presented with Xmind for summary and another PDF file for detailed description if necessary. For the practice of empirical analyses, students are suggested to be familiar with at least one econometric package. (Eviews, Stata, Gauss, R,…).

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=CAPS876&Crsname=國際法原理與內國法律實踐
name:
國際法原理與內國法律實踐
PRICIPLES OF INTERNATIONAL LAW AND DOMESTIC PRACTICES
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\CAPS876.TXT一、兩岸人民關係條例有關領域與管轄的敘述，以及區域法律衝突法的規範。二、兩岸人民關係條例有關加入世界貿易組織的國際經濟規範修法調整。三、兩岸人民關係條例有關兩會協議處理的法源與實踐。四、兩岸人民關係條例有關正常化的短中長期立法規劃。五、兩大國際人權公約施行對於兩岸關係法律體系的轉變。六、大陸人民在台法律地位與憲法平等權及合理的差別性待遇。七、美日德民主國家就主要差別待遇立法例與不同的待遇標準。八、現行港澳關係條例準用外國人待遇與條件的相關原則。九、區際經濟整合與97-99港澳地位與待遇的重新定位。十、新的主權連結模式與區域整合：Commonwealth、MAI與NAFTA。
objectives: 課程的主要設計，乃在討論國際法原理在我國立法過程中的應用。主要的討論重點在於兩岸人民關係條例與港澳關係條例的歷次修法，其有關國際法原理的應用，以及區域法律衝突法律適用的相關政府實踐。經由兩岸法律立法過程的進階案例研究，瞭解主權、治權、管轄權的內國法律實踐，以及與兩岸有關的國際法問題。選課學生必須具備國際法或國際經濟法基礎的法律本科生，或修過本人在中國與亞太區域研究所開過的國際法有關的任一課程。

name:
研究方法論
RESEARCH METHODOLOGY
syllabus: This Course1. help students learn about the role of theories and paradigms in the organization and the production of knowledge.2. explore the validity issues of quantitative and qualitative research.3. address basic concepts employed in quantitative and qualitative research methods.
objectives: After completing the course, students will1. understand the competing paradigms of educational research.2. understand the macro-perspective of methods associated with conducting educational research.3. learn how to plan and conduct quantitative and qualitative methods applied to the prospective and key issues in education research.

name:
教育統計學研究
STUDIES IN EDUCATIONAL STATISTICS
syllabus: This course deals with methods of basic statistics as these are used in practice. Topics covered are descriptive statistics, random and discrete variables, sampling, estimation, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, analysis of variance, surveys, and experimental designs.
objectives: The learning objectives of this class are as follows: 1. To develop skills needed to use quantitative methods effectively 2. To interpret and communicate statistical results

name:
多元文化教育研究
RESEARCH ON MULTICULTURAL EDUCATION
syllabus: The course aims to help students understand the issues of equity, diversity, and social justice in education.
objectives: The course has three main goals: 1) to study the fundamental concepts of multicultural education, 2) to use multicultural perspectives to study how diverse students groups learn with a specific focus on the indigenous communities, and 3) to extend the multicultural perspectives to culturally responsive curriculum, teaching, and evaluation.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=IGPE738&Crsname=教育測驗資料分析(以R軟體操作)
name:
教育測驗資料分析(以R軟體操作)
EDUCATIONAL MEASUREMENT DATA ANALYSIS USING R
syllabus: This course aims to develop students’ proficiency in quantitative research while enhancing their ability to learn and apply quantitative analysis tools, specifically R software. The course emphasizes the integration of knowledge, practical application, problem-solving, and self-directed learning. Students will be encouraged to propose research questions and explore solutions through hands-on experience with R. The topics covered will be tailored to students’ existing skills and learning progress and may include basic statistical concepts, descriptive statistics, multivariate analysis, and structural equation modeling.
objectives: This course aims to develop students’ proficiency in quantitative research while enhancing their ability to learn and apply quantitative analysis tools, specifically R software. The course emphasizes the integration of knowledge, practical application, problem-solving, and self-directed learning. Students will be encouraged to propose research questions and explore solutions through hands-on experience with R. The topics covered will be tailored to students’ existing skills and learning progress and may include basic statistical concepts, descriptive statistics, multivariate analysis, and structural equation modeling.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=IGPE757&Crsname=全球研究、全球教育與全球學習
name:
全球研究、全球教育與全球學習
GLOBAL STUDIES, GLOBAL EDUCATION, AND GLOBAL LEARNING
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IGPE757.TXTMODULE I: Students will encounter Global Studies as a discipline and learn to think with theoretical and methodological approaches associated with global studies to shed light on major issues faced by humanity and gain a basic understanding of the ways thinkers in economics, political science, environmental science, and cultural studies have engaged with educational issues. These disciplinary lenses will be applied to consideration of policy, practice, and changes in education.MODULE II: Students will explore various cases of global learning in academic and professional contexts and consider their relationship to diverse global issues broached in the earlier part of the class.MODULE III: Students will encounter various studies from educational psychology and philosophy discussing learning in cross-cultural contexts or for global orientation.
objectives: The objectives of this course are: 1) (MODULE I) to familiarize students with major theories of globalization and methodologies and methods for conducting global studies as an academic field, particularly as pertains to education; 2) (MODULE II) to explore with students various modes of global education, from study abroad, to academic exchange, and international internships and professional development; 3) (MODULE III) to offer an overview of and opportunities to experientially engage with practices of global learning.

name:
知識創新教育研討
SPECIAL TOPICS IN KNOWLEDGE CREATION
syllabus: How is learning changing in the knowledge age and digital world? What does the lifelong learner mean to address global issues and respond to real-world problems? This course offers weekly topics to explore educational issues, followed by tracing its foundations, paradigms, and applications of knowledge creation in education. Contemporary issues and methodologies will be addressed and included to broaden the perspectives of learning in the knowledge/digital age. This course also provides collaborative learning opportunities and group discussions to help you develop instructional design and research ideas based on your research interest.Please attend the Week 1 class overview if you are interested in taking this course.
objectives: 1. Understand the foundations and paradigms of knowledge creation2. Apply theoretical groundwork to educational practices3. Integrate contemporary research results and their practical applications into teaching and learning4. Develop instructional and research designs for knowledge learning environments

name:
跨領域對話教育研究
RESEARCH ON INTERDISCIPLINARY DIALOGIC EDUCATION
syllabus: This course explores the theoretical foundations and practical applications of dialogic edu-cation across disciplines. We will study key scholars who have significantly contributed to the understanding of dialogic processes in educational settings. Additionally, the course will cover research methodologies for investigating classroom dialogue, with a focus on both qualitative and quantitative approaches. The course will culminate in a final project where students design a strategy or intervention to promote effective classroom dialogue. This course invites you to critically engage with the concept of dialogue in education and to think creatively about how to apply these ideas in your own educational practice and even your own daily life. Your active participation and thoughtful contributions are essential to the success of the course.
objectives: By the end of this course, students will be able to:1. Understand and articulate the theoretical foundations of dialogic education.2. Identify and analyze the contributions of key scholars in the field.3. Develop and apply research methodologies to study classroom dialogue.4. Design and propose strategies for promoting effective classroom dialogue in diverse educational settings.

name:
人工智慧教育
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE IN EDUCATION
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\IGPE770.TXTThis course explores the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) in educational settings, examining both theoretical frameworks and practical applications.Students will learn about AI technologies, their impact on learning and teaching, and ethical considerations. The course combines lectures, discussions, hands-onactivities, and project-based learning.
objectives: 1. Understand the fundamentals of AI and its applications in education.2. Analyze the impact of AI on teaching, learning, and educational outcomes.3. Explore AI tools and technologies used in educational settings.4. Develop critical thinking skills regarding ethical and practical issues in AI in education.5. Design and implement AI-based projects to enhance learning experiences.

name:
發展心理學研究
RESEARCH IN DEVELOPMENTAL PSYCHOLOGY
syllabus: This course focuses on two main areas ‘development’ and ‘practice.’ This course, from the perspectives of neural biology, psychological processes, and social culture, explores the developmental changes from childhood to adulthood, with a particular emphasis on the physical and mental states of childhood and adolescence. In terms of research of developmental psychology, the main focus of this course is on the maturation and changes in individuals with regard to physiology, perception, cognition, language, social interaction, emotion, and intelligence. Building on this knowledge base, it is necessary to further understand how schools and families respond to individual development, especially during adolescence. Therefore, in practice, the course aims to assist students in understanding and analyzing how nature and nurture interact and influence an individual's situation, and how to handle maladaptive behaviors that may occur during adolescence through lectures, literature reviews, flipped classrooms, group discussions, and field trips.
objectives: 1.To understand the concepts and research trends of developmental psychology.2.To understand the development of childhood and adolescence from a physiological, mental, and social perspective.3.To understand potential problems that might occur during adolescent puberty, such as problems with behavior, emotions, learning, etc.4.To learn how to analyze individual’s problems by the perspectives of ecological systems.5.To learn about guidance principles and strategies to address problems in adolescent puberty.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=DCEM712&Crsname=人類疾病之創新動物模式研究
name:
人類疾病之創新動物模式研究
TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH USING INNOVATIVE ANIMAL MODELS
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\DCEM712.TXTThe major goal of this course is to introduce current animal models that are used in medical research relating to human diseases and psychiatry. This course will cover key concepts including 1) the role of animal models in pathology research and treatment development, 2) traditional and innovative approaches/techniques used in assessing animal behavior, cognition, and/or other biological readouts. Students are expected to read assigned materials before weekly meetings and participate in discussions. An oral presentation and a written assay are involved in assessment.
objectives: This course is aimed to help students to 1) understand the importance of animal research in science, 2) understand how animal models are applied to human diseases research, including pathology and therapeutic interventions, 3) be able to interpret experiment results and design innovative animal models/approaches.

url: https://selcrs.nsysu.edu.tw/menu5/showoutline.asp?SYEAR=113&SEM=1&CrsDat=ISM748&Crsname=電腦輔助材料力學工程分析
name:
電腦輔助材料力學工程分析
MECHANICS OF MATERIALS USING SOLIDWORKS SIMULATION
description:
《講授類》
網路選課期間先以創新半導體製造所學生修課為優先，外院、電子零組件所及半導體封測所的學生於選課異常處理期間進行紙本加簽選修。
syllabus: Fundamental solid mechanics will be reviewed to instill the basic concepts of structural analysis through finite element analysis. Various types of elements will be introduced, along with their applications in constructing analysis models. The course will illustrate the analysis procedure, including modeling, constrains, analysis execution, and result review. Additionally, this course will cover linear and non-linear analysis, dynamic analysis, and optimization techniques. The commercial software ANSYS will serve as the platform for illustrating and practicing analysis methods.
objectives: Computer simulation has already proven itself as a potent tool, offering a wealth of information and aiding in the design, analysis, and optimization of engineering projects, including the application of digital twin technology. The objective of this course is to equip students with simulation skills that they can apply to their research and work. Fundamental theory of material mechanics is introduced as a background to construct models for analysis using finite element simulation. Practical hands-on experience with simulation software is essential to enable students to practice and develop their capability to analyze engineering cases effectively.

name:
薄膜工程與檢測技術
THIN-FILM ENGINEERING AND CHARACTERIZATION
description:
《講授類》
網路選課期間先以創新半導體製造所學生修課為優先，外院、電子零組件所及半導體封測所的學生於選課異常處理期間進行紙本加簽選修。
syllabus: 尚未輸入 第一章：基本薄膜概論第二章：薄膜製程與應用第三章：薄膜電性檢測與實例第四章：薄膜物化檢測與實例第五章：薄膜光學檢測與實例
objectives: 使課程學生具備基本薄膜備製方法與檢測原理

name:
先進半導體科技
ADVANCED SEMICONDUCTOR TECHNOLOGY
description:
《講授類》
網路選課期間先以創新半導體製造所學生修課為優先，外院、電子零組件所及半導體封測所的學生於選課異常處理期間進行紙本加簽選修。
syllabus: \\140.117.152.55\crs_net_data\crs_outline\1131\outline\ISM775.TXT1. Review of Fundamentals of Semiconductors (6 hrs)2. Introduction to Basic Semiconductor Components (12 hrs)3. Introduction to Novel Semiconductor Devices (12 hrs)4. Microfabrication Technologies (12 hrs)5. Recent Advances in Semiconducting Materials and Devices (6 hrs)
objectives: This course presents the latest developments in semiconducting materials and devices, providing up-to-date information on the science, processes, and applications in the field. Detailed attention is paid to advanced and futuristic materials. In addition, clear explanations are provided of, for example, electron theories, high-field effects, the Hall effect, transit-time effects, drift and diffusion, breakdown mechanisms, equilibrium and transient conditions, switching, and biasing.
